K.'s husband Sovann, 33, works in an organization with a salary of $80 a month. K. sells various kinds of breakfast foods such as rice with pork, porridge, and noodles. She gets up early every morning to prepare the foods she sells. She has gained a lot of customers. Now Konthera is looking for a loan of $300 to buy tables, chairs, and other equipment for her shop. She dreams of having a good house and providing her children with a good education. 

The two other members of the group are: 
H., 51, who has a shop where she serves breakfast foods. She is applying for a loan to renovate her shop. 
S., 34, who is sells groceries. She is looking a loan to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, and other equipment

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
This member of Everlasting Center at Napilan, Sapang Dalaga, Mis. Occidental  is named Anecita  J.. She’s already 37 years old and has been in the Coop for 3 years.
 
Anecita invested a small amount in her "Sari-Sari" (variety) store before she became a Paglaum member. After joining Paglaum, she tried requesting credit services being offered by the Coop in support of her business. Being a single parent of 3 children, she strives to earn a living and has to be tough always, especially in facing obstacles and challenges that come along her way thru life.

She’s grateful to Paglaum because of its financial assistance that enables her "Sari-Sari" store to grow. As a member, she also takes part in training sessions regarding savings and investments, insurance, and how to manage a business. Currently, she is applying for PHP 10,500 to purchase additional groceries for her "Sari-Sari" store. A "sari-sari" store is a small retail store dealing with food and household items such as canned goods, seasonings, toiletries and many others.

Like other parents, she is working hard for her children. She dreams that all of them may complete college courses and have the know-how to earn a living of their own in the future.

loans.use: purchasing additional grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
D., 47, raises pigs from her home as well as working as a local rice farmer. She is a widow and the mother of five children, all of whom are single and most of whom are employed. One of her employed sons' name is Him, 27, and to help meet the family's daily expenses, he carves wood from the forest to sell for income.

D. is applying for a loan to buy a water buffalo for her son use to transport wood for sale.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo

loans.name: 08-Đông Hải Group

texts.vi:
* Nhóm 08 gồm 5 thành viên sống tại thôn Ái Sơn 1 xã Đông Hải,là một thôn nghèo của tỉnh Thanh Hoá .Chị Lê Thị N. làm nhóm trưởng ,năm nay chị 49 tuổi ,hàng ngày ngoài việc đồng áng, chị còn tranh thủ thời gian lên chợ mua hoa quả đi bán rong để có thêm thu nhập.Chồng chị là Trần Văn Năm ,làm ruộng.Gia đình chị có 2 người con , con gái đầu đã có gia đình riêng. Con trai út hiện  chưa có việc làm.Chị đang vay mức tiền là 3.079.800 VNĐ~180USD để đầu tư thêm vốn vào mua trái cây để bán.Các thành viên trong nhóm có cùng mức vay với chị.
* Chị N. Thị Hương vay vốn để mua trái cây về bán.
* Chị N. Thị Huệ vay vốn để mua gà giống về nuôi.
* Chị N. thị Kha vay vốn để mua gà giống về nuôi.
* Chị N. Thị Sen vay vốn để đàu tư vào hàng tạp hoá tại nhà.
texts.en:
Group 08 has five members. They live in Ái Sơn village number 1, Đông Hải commune, a poor village in Thanh Hoá province. Mrs. Lê Thị N., 49 years old, is the group leader. Each day, in addition to working in the rice fields, she spends part of her day going to the market to buy fruit, which she then sells door to door in order to earn some more income. Her husband, Trần Văn Năm, is a rice farmer. They have two children, an older daughter who has already married and a younger son who has not yet left home. Mrs. N. hopes to borrow 3,079,800 VND (~180USD) to invest expanding her fruit sales. The other members of the group are requesting loans of the same amount. Mrs. N. Thị Hương will use her loan to buy fruit which she can resell. Mrs. N. Thị Huệ will use her loan to buy breeding hens. Mrs. N. Thị Kha will use her loan to buy breeding hens. Mrs. N. Thị Sen will use her loan to invest in a small grocery shop she runs from her home.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit sales, breeding hens

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: K., 54, has been earning by a little grocery selling for a long time. She is widowed mother of four children; all four of them are teenagers and attend school. K. works very hard everyday at her business activities and she never wastes time with earning money because she wants to make sure all her children receive the highest education. K. is asking for a loan to purchase additional groceries for sale, and to use the remainder of the loan to repair her old house. The family lives in Kompong Tom Province.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries for sale

loans.name: Soeurng

texts.en:
K. is 46 years old and a resident of Battambong Province. She is a mother of five children; three of them are attending school and the other two are still young. She is married to Pâk, 47, who is a bicycle and motorbike repairer.

K. is a vegetable seller selling potatoes, cucumbers, salad, etc. since 2006. Her business is located in a busy market; hence, K. can earn a good profit from her business. With her very old motorbike, K. gathers her products from the vegetable planters for a bargained price and stores them in her house for her to sell at the market. K. is applying for a loan of $500 to buy a motor to replace the old one and to buy more vegetables for her store. She dreams of having a good living and house, and degrees for her children.

loans.use: To buy a motor to replace the old one and to buy more vegetables for her store

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: N. is 51 years old and sells Khmer desserts for neighbors in the village. She currently earns an income of approximately $2 per day, and has been running the business since 2001. She is widowed and has given birth to five children; three of them are employed and the others are students. They live together in the rural area of Kompong Tom Province. To help with the family's food needs, one of her employed sons sells firewood. N. hopes to buy a cart for her son to use to transport firewood to sell directly at clients' houses; thus, she is applying for a loan to purchase a cart, and will use the remainder of the loan to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase a cart

loans.name: Roeuy

texts.en:
S. is 31 years old and a resident of Battambong Province. She has four children; all of them are single and under her care. She had married to Phat, 36, who is a wedding priest. S. is a vegetable seller selling potatoes, salad, cucumbers etc. She is a responsible mother and neighbor. She has gained a lot of customers from her store because her store is located in the busy market.

S. uses her old motorbike for her business but it is broken very often. S. is applying for a loan of $500 to buy a motor to replace the old one for her and her husband. The loan will help the family have a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy a motor to replace the old one for her and her husband

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita G., 58, a resident of Laligan, Valencia City, is married to Ronald. Her husband was jobless for a year, that's why she earns a living through selling assorted grocery items in their neighborhood. She approached HSPFI and received PHP 5000 as her first loan. Mrs. Lolita is now in need of PHP 8000 to purchase more grocery items for sale in order to increase her business sales and earn more profit.

She hopes to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for sale

loans.name: Nge

texts.en: S., 34, sells Khmer cakes out of her home. She is married to Rith, 33, who earns a living by making charcoal for sale. They are currently responsible for their one child who is still young and attends school. The family's living conditions are not too good because their house is small for them. They have been building a new house for one month, but right now they are lacking the money to pay for the house building, so that is why they have decided to request a loan. The family lives in Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To pay for house building

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana F., a resident of Garang, Tangub City, is married with 4 children. One of her sons is mentally incapacitated since birth. Her husband is a farmer by profession. She received a loan with Pagalum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the amount of Php 5,000 as additional capital for her vegetable vending. She is also a member of another financial institution, but she stopped her membership with said institution and focused on Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She hopes that her business will prosper in the future so that she can send her children to school, and moreover, to give her family a decent life.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables for vending

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: A widow, S. is 41 years old and a resident of Battambong Province. She has three children; all of them are students. She owns a beauty salon in her house. She has a lot of customers for her service because she is a friendly and helpful person. To help meet the family's requirements, she recently wants to increase her income. Then, S. is looking for a loan of US$ 300 to buy more beauty salon equipment for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more beauty salon equipment for her shop

loans.name: Norng

texts.en: S. is 49 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She has three children; all of them are students. She is married to Katha, 48, who owns a set of music instruments that he rents out. S. has been selling sausages to the villagers in front of her house since 2006. She is good at making a tasty spicy sauce for her customers so that she can earn a better profit. At the family's proposal, S. is looking for a loan of US$ 600 to buy more music instruments for her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy more music instruments for her husband's rental business

loans.name: Tat

texts.en:
R. is 48 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She has three children: one is single and works as a local construction worker, and the other two are married and live separately. R. is married to Run, 49, who is a local palm climber.

R. is well-known for being a responsible mother and neighbor; she works hard. The villagers always come to her field to buy her vegetables because R. doesn't use any chemical fertilizer in her field. And so she had gained better savings.

Recently, R. is looking for a loan of US$ 1000 to buy a motor for her and her family. The loan will help the family have more updated living standards. R. was not available for the photograph so her husband is in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy a motor for her and her family

loans.name: Pigy Lestari Group

texts.id:
Kelompok Pigy Lestari yang semuanya beranggotakan ibu-ibu yang tekun dalam menjalankan usaha beternak babi walaupun masih dalam skala kecil sudah menjalin kerjasama dengan Dinari dalam permodalan usaha dan mendapat banyak manfaat yang baik dari kerja sama ini. Usaha yang sebelumnya hanya dikelola dengan sangat sederhana karena dana yang terbatas sudah mulai bisa dikembangkan dan mereka mendapat hasil yang lebih baik daripada sebelumnya khususnya dalam keuntungan usaha yang diperoleh sebelumnya Rp 300.000,- sampai Rp 400.000,- kini bisa mencapi Rp 500.000,- perekor karena kualitas ternak makin baik..  
Pada pinjaman pertama kelompok Pigy Lestari yang diketuai oleh Ni Komang Ratiani beranggotakan 11 orang namun kini 6 orang diantaranya sudah mulai bisa mandiri dalam permodalan dan memutuskan untuk berhenti dari keanggotaan kelompok. Sekarang anggota kelompok tinggal 6 orang dengan penambahan 1 orang anggota baru. Kelompok Pigy Lestari mengikuti program ternak babi yang dikelola Yayasan Dinari dengan jangka waktu enam bulan dan pelunasan dilakukan  pada akhir periode
texts.en:
Pigy Lestari group consists of housewives who own small scale pig farms. The group works together with DINARI to obtain training and funding, and the group has reaped a lot of rewards from the cooperation. In the past, the businesses were managed in simple traditional manner due to limited funding. With DINARI's help, the group managed to grow its businesses and profitability, increasing its profit from $25-32, to $43 per pig due to improving quality. When the group applied for its first loan, it had 11 members. Currently, 6 of those members managed to set up their own farms and exited the group. Now the group has 6 members, with 1 new member. Te Pigy Lestari group is applying to join DINARI's pig farming program managed by DINARI foundation, and seeking a 6 month loan.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy piglets and it's feed

loans.name: Mohammad Nayam

texts.en: M. nayam lives in Kabul Afghanistan. He is married with three children. M. nayam wants to receive a loan for his general store which he wants to enlarge. He is requesting an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 11 months  to buy the necessary materials for his shop to complete his stock. M. nayam wants to thank both  Kiva and AFSG for this loan process in Afghanistan  that helps poor people.

loans.use: To complete his stock by buying the necessary materials for his shop

loans.name: Ni Komang Wiriasih

texts.id:
Sebagai seorang pedagang Kakao , Musim hujan merupakan kendala utama dalam menjalankan usaha ini , Disamping hasil panen petani yang turun hingga 80 % juga hasil yang ada kwalitasnya juga kurang baik .Hingga tak jarang banyak pedagang kakau yang mengisi waktunya dengan berjualan buah-buhan yang lagi musiman. Demikian juga halnya yang dilakukan oleh Ni Komang Wiriasih . Istri dari I Komang suarya ini  disamping mencari /membeli kakao juga memanfaatkan modal yang ada dengan berjualan Rambutan dan Durian yang saat ini lagi musimnya, hasil yang di dapat cukup lumayan untuk menambah biaya keperluan di dapur. Ni Komang Wiriasih Telah Menyelesaikan Pinjaman tahap Keduanya Yaitu Rp 5.000.000,-dan Bermaksud meminjam lagi untuk tahap ketiga dengan Nilai yang lebih Kecil Yaitu Rp 1.000.000,-yang akan di pergunakan untuk modal membeli barang dagangan buah-buahan .   
Dengan tambahan modal ini Wiriasih berharap bisa membeli barang Petani dan memperoleh keuntungan sambil menunggu musim kemarau dimana musim kakao kembali ramai.
texts.en:
The rainy monsoon season is a challenge for cocoa trade as it decreases the farmers' productivity up to 80% and it also reduces the produce quality. This motivates a lot of cocoa traders like Ni Komang Wiriasih to seek side businesses, such as selling seasonal fruits. Ni Komang Wiriasih is married to I Komang Suarya. Besides selling cocoa, she also trades Rambutan and Durian that is in season during the rainy season. The profit is sufficient to supplement her income to pay for daily expenses. Ni Komang Wiriasih just paid back her second loan of $500, and is applying for another loan for $92 that will be used to purchase more fruits. With this additional funding, Wiriasih hopes to purchase more produce from farmers and reap more profit until the summer when cocoa season peaks.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more cacao

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en: Araceli G. is a resident of Barangay I, Tangub City and a widow with 5 children. She started her business, a sari-sari store, with a capital investment of Php 1,000.00. She become a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and she is now requesting a loan amounting to Php 5,000.00 to purchase additional goods for her sari-sari store. This is her second loan with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She hopes that her business will grow larger and become a mini-mart. She also hopes to live a decent life in the future.

loans.use: Purchase additional goods for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru: Исматов Хикматулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 28 лет , женат и имеет одного ребенка. Уже восемь лет занимается торговлей. Торгует продуктами питания на центральном рынке. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы уевличить товарооборот. Это даст возможность привлечь новых клиентов и увеличить доходы. Таким образом жизнь улучшиться. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hikmatullo I. lives in Gissar. He is 28 years old and is married with one child. He has worked ini sales for the past eight years. He sells groceries at the central market. Hikmatullo would like to obtain a loan in order to increase cash flow. This would allow attracting new customers, bring more profit and improve his family's life. Hikmatullo plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sueli

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Sueli  semakin semangat dan gesit dalam mengembangkan usaha warungnya, warung makanan ( Menjual gado-gado, es dan makanan ringan  )miliknya kini semakin ramai di kunjungi pembeli . Untung yang di dapatpun kian meningkat hal ini tak terlepas dari bantuan pinjaman dana yang di peroleh dari Kiva melaluiYayasan  Dinari. Peranan Ni Wayan Suweli yang dibantu oleh anak perempuanya dalam mengelola warung ini juga sangat mempengaruhi perkembang dari usaha ini.Pagi tat kala Ni wayan Suweli pergi mencari dagangan ke pasar induk di Negara, Anak perempuanya dengan setia menunggui warung sampai Ibunya balik dari pasar. Begitu juga sore harinya disaat Ni Wayan Suweli mengerjakan pekerjaan rumah tangga kembali giliran anak perempuannya yang jaga warung, begitu seterusnya. Sehingga warungnya selalu buka tiap hari. 
      Dengan keuntungan yang di dapat oleh Ni wayan Suweli cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari –hari keluarga bahkan sebagian di pergunakan sebagai modal , sehingga Ni wayan Suweli bisa mengurangi jumblah pinjaman dari 2 Juta Menjadi 1 Juta Rupiah Di Perioda Ketiga ini , yang rencananya akan di Pergunakan Untuk membeli mesin Kulkas untuk membuat es,dan menyimpan sayur mayur yang masih sisa sehingga tidak cepat rusak.    Dengan begitu Ni Wayan suweli bisa menekan kerugian dari barang dagangan yang cepat busuk. Dan yang terpenting Adalah bisa Meningkatkan keuntungan yang di peroleh.
texts.en:
Ni Wayan Sueli is very motivated in growing her small food vending business. She sells gado-gado (Indonesian Salad), ice, and other snacks. As her client base increases, so is her profit. She was assisted by an earlier loan from Kiva and DINARI foundation. Ni Wayan Sueli is helped by her daughter in managing the kiosk. In the morning, when Ni Wayan Sueli goes to the market to purchase foods to sell, her daughter takes care of the kiosk until her mother comes back. Also in the evenings, when Ni Wayan Sueli is performing her household chores, her daughter also take care of the kiosk. Therefore the kiosk can remain open longer during the day. With the profit, Ni Wayan Sueli managed to fulfill her daily family needs and pay down her loan from $200 to $100. In this third period, Ni Wayan Sueli plans to use the loan to purchase a refrigerator to make ice, keep vegetables and perishable items. Hopefully she can improve her business profitability with the improvements.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more refrigerator

loans.name: Gatey

texts.en:
Gatey Z. is married.  She lives with her family and has a beading business. She has been involved in this business for a long time. She got her first-cycle loan and used it to improve her business. Now Gatey plans to enlarge her business and wants to take out her second-cycle loan. Therefore she has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghanis with a term of 11 months to enlarge her shop,  complete her stock and change the design of the beading. 
Gatey has plans to open another beading shop within the next 5 years. She tries her best with her income. She wants to say that without this loan it would be impossible to have a successful beading business.

loans.use: To enlarge and improve her beading business

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.ru: Норов Саъдулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 35 лет. Женат и имеет троих детей. Имеет микроавтобус , который испольпользует для перевозки пассажиров. Сейчас хочет сделать ремонт своей автомашины, для чего и запрашивает кредит. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sadullo N. lives in Gissar. He is 35 years old and is married with three children. He has a minivan which he uses as a taxi. Sadullo is applying for a loan in order to do car maintenance. He would be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: car maintenance

loans.name: Girah

texts.id:
Pada periode ke dua Pinjaman dipergunakan untuk melanjutkan usaha warungnya yang terletal diaeral Dermaga ikan pengambengan.Usaha warung sudah diekuni sejak lama dan pelangganpun sudah ada.Girah menfaatkan keramain dermaga dengan membuka warung makanan. Pelanggannnya adalah para awak kapal yang baru pulang dari berlabuh setelah semalaman mencari ikan dilaut.

Untuk menjalan usaha ini girah harus berjualan selama 24 jam nonstop,sebab warung terletak di daerah dermaga. Asbullah suaminya tetap menemani Girah di warungnya siang dan malam sekaliyan berjualan bensin didepan warungnya.Semua kegiatan untuk menjalan usaha baik memasak dan istirahat dapat dilakukan diwarungnya.Keuntunagn bersih dalam setiap harinya mencapai Rp.50.00 s/d Rp.100.000,-. Hasil dari keuletan inilah Girah dapat memperbaiki warung sehingga layak untuk ditempati.
texts.en:
Girah plans to use this second loan to continue her food kiosk business. The kiosk lies in Pengambengan fishing pier. She has been running this business for years with steady client base who are mostly sailors and fishermen coming back from night at sea to fish. Girah needs to run the business 24 hours non stop to keep up with her sailor clients hour. Asbullah, her husband accompanies her in her kiosk night and day. He also sells diesel fuel in front of Girah's kiosk. They also live in the kiosk. The kiosk earns about $5-10 profit per day. She plans to repair the kiosk to improve her living condition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair kiosk

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Норов Абдулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Возратс 33 года , женат и имеет двоих детей. Имеет высшее образование, по специальности учитель. Работает на центральном рынке района. Имеет небольшой грузовой автомобиль , который использует в качестве такси. Кредит планирует получить для ремонта автомашины. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdullo N. lives in Gissar. He is 33 years old and is married with two children. He has a university degree and is a teacher by training. He works at the central market as a taxi driver in a small truck that he uses as a taxi. He is applying for a loan in order to do car maintenance. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: car maintenance

loans.name: Leuk

texts.en: N. is 27 years old and has been earning money by selling vegetables for more than three years. She currently lives with a small family that is made up of three members, in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. N. is married to Mr. Yun, 30, who runs a small-sized workshop next to his house, providing a service as a motorcycle washer. N. now has one child who is a minor. The family is facing difficulties with transportation, as they need to pay high taxi expenses; therefore, N. would like to ask for a $900 loan to buy a motorcycle for the family's riding needs. (N.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for the family's riding needs

loans.name: Sahriati

texts.id:
Warung makanan yang dikelola Sahriati setiap pagi mulai pukul 03.00 Sudah mulai ramai karena para nelayan yang sudah berlabuh mencari ikan sudah mulai datang untuk mulai makan dan minum.Walauun masih tergolong tergolong sederhana,namun itulah yang menjadi usaha yang menjadisumber penghasilan.Suaminya tidak mempunyai pekerjaan tetap sehingga dapat senantiasa membatu sahriati apabila diperlukan.

Pinjaman Modal usahayang diberiakan oleh Yayasan DINARI untuk yang kedua kalinya dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya yaitu untuk berbelanja segala keperluan usaha warung makannya.Untuk berbelaja kebutuhan masakanya dilakukan setiap hari dipasar,berbelanja makan ringan  biasanya dilakukan dalam satu minggu dua kali. Kentungan bersih dalam sehari mencapai Rp.100.000  jika situasi sedang ramai terutama pada musim banyak ikan di dermaga.
texts.en:
Sahriati opens her food kiosk at 3 am in the morning. It is already busy at early hours in the morning, as sailors and fishermen comes back from night at sea to have breakfast. The kiosk is simple, but it is Sahriati's only income source. Her husband does not have steady job, so he can help Sahriati when needed. She is applying for second business loan from DINARI to increase her working capital to purchase more ingredients. She purchases ingredients from the market daily. She earns profit about $10 per day in peak fishing season.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Capital

loans.name: Zamda

texts.en:
Zamda has been a bread and fish seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 5 years. She belongs to the Wapendanao group loan (Group code 2008). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more sugar, flour, oil and fish for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Zamda is 37 years old, divorced, and has three children: ages 20, 15 and 10.

loans.use: To buy more fish, sugar, flour and oil for her business.

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.ru: Норов Нурулло проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст 47 лет , женат и имеет шестерых детей. Имеет средне-техническое образование. По профессии водитель. Работает частным таксистом. Таким образом и обеспечивает свою семью. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы сделать ремонт автомашины.Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nurullo N. lives in Gissar. He is 47 years old and is married with six children. He has technical education and is a driver by training. He provides for his family by driving a taxi. He is applying for a 12-month loan that would allow him to fix his car.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: car maintenance

loans.name: Tak

texts.en:
Mrs.Tak S. was born in 1982 and makes a living raising pigs. She also makes and sells cakes from her home. She is married and the mother of two children, who are still young and enrolled in the local school. Her husband's name is Tonh, 31 and he is a truck driver. Tonh owes a truck for transporting earth and soil. He provides this service to the village, which earns him an income of about $9 a day. The family lives in Siem Reap Province. 

Tak S. is asking for a $1200 loan to start a new business as a grocery seller. She will use the loan to build the grocery store, buy a stock of groceries for resale and use the remainder of the loan for her husband's business. Tak S.'s husband appears in the picture because she was not available.

loans.use: To build a grocery store and buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Ibodatoi

texts.ru:
Каримова Ибодатой проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 63 года, замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Торгует на центральном рынке. Торгует хлопковым маслом. Завозит товар из города Турсун-Заде. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 20 лет. Теперь планирует  получить кредит и увеличить товаролоборот. Это необходимо сделать так как 
 спрос на ее продукцию растет  и она не успевает обеспечить всех клиентов. Это поможет ей привлечь много новых клиентов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ibodatoi K. lives in Gissar. She is 63 years old and is married with six children. She sells cotton oil at the central market. She brings cotton oil from Tursunzade. She has been in this business for 20 years, and she would like to get a loan for increasing cash flow. This is necessary because at the moment she does not manage to satisfy the growing demand for cotton oil. A loan would also allow her to attract new customers. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma owns a small decoration items shop in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to the Furaha group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $25. She works at her business every day. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more decoration items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwajuma is 29 years old, widowed, and has three children: ages 9, 6 and 3.

loans.use: To buy more decorations items for her business.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma has owned a small charcoal store in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She belongs to the Tusife Moyo group loan (Group code 2051). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day, she works at her business for 7 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Fatma is 30 years old, married, and has three children: ages 15, 8 and 4.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Mursal

texts.ru: Давлатов Мурсал проживает в Гиссарском районе. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Возраст 34 года. Уже 12 лет занимается торговлей. Торгует овощами и фруктами. Кредит планирует использовать для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mursal D. lives in Gissar. He is 34 years old and is married with four children. He has been in sales for 12 years. He sells produce and is applying for a loan in order to increase cash flow. He would pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Vat

texts.en: Mr. Vat V. is 52 years old. He has a battery charging machine and provides a battery charge service for the village. He started his business in 2005 and earns an average income of $5 per day. To help meet the family's foods need, his wife grows vegetables and sells groceries. The couple currently live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. They have two children who are married and live away from the family home. V. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for family transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle for family transportation

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom K. lives in Doem Roes village in Kandal province. She is a pig breeder. However, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to build a piggery for her breeding. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers and cement to build the piggery. Mrs. Mom K. is 52 years old and a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy timbers and cement to build a piggery

loans.name: Chroeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Chroeurn H. is a farmer in Thorm Ney village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land used to cultivate rice. Additionally, she sells water lillies. Her husband, Mr. Man Sokhorn, is a construction worker. Even though they try to work hard, they earn less income than they need to support their household. Mrs. Chroeurn H. is applying for a loan to buy a piglet for breeding and to buy fertilizer to increase her crops. She is 30 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school. The others are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a piglet for breeding and to buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Roquela

texts.en: Mrs. Raquela N., in her mid-40's, operates a grocery store in Palacapao where, with her own money as capital plus financial assistance from HSPFI, she has been able  to sustain the business.  Her husband is a habal-habal (motorcyle transport) driver, but the family income is insufficient to meet the daily needs of their children. Raquela is now requesting a loan of PHP 20000 to purchase grocery items for the store and  somehow meet the needs of the family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery Items for the business.

loans.name: Ruhzora

texts.ru:
Гуломшоева Рухзора 23 года, не замужем. Она помогает  родителям личным вкладом в семейно-бытовые расходы. Также помощница матери по продаже посуд. Они торгуют на рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе посудами: тарелки, чайники, сервисные наборы, подарочными наборами... Продаваемые  товары являются необходимыми в повседневной жизни. У них много клиентов. Сама Рухзора имеет высшее образование. Закупают они товар у поставщиков из Китая.
        Для увеличения ассортимента и товарооборота, то есть закупа сервисных наборов хочет получить займ в   сумме 3500 сомони.
texts.en:
Ruhzora G. is 23 years old, she is not married. She helps her parents and doing her part by taking on the household expenses. She also helps her mother to sell china. They sell china on the Korvon market in Dushanbe which include plates, teapots, whole dining sets as well as gift sets. These items are the necessities of every day life. They have many clients. Ruhzora herself has a high education. They purchase the merchandise from suppliers from China.
To increase the assortment of their inventory and commodity circulation they want to get a loan for 3500 somoni (US$950) to buy more dining sets.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dining sets

loans.name: Sa Aem

texts.en: Mrs. Sa Aem S. is a villager in Pich Entrea village in Takeo province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Deib Siha, is a firewood seller. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sa Aem S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more firewood to resell to earn more profit. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children; one attends the local school and the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to resell

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan, requested by four borrowers, all of them live in Chong Kneas Commune in Siem Reap Province. Mr. O., 39, has been selected to be leader by the group members. O. and his wife currently earn a living by catching fish which they sell at the local market. They get up early, before light, every  morning and start fishing. They livelihood depend O. catching fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake, which is their main fishing ground. O. is unable to catch maN. fish  as his his fishing equipment is often broken. Therefore, he is asking for a loan to buy more fishing equipment. 
The other three borrowers are: 
T. is a widow, age 64, who earns a living catching fish for sale. She needs a loan to buy nets for fishing..
N., 48, catches fish to sell, with her husband and she requests a loan to buy more fishing equipment.
S., 20, catches fish for a living and she has applied for a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To buy more fishing equipment

loans.name: Natt

texts.en:
Mrs. Natt T., a resident of Kraing Raung village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who earns a small income growing rice. Her husband, Mr. Keo Pros, is a construction worker who also sells motorbikes locally. Since the latter business is going well, he wants to expand it by purchasing two more motorbikes, and so Natt is requesting a loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Natt T. is 41 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two more motorbikes for her husband to resell.

loans.name: Von

texts.en: Mrs. Von T. was born in 1957 and she now lives in Talok Cheoung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sdeung Chorn, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice to earn their living. Mrs. Von T. has a child who makes doors, windows, beds and so on. Since this business is going well, Mrs. Von T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more lumber for her child's business. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more lumber for her child's business

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: L., 30, has been fishing in and around Tunle Sap Lake for a long time. He earns on average $2 per day. He is married to Rom, age 29, who works with him in the fishing business. The couple have three children. All three are teenagers attending school, and they live together in Siem Reap Province. L. presently faces a problem in that his fishing equipment often has broken. Therefore, he is applying for a loan in order to buy additional fish equipment like nets and traps, to supply his business operation.

loans.use: To buy additional fish equipment

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian P., 40, separated with 2 children, lives in Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City, Southern Philippines. Everyday, she strives hard to support for the needs of her children. At young age, she started to support herself and lived on her own because her parents were separated and could not provide their daily needs.  Currently, she is into home service manicure and pedicure and also tends a variety store. She wishes to expand her expertise that’s why she wants to engage into hair cutting and dressing. This would be her 2nd loan with HSPFI amounting to PHP 8,000 to purchase the materials needed for her new business. Someday, she dreamed of having her own beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase materials for hair cutting and dressing

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and millet for making porridge

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.ru: Юсупов Mухамад проживает в Гиссарском районге. Возраст 50 лет. Женат и имеет четверых детей.  Жена нигде не работает. Сам он работает сварщиком . Имеет точку  на рынке. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы закупить метал , для работы. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhammad U. lives in Gissar. He is 50 years old and is married with four children. His wide is unemployed. Muhammad works as a welder. He has a welding point at the market. He is applying for a loan in order to be able to puchase welding materials. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: welding materials

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Mrs. Susan B. hails from the province of Antique. She is blessed with three children. She is married to a driver of delivery van and which also serves as their service vehicle when going to the market.

She is requesting an amount of PHP15,000 as additional capital for her variety store. She was started the variety store when ASHI gave her an initial capital. The income generated from her business is a great help for her to meet family expenses.
	
She dreams that her children will finish their studies and her variety store will become a mini-mart someday.

loans.use: To be used as additional working capital for her variety store.

loans.name: Sha  Gull Group

texts.en:
Sha gull is the group leader of the Sha gull group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to take a loan for their own business. The total amount of their group loan is 58,800 Afghani for the term of 11 months.
Nafesa wants to take a loan for her husband’s repair shop. bibi gull wants to take a loan for her son’s general store. Rana wants to take a loan for her husband's mechanic business and Sha gull wants to take a loan for her husband's business as a taxi driver. Their want to buy necessary materials for their businesses. 
They are confident that with the money they receive can have a good profit and can run their business in a good way. These women are happy about the loan process and want to say that it will support the entrepreneurs a lot.

loans.use: They want to buy the necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.ru: Алимардонов Искандар проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст 51 год. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет средне-специальное образование. Попрофессии водитель. Но зарабатывает путем животноводства. Закупает молодых бычков , которых перепродает на рынках , после откормки. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Iskandar A. lives in the Gissar district. He is 51 years old, married, and has four children. He completed vocational secondary school. He is a professional driver but actually makes his living in animal husbandry. He buys young bull calves which he sells at markets after fattening them. He is applying for a loan to expand his herd of livestock. He can repay the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding livestock herd

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
S. is a widow, age 45. She and her 4 children live in Siem Reap province. She earns a living by raising and selling pigs. The pigs are raised in a stall next to her house. As another source of income, she grows vegetables on farmland that she owns.

Three of S.'s children are employed and their contributions help feed the family. Two children are construction workers, and the other one sells firewood. Sreiheand recently sold all her pigs to the slaughterer. She plans to use the loan to buy another pig and a cow to raise.

loans.use: Buy piglets and a cow to raise

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en: Hilario P., 43 years of age, married, is a resident of Kiburiao, Quezon, Bukidnon .He is an active entrepreneur for a long time. He started his business after he inherited some inventory from his parents.  Since then, the business gradually increased  with the help of HSPFI as business partner.  He needs a loan of P20,000 to purchase stocks in volume to avail more discounts from his suppliers.  Mr. P. wants to expand his business from being retailer to being a wholesaler in the village.

loans.use: To purchase volume of stocks for sale

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Mrs. Eang L. is a farmer in Krodass village in Kampong Cham province. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because her field is infertile. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Nhoem Phang, is a rice miller who owns a rice mill. Mrs. Eang L. is a 31-year-old mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du  groupe Badenya sont au nombre de dix femmes toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans,  4 enfants et vivent en majorité dans des familles monogames dans le quartier Bozo kin de Sansanding (4ème région administrative de la république du Mali.).
Elles exercent essentiellement le commerce de poissons  sous diverses formes : frais, fumé, séché et de condiments alimentaires. 
C’est le souci d’accroître leur fonds de commerce qui les a amené à s’organiser et rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt solidaire. Le premier fut correctement bien remboursé.
Ce prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter, 2 bidons de 20 litres d’huile de coton ou d’arachide, 4 paniers de tomate fraîche, une tonne d’oignon frais, 3 bassines de poivron et piment frais, 300kg de poisson fumé et de sardines séchées. Elles se ravitaillent une fois par semaine à la foire de Sansanding en légumes,  huile et en poisson à Macina. Les poissons sont revendus dans les foires de Siribala, Dougabougou et sur place à Sansanding ; les autres condiments sont écoulés à domicile et dans le marché de Sansanding au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel moyen de 19.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter leurs fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Badenya group number 10 married women. They have an average age of 33 and, on average, 4 children, and they live mostly in monogamous families in the Bozo Kin neighborhood of Sansanding (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They mostly sell fish in diverse forms (fresh, smoked, dried) and also condiments. The need to grow their working capital led them to organize themselves and join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their second group loan. The first was correctly reimbursed.

This loan will be used to buy 2 jerry cans of 20 liters of cottonseed or peanut oil, 4 baskets of fresh tomatoes, a ton of fresh onions, 3 basins of green peppers and fresh hot peppers, 300 kg of smoked fish and some dried sardines. They do their buying once a week at the fair of Sansanding as far as vegetables go; their oil and fish are from Macina. The fish are re-sold at the fairs in Siribala, Dougabougou and right there in Sansanding; the other condiments are sold from their homes and in the market of Sansanding for cash or credit to a clientele essentially constituted of women.

They hope to make a monthly average profit of 19,000 F CFA which will be used to increase their working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fish and condiments

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi A. is a young and energetic man who has been caring for his elder mother since his father passed away a year ago. At 23 years old, he operates a small grocery store where he sells products like rice, canned foods, drinks, among other things.

Fadi is asking for a US$1000 loan to purchase more groceries to meet the increasing demand of his costumers. He is excited about this loan and would like to thank everyone for their trust and support

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita C., 40, married, is a residnet of  Laligan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is engaged in fish vending for the past two years.  Her business started with a small amount of money she borrowed from her relatives. Later, she was  able to access  a loan from HSPFI.  Mercedita needs additiona capital amounting to  PHP11,000 to increase the volume of her sales. She aspires to become a rice trader and a soft-drink dealer in the future.

loans.use: To purchase  fish  for  sale.

loans.name: Yèrèma Horonya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Yèrèma horonya est composé de quatre  femmes ayant 32 ans et 3 enfants en moyenne ; toutes mariées dans des familles polygamiques, elles vivent  dans le quartier Bozo kin de Sansanding (4ème région administrative du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de voisinage et font le commerce de poisson frais, fumé, séché et de lait. 
Afin d’augmenter  leur fonds de commerce, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles  sont à leur 1ier prêt de groupe (prêt solidaire).  
Elles comptent  utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 82 kg de poisson fumé et 333 litres de lait frais dont une partie est fermentée et vendue sous forme de  yaourt et de  lait caillé d’où elle extrait du beurre frais. Elles se ravitaillent en poisson à la foire hebdomadaire de Macina et en lait quotidiennement dans les  hameaux peulhs (foula wèrè) des villages environnants de Sansanding. Les poissons sont revendus dans les foires de  Dibougou, Siribala, Dougabougou, Dia et sur place à Sansanding ;  le lait est vendu tous les jours à domicile, dans les quartiers et au  marché de Sansanding le jour de foire au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle   composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel moyen de 16.400FCFA.qui servira à aider les époux à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Yèrèma Horonya is a group composed of four women, all married, who average 32 years of age and 3 children. They live in polygamous families in the Bozo Kin district of Sansanding (fourth region of the Republic of Mali). They came to know one another through ties of marriage and community and do commerce in milk and in fresh fish, as well as smoked and dried fish.

In order to augment their working capital, they decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their first group loan (solidarity loan). They plan to use this loan to buy 82 kg of smoked fish and 333 liters of fresh milk, part of which is fermented and sold as yoghurt or as curdled milk, from which they extract fresh butter.

The group members get supplies of fish as the weekly fair in Macina; the milk is gotten daily in the Fulani hamlets (Foula wèrè) among the surrounding villages of Sansanding. The fish is resold at the fairs in Dibougou, Siribala, Dougabougou, and Dia, and locally in Sansanding; the milk is sold all the time from home, in the area, and at the Sansanding marketplace on market day, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of men, women, and children.

The women envision realizing an average monthly profit of 16,400 francs CFA that will serve to assist the husbands in covering family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy smoked fish and milk

loans.name: Khai

texts.en: Mrs. Khai M. is a villager in Pnao Koeurt village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a laborer in the local village. Even though she tries to work hard, she still doesn't earn enough income to support her family. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a piece of land to cultivate more  rice to earn more income. Mrs. Khai M. is 54 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Jessica's Group

texts.en:
Jessica is a super entrepreneur. Her main business is a drugstore that she has operated for 15 years. In addition, she owns four other businesses including a hair salon, a motorcycle rental shop, a farm, and a rental business for commercial houses. Her extraordinary business ambition is matched only by her extraordinary responsibilities that include caring for her own 10 children and caring for another 30 orphans from her late sisters and brothers. Every month, she takes all her children to a farm where they assist in growing crops. The proceeds from selling these crops help pay fees for their school and medical care.

Jessica aspires to open an additional retail shop to be operated by her mother and to expand her recently opened motorcycle rental shop. She is asking for a loan to finish the construction of additional rental properties.

loans.use: Construction of rental properties

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: At 40, Lanie Z. strives hard to send her three children to school and provide them with their needs.Her husband Edwin Z., earns PHP120 per day as an auto-mechanic in their vulcanizing.  With her initial capital and loans extended by HSPFI, she purchased some motorcycle and bicycle parts for their shop. Lanie also retails gasoline in her vulcanizing shop. She need an additional capital of PHP 15,000 to expand her business. She hopes that someday she can open another shop.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle and bicycle  parts and gasoline for retail

loans.name: Yèrèdon Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf  femmes du  groupe Yèrèdon sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogamiques à l’exception d’une seule. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans,  3 enfants et vivent toutes  dans le quartier Bozo kin de Sansanding (4ème région administrative du Mali).
 Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et dans la foire de Macina où elles se ravitaillent toutes en poisson.
Afin d’accroître leur fonds de commerce et de satisfaire la demande  de plus en plus forte de la clientèle, elle ont décidé de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire.
Ce prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter,  10 paniers de tomate fraîche, 1,5 tonne d’oignon frais, 5 bassines de poivron et de piment frais, 600kg de poisson fumé et de sardines séchées. Elles se ravitaillent une fois par semaine à la foire de Sansanding en légumes. Quant aux poissons à Macina. Les poissons sont revendus dans les foires de Siribala, Dougabougou et sur place à Sansanding ; les autres condiments sont écoulés à domicile et dans le marché de Sansanding au comptant à crédit et en détail à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel moyen de 33.000FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
NB : Bana T. est absente sur la photo. Elle a accouché à la veille du financement d’où la présence de 8 femmes au lieu de 9.
texts.en:
The nine women of the Yèrèdon group are all married and live in monogamous families, except for one. They have an average age of 35 and on average, 3 children; they all live in the Bozo Kin neighborhood of Sansanding (fourth administrative region of Mali).

They met because of bonds of marriage, of being neighbors, and at the market of Macina where they all go to buy their fish.

So as to grow their working capital and satisfy the ever-growing demand of their clientele, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their 3 group loan.

This loan will be used to buy 10 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 1.5 tons of fresh onions, 5 basins of green peppers and fresh hot peppers, 600 kg of smoked fish and dried sardines. They do their buying once a week at the fair of Sansanding as far as vegetables go. As for the fish: in Macina. The fish are re-sold in the fairs of Siribala, Dougabougou, and right there in Sansanding; the other condiments are sold at home and in the market of Sansanding for cash or credit and retail to a clientele essentially composed of women.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 33,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and for family expenses.

NB : Bana T. is absent from the photo. She gave birth the day before the photo was taken, so there are 8 women instead of 9.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments and fish

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Chhem U., 39, is a local poultry seller, as well as a distiller of Khmer wine which she also sells. She has been running these businesses since 2000, and currently earning approximately $3 per day. She is married to Mr. Sharon, 44, who earns a daily income by selling firewood. Chhem U.'s husband has always collected the firewood from a people that cut trees in the forest and he stocks supplies of firewood for resale. The couple has four children who are students. Chhem U. is asking for a $1000 loan to buy additional poultry to raise and use the remainer of the loan for her husband to expand his firewood business.

loans.use: To buy some poultry to raise

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap U. is a villager in Siem Bauy village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she has an obstacle because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on their crop. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. She would use the rest of the loan to purchase rice for her family to eat. Her husband, Mr. Yin Muong, is a rice miller. Mrs. Siopheap U. is a 35-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her field

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Грезова Мархабо проживает в районе Варзоб. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Возраст 33 года. Имеет высшее образование . По профессии врач-гинеколог. Планирует получить кредит для покупки гинекологического кресла. Это даст возможность создать условия для работы в поликлинике. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Marhabo G. lives in Varzob. She is 33 years old and is married with two children. She has a university diploma in Obstetrics and Gynaecology. She would like to get a loan for buying a gynecological examination chair. This would improve working conditions at the polyclinic. Marhabo would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a gynecological examination chair

loans.name: Loem

texts.en: P.. a 61-year-old a resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, makes a living growing corn. She is the widowed mother of two children, one married and one single, both employed. Her single child also helps her in growing corn. To earn more income, P. is requesting a loan of $100 to purchase chickens and piglets to raise and some fertilizer for her crop.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Maisara

texts.ru: Бурханова Майсара проживает в Варзобском районе. Возраст 27 лет. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Работает на рынке "Баракат", где торгует продуктами питания:маслом и рисом. Товар привозит из города Турсун-Заде. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить  товар и таким образом запастись. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Maisara B. lives in the Varzob region. She is 27 years old and is married with two children. She sells oil and rice at the Barakat market. She brings the products from Tursunzade. Maisara plans to use the loan for stocking products. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Regina Nantaba Group

texts.en:
Regina N., 48, is the group leader for 5 members; she is a widow and she does not get any assistance from anyone else. She has children aged between 9 and 23 years old. Regina rents a one-roomed house where she stays with her children; she has access to electricity and piped water. She does not care for additional family members, and she normally has one meal a day.

Regina is a tailor and she mainly tailors "gomeses" (Ugandan traditional wear) and school uniforms. She rents a shop where she tailors her clothes and she works six days a week. She normally sews about 3 "gomeses" a day and her customers are mainly women and children. She normally sews materials that customers bring to her, charging them labour costs. And she has done this particular type of business for over 25 years now.

The problem she faces in her business is that of competition; there are many tailors around the place she tailors from. And also her clients normally come seasonally, for example, when schools are opening for the term.

Regina has been a client of MCDT for over 8 years now and she is servicing her 13th loan. The reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because of the timely loans; she has worked with her group for 8 years now . With this next loan, she wants to buy materials to sell to her customers. She will also use part of it to pay tuition for her children.

Regina wants one day to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: buy fabrics for sale

loans.name: Ukombozi Group

texts.en:
Cathrina has been a clothes seller (vitenge and bed sheets) in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 8 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more bed sheets and vitenge for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Cathrina is 42 years old, divorced, and has two children: ages 24 and 21. She also cares for three additional dependants. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mareciana and Maria. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (bed sheets and vitenge) for her business.

loans.name: Shokir

texts.ru: Тупалангов Шокир проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 26 лет. Уже пять лет он занимается животноводством. Он не женат , но живет с родителями и семьей брата.Семья большая и поэтому ему приходится много работать для того, чтобы полностью обеспечить своих близких. Поэтому теперь он сможет получит кердит и увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shokir T. lives in Shahrinau. He is 26 years old and is single. He lives with his parents and his brother's family. The family is large, and Shokir needs to work hard. For the past five years he has been involved in livestock breeding. He would like to get a loan to purchase more livestock. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Rak

texts.en: Mrs. Rak C. is a villager in Bort Tonle village in Kampong Cham province. She sells fruit and palm sugar. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates yams. She faces a problem because she does not have enough money to cultivate yams on the field. Thus, Mrs. Rak C. decided to ask for a loan to grow yams to earn income. She is a 35-year-old widow with two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: to grow yams to earn income

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam has been a bites (bread and maandazi) seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to the Nia Moja group loan (Group code 2011). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. Every day she works at her business from 7:15 a.m. She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more flour and cooking oil for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Maryam is 34 years old, married, and has one child.

loans.use: To buy more flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Life has been a constant struggle for Christina T.. At the age of 33, she helps raise her 6 children with her husband Roberto T.. With HSPFI assistance, she was granted a loan of PHP 8000 and she started doing business. Every morning, she wakes up early to purchase fish at the market for retail and display it in her small store. As of now, she is planning to fill her store with several lines of products like school and office supplies and several grocery items. Therefore, she is in need of capital amounting to Php 11,000 to make her plan come true. Christina is confident that with the expansion of her business she can be able to meet the needs of her family and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase school and office supplies & grocery items for sale

loans.name: Chi's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chi E. is the group leader of four people who all live in Kong Chey village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. From this plantation, she gets very little income to support her family. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy another plot of land to cultivate rice to earn more income. Mrs. Chi E. is 58 years old and a widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory.

One member in this group has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Zoir

texts.ru: Зоир отец троих детей,бизнесмен, который занимается продажей шлангов для полива огородов и другие необходимые для дома товаров.Жена Зоира работает техничкой в столовой рынка города Гафуров.На плечах Зоира лежит вся лепта семейных расходов,заработная плата его жены очень низкая.Для увеличения своего оборотного капитала и ассортимента Зоир хочет взять кредит.
texts.en:
Zoir S. is a businessman and a father of three. He sells garden hoses and other household goods. Zoir's wife works as a maintenance person at a local dinner in Gafurov. The wife's pay is very low. To help better provide for his family, Zoir is seeking a loan to finance business expansion.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Fauzia

texts.en:
Fauzia has her own a minishop (kiosk) and has sold clothing in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for the past 3 years. She belongs to the Safi nia loan group (Group code 2007).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothing and other items for her business. She ihopes that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.   

Fauzia is 30 years old, married, and has three children: ages 12, 10 and 6.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale

loans.name: Holnazar

texts.ru: Ходжаев Холназар проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 29 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Имеет высшее образование. По профессии экономист. Но работает артистом. Выступает на свадьбах , исполняя национальные песни. Кроме того имеет торговую точку , где продает разный товар. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и специализироваться на определенном виде товара. Это даст возможность найти свою нишу на рынке. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Holnazar H. lives in Kulyab. He is 29 years old and is married with 2 children. He has a university degree in Economics but he makes a living as an actor. He performs at weddings singing traditional songs. In addition, he has a vending point where he sells different products. Holnazar would like to get a loan in order to increase cash flow, find his own niche and specialize in selling one type of goods. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Von

texts.en: Von A., 26, is a local motorcycle taxi driver. He provides his taxi service for local villagers and passer-by, and can earn an average of $3.50 per day. Von A. is a single man who is very responsible to his family and he currently lives with his old mother, who is a rice farmer in Kompong Tom Province. Von A.'s business is going well but recently his old motorcycle frequently breaks down so he can't attract additional clients. Therefore, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a new motorcycle to replace his old broken machine.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.en:
Maria Elisa Costillo is 51 years old and owns a variety store. She is separated from her husband. Her sister granted her aP10, 000.00 loan as an initial capital in her store. 

Maria belongs to ASHI-Antique, Southwest Branch, Banawon 24.  She received her 3rd loan in the amount of P15,000.00 last January 27, 2009 and used it as additional capital in her variety store. She is now managing her store and the people living in the barangay (neighborhood) serve as the customers.  This additional capital is a great help in meeting her and her sons daily needs. She also raises hogs and poultry as additional income.

Through her initiative and ASHI, she dreams that someday her store will become a grocery store and her son will graduate from college with a stable job, so that they can elevate themselves from poverty.

loans.use: Variety Store

loans.name: Luningning

texts.en:
Mrs. Luningning D. Cruza is 34 years old and has lived in Guintas, Hamtic, and Antique, Philippines. She is married and blessed with 5 children, 3 in elementary level and one in high school. 

She owns a variety store and received a P14, 000.00 loan last January 29, 2009 to purchase groceries for her store. With a greater variety of inventory she now attracts many more customers. Aside from this business she also has piggery and raises poultry. For the future she hopes to have mini grocery store and to complete her son education so that he will not have to experience the poverty that she has

Mrs. Luningning D. Cruza is very thankful to ASHI because of the trust they had in her, especially the initial capital to establish her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for a Variety store

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija has been a cloth (khanga: traditional Tanzanian fabric) seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to Stahili Salama Group (Group code 2053).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 125. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more "khanga" for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Khadija is 20 years old and married.

loans.use: To buy more cloth (khanga) for her business

loans.name: Gulboy

texts.ru: Кукиев Гулбой. проживает в городе Яван, в одном изх отдаленных кишлаков города. Женат и имеет восьмерых детей. Занимается выращиванием пшеницы и других злаковых культур. Получаемый урожай использует для продажи , а частично оставляет себе для личного использования. Кредит поланирует получит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Gulboy K. lives in one of the remote villages of Yavan. He is married with 8 children. He grows wheat and other grains. He sells most of the harvest and leaves the rest for his own consumption. Gulboy is applying for a loan in order to increase cash flow. He would repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Cenita

texts.en: Tending a small food vending stall at school and selling of grilled chicken parts at noontime are the primary sources of income of Cenita J.. This is her way of helping her husband, an on-call carpenter, in providing their daily needs. With their four children, two of whom are in school, she feels that she needs to strive harder to be able to cope up with their daily expenses and their children's studies. She needs an amount of Php 11,000 to expand her business to cater to the increasing demand of the local market.

loans.use: To purchase chicken parts and  supplies for her small stall at school

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Abd Alftah

texts.en:
Abd Alftah A. is only 19. However, despite his age, he is already mature and started to worry about how he is going to provide a better standard of living for his family.

 Abd Alftah owns a small store where he sells a variety of goods such as rice, milk, and soft drinks and earns enough money for the family. But in order to increase his stock of goods, he is asking a loan of US$ 1000. He would appreciate your assistance very much.

loans.use: purchase more goods for his grocery store

loans.name: Mwatum

texts.en:
Mwatum has a small flavor items shop in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Sisikwasisi Group (Group code 2042). Every day she works at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more flavor items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwatum is 35 years old, married, and has five children: ages 10, 9, 7, 6 and 4.

loans.use: To buy more flavor items for her business

loans.name: Holmo

texts.ru: Абророва Холмо одинокая женщина, которая одна воспитывает четверых детей. Занимается животноводством. Имеет трех коров, молоко которых она продает , и за этот счет обеспечивает семью. Кроме того покупает неоткормленных телят , которых откармливает и перепродает на рынке . Таким образом она решила получить кредит и увеличить поголовье скота, что даст возможность увеличить товарооборот. Погаить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Holmo A. is a single mother of four. She works in animal sales. She has three dairy cows whose millk she sells in order to make a living. She also buys young bull calves that she then sells at the market. Holmo decided to apply for a loan that would allow her to increase the number of livestock and increase cash flow. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Obidjon

texts.ru: Обидчон мужчина 39 лет, отец троих детей , жена портниха на дому.Сам Обидчон много лет как зарабатывает на жизнь заготавливая и продавая мясной шашлык.он выпекает несколько видов шашлыка.Его продукция  пользуется большим спросом ,т.к. отличается от других высоким  качеством и вкусом. Получив кредит он хочет отремонтировать свой ларёк, обновить навес.Для чего ему понадобилось 1600 сомони.
texts.en:
Obidjon M. is 39, married. He has 3 children. Obidjon's wife works as tailor at home. For many years, Obidjon M. has been making and selling kebab. His kebab is in great demand for the taste and quality. This loan Obidjon will use to renovate his stall.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovation of the place of business

loans.name: Ukombozi Group

texts.en:
Joice, a clothes and food seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years, currently earns an average monthly profit of $25 working daily at her business from 7:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to buy more clothes and food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.

Joice is 42 years old, divorced, and has two children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Joice A. and Teresia, both of whom also have their own small businesses in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and food items for her business.

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en: Nkechi is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past year. Nkechi sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks, she worked and studied this business for 6 months and she now, has owned her own business for the past year. Nkechi requests a loan amount of N70, 000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Oyunbileg

texts.en:
Oyunbileg S. is married with two children. Her family lives in a "ger" (a traditional nomadic Mongolian home) on a plot of land, that the family owns in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest son, Buyant, is studying in Erdenet city to become a Buddhist monk. Her youngest son, Buyanbat, is studying in elementary school in Ulaanbaatar. Her husband, Lutbaatar, works in construction. However, construction work for the most part only takes place during the warmer months in Mongolia. Temperatures far below zero make it nearly impossible to work in winter. In the cold months, he stays at home and makes wooden chairs and plates to sell. 

Their family used to live in Erdenet city before 2005, but moved to Ulaanbaatar to improve their living conditions. As soon as they moved, Oyunbileg began to run a retail business. She bought a retail stall to sell socks and other small items in "Narantuul," the biggest outdoor market in Mongolia. She is planning to expand her business by buying another stall at the same market. With her loan, Oyunbileg will invest in more socks, which she buys from wholesalers.

Oyunbileg is a very polite and humble person. Oyunbileg said, in Mongolian, that "I and my husband are thinking about buying another piece of land from our future business profits."

loans.use: To buy more socks to invest in her retail business

loans.name: Kory

texts.en: S., 36, has been running a little shop selling a small variety groceries. She sells items like cooked ingredients, sweets for kids, and some vegetables to the villagers. She is a widow who has no children and she currently lives alone in her small cottage, in rural area of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. S. needs to borrow a loan in order to purchase a larger variety of groceries to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en: Baigalmaa J. is single mother who lives with her daughter in a "ger," the traditional Mongolian nomadic housing. They don't have their own yard, so they built their ger in her sister's yard. Her daughter is handicapped, but despite this she helps in her mother's business as much as she can. Baigalmaa graduated from college as a construction mechanic, but never worked as mechanic. Her first retail business was cigarette sales. She was in the cigarette business from 1997 until 2000. Then she switched into the dairy products business at the local market. During the summer, she sells only "airag," or fermented mare's milk. She gained a lot of experience while working in the dairy business. Baigalmaa wants a loan to buy a larger volume of dairy products, including airag, since almost every household uses dairy products during the upcoming lunar New Year celebration.

loans.use: To buy dairy products for the upcoming lunar New year celebration

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia O. sells beef. She purchases cattle, slaughters them and sells the meat products. She hopes to be able meet the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more cattle to process and sell. Patricia is 38 years old and married with 5 children. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to slaughter and sell

loans.name: Foye

texts.en: Foye lives in largo State, Nigeria. She is engaged in the rental service of itms like chairs, tables, and canopies.
