Foye has been in this business since the year 1990 and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 4 years. Foye is 58 years old and married with 5 children. Foye is soliciting for a loan amount of N90, 000 to purchase more canopies, chairs, pots and tables to rent out. This will enable her to satisfy the demand of her numerous customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more canopies and chairs to rent

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.en:
Azamjon A. was born in 1984 in the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is the only son in the family so he started earning money when he was a school boy. Today Azamjon has an outlet in the Khujand local bazaar where he is engaged in selling small items (sewing notions, hair spray, shampoo, hair colouring, clothes pegs, shaving blades, etc.) He has been in this business for three years and today he has a fine assortment of goods that he brings from Istaravshan.

Azamjon is asking KIVA for financial support in the form of a business development loan of 4100 STJ for 6 months for purchasing a new assortment and for a business turnover increase that will permit him in future to expand the existing business as a cosmetics sales outlet. Azamjon thanks KIVA for its precious contribution to small business development and support.

loans.use: purchasing a new assortment

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. sells beef. She hopes to expand this business so as to meet the demand of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more cows to slaughter and sell. Joy is 39 years old and she is married with 6 children. She lives in Agbor, Delta State, Nigeria. She says thanks to all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cows to slaughter and sell

loans.name: Olaide

texts.en:
Olaide operates a restaurant business and she also sells drinks; she learnt the business in 2 years. Olaide has been in her business for the past 20 years. For the past 4 years, her business has experienced a new turn because of the loans she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance during this period.

Olaide is 44 years old and she has 5 children. Olaide is requesting the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook for sale. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin is 44 years old and married with 4 children. He rears and sells fish and pigs in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. The demand for his pigs and fish is high and he hopes to meet the demand of his customers. He needs the loan amount of N 150,000 to build more pens for the pigs. He is indeed grateful to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To build more pens for the pigs

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy M., 29,  of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, Southern Philippines is happily married  with  three children.  Her  husband earns income  by transporting  people from their residences to the City traversing an average distance of about 67 kilometers. She augments her husband’s income  by venturing into  food vending. Most of her customers are her neighbors and vendors of the  village. Mercy wants to earn more to support the educational needs of her children and the needs of her family as well. She also wants to improve her food vending stall so she can accept dine-in customers. She joined  HSPFI’s microfinance program to get additional  capital for her business. She is requesting a loan of Php11,000. Mercy is thanking you for helping her realize her plan.

loans.use: To improve her food vending stall

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is a mother of 4 and she is 30 years old. Blessing sells provisions, wine, and cosmetics in her shop. She learned this business in 2 years and she has been in the business for the past 4 years. Blessing lives in Mebamu in Lagos State, Nigerian. Blessing is requesting the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more wine, provisions, and cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders and to LAPO.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and wine to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mr. S., 39, is a local fisherman who depends for a living on fishing in and around Tunle Sap Lake. He is married with four children; all of them are still young and under his responsibility. His wife's name is Hear, 26, who is a local rice farmer. Mr. S. catches a large volumn of fish and sell his fish to market-sellers. His business is profitable. To expand the business, he would like to ask for a loan to buy some fishing equipment to increase his business.. He lives in Kompong Tom Province of Cambodia and he and his family are pictured.

loans.use: To buy some fishing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of corm, millet, beans and peanuts for resale

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: Georges is a 45-year-old married man with two children, living in Fourn Al Chebak in Beirut. Since his teenage years he has been working as a house painter, and nowadays he is responsible for the renovation of several houses. Today, Georges is requesting $1,200 to buy paint at a very good price, in order to re-sell it and increase his profits.

loans.use: Buy paint to re-sell

loans.name: Gladu

texts.en:
Gladu H. aged 28, runs a stationery shop in Bugiri. She is married to Mr. Musamadi Patrick, a secretary at Karamoja district quarters. The couple has 2 children, aged 4 and 2 years. Gladu H. used to work as a bursar at Nsono primary school in Bugiri.

From her earnings as a bursar, she managed to raise the capital to open up the stationery shop in 2005. She rents her business premises at the rate of ush 500,000 per year. She earns a profit of ush  70,000 per week in good seasons. Her business growth is attribiuted to customer courtesy and quality products. H.'s goal is to educate her children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: Purchasing books, printing papers, ink, pens and files.

loans.name: Elliot

texts.en: Elliot raises and sells fish and pigs. He hopes to expand this business. He needs the loan amount of N150, 000 to build more pens for raising pigs. He is 38 years old and married with 1 child. He says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To build more pens for raising pigs

loans.name: Maisara

texts.en: A. Maisara has been an active client of the MicroInvest loan program since 2004. She showed herself as the reliable and exemplary client. She has never missed a loan repayment date. Maisara was born in 1968 in Khujand. She is married with 3 children. Maisara is engaged in the commercial service. She sells food products from her home where she has a food shop.She buys her supplies in “Panjshanbe” the local bazaar, and then re-sells them. Her business has a good turnover and she dreams of some day opening a food-market. Maisara has made a  request for a business development loan of 1000 STJ over 4 months to purchase a refrigerator. She thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi is 55 years old and married with 8 children. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells fish and foodstuffs. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profits. Ngozi requests the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more fish stock and foodstuffs to sell. She is indeed grateful to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of fish and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ayewole

texts.en: Oyewale sells foodstuffs and frozen food from her shop. She studied this business for 1 year and she has been in the business for the past 10 years. Oyewale is 38 years old and has 2 children. She is a LAPO client. Oyewale lives at Lgbede, Lagos. She requests a loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs and frozen food like turkey and chicken to sell. She is very grateful for the financial assistance. She says thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and frozen food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy provisions for his store

loans.name: Nikolay

texts.en:
Nikolay, married and with one adult daughter, sells women and men’s shoes at one of the markets in Zaporozhye. His net income is about 3,000 UAH per month. Hard working and quite entrepreneurial, Nikolay started the business 12 years ago and now has three kiosks at the market where he and his wife sell shoes. He believes that selling good quality products brings repeat clients and helps his business to grow.

Nikolay would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase his spring collection of shoes. He needs to buy early enough to be able to offer the best selection possible for his clients.

loans.use: To purchase spring shoes for the business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Shibiri, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. Ruth has been in this business for the past 5 years. She travels to republic of Benin to buy her supplies (a journey of about four hours by bus) and she goes to the market once a week. Ruth is 40 years old and she has 3 children. Ruth needs the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en:
Dilrabo A.  first joined MicroInvest in 2004, when she heard from her sister about the good business developement loans available through MicroInvest.  Thanks to her first loan with MicroInvest she was able to open an outlet selling children wear. Now she has branched out her business into small wares selling. She has many repeat customers as she sells for the lowest prices at the bazaar. 

Dilrabo buys her supplies in Istaravshan and Bishkek (in the Kyrgyz Republic). She is asking KIVA for support through a  business development loan of 4100 STJ for 6 months to import new seasonal wear and increase her business turnover.

loans.use: To import new seasonal wear for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his store with goods

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday O. sells medicine to his customers. The demands for his medicine are high and he hopes to meet all their demands. He is requesting the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase additional medicine to sell. He is 49 years old and married, with 4 children. He says thanks to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike for taxi service

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina A., a single parent with four dependents, has been selling fish and operating a beauty salon at Bantama near Elmina since 1997. Purchasing from the fishermen, she brings the fish home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale. Christina has received no formal education.

Christina is responsible for paying the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale and to purchase a variety of hair products to meet customer demand. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house she plans to build for the children.

loans.use: To buy fish in larger quantities and a variety of hair products to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло Сафарова проживает в городе Куляб в Восейском районе. Возраст 45 лет , замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Уже четыре года занимается торговлей одежды. Торговая точка находится на центральном рынке города. Товар привозит из города Душанбе. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shahlo S. lives in the town of Kulyab in the Vosei region. She is 45 years old and is married with five children. For the past four years she has worked in clothing sales. Her vending point is located at the central market. She brings clothes from Dushanbe. She plans to get a loan in order to increase cash flow. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Aidah Namukasa Group

texts.en:
Aidah, a 49-year-old group leader of four other women, has seven children between 16 and 28 years of age, all attending school. She rents a one-room house with electricity and water access where she resides with her children. She also takes care of additional family members. Her greatest expenses in a month are rent and feeding her family

For the past 14 years, Aidah has sold second hand clothes from a market stall she rents, normally receiving about 20 customers a day working six days a week. She has been with MCDT for over four years now, having chosen them for their timely service, and is currently servicing her 12th loan. She is requesting her latest loan to increase her stock.

Aidah looks forward to expanding her business to improve her income.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary C. is married and has five dependents. She received schooling through commercial education. Mary sells groceries, boxes of soap, and bags of rice at the Elmina new market, which she has done since 2003. Her husband is not in the country at the moment. Mary uses her income to assist her husband in the housekeeping expenses. Mary will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase her sales to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save toward the completion of the family house she has started building with her husband.

loans.use: To increase the sale of groceries, boxes of soap, and bags of rice

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a widow. She sells women's and men’s shoes at one of the markets in Zaporozhye city. Her net income is about 1,500 UAH per month.

Elena has been in this business for 10 years. Her kind and open personality helps Elena to serve and retain her clients. Elena has formed her client base and has many repeat clients who come to her when they need to purchase new shoes.

Elena would like to receive 10,000 UAH to purchase a spring collection of shoes. She needs to buy it early enough to be able to offer good choice for her clients.

loans.use: To purchase spring shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She sells cooked foods like rice, beans, plantain, etc. She hopes to expand this business. She needs a loan to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana sells foodstuffs; she has been in the business for the past 7 years. Christiana is 36 years old and married with 4 children. Christiana is requesting a loan to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is very happy with LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their financial support they have given to her. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Kuvandik

texts.en:
Kuvandik A. has been working with our loan programme since 2006 and he is a reliable client who has not had any loan repayment delays. Kuvandik is a school teacher by profession, but the teacher salary is too low to ensure that his family's needs are met.

Kuvandik is engaged in livestock farming, with 2 cows, one bull and 5 sheep. This business provides him with meat and milk. His wife sells the milk. Kuvandik is experienced in livestock farming, as he has cared for the animals for 15 years. Kuvandik applied for a loan to build a seasonal cattle building. He thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: To build a seasonal cattle building.

loans.name: Arabsho

texts.ru: Арабшо Салимов проживаетв городе Куляб, в Восейском районе.Женат и имеет двоих детей. Возраст 30 лет.Работает в средней школе  района. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Скупает мелкий рогатый скот , а после откормки перепродпет. Планирует получить крелдит для того, чтобы уувеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Arabsho S. lives in the town of Kulyab of Vosey region. He is 30 years old and is married with two children. He works in the region's secondary school and is involved in animal sales. He buys and sells bull calves. He plans to get a loan in order to increase the number of livestock. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica C. is a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon near the Elmina police station. Veronica has received a junior high school education. She is single and has no children. Veronica has been a hair dresser since 2005. She is responsible for paying the rent, utility bills and other financial expenses.

Her loan will be used to buy a variety of hair products to meet the demands of her customers who come to the salon. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house she wants to build so that she can stop renting apartments.

loans.use: To buy a variety of hair products.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: For the last ten years, Emma C., 38, has been trading different garments, furniture and other  homemade handicraft.  Due to lack of capital she was not able to meet the demands of her customers since her business needed a bigger amount of capital to sustain its operations. She stopped  and ventured into another kind of business. Emma is really motivated and determined that as long as she has an opportunity she'll grab it for the sake of her children and family. She then decided to put up a grocery store to assist her husband in meeting the family needs. HSPFI granted her  a loan of PHP10,000 to start her new business. Today her grocery store is growing such that she even goes to the city two times a week to buy goods for her store. This time she requesting for an additional capital of PHP14,000 to purchase additional products for her store like rice, beverages and other grocery items for sale.

loans.use: To purchase additional products  like rice, beverages and grocery items for sale

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta A. sells used clothing at Elmina. Alberta has received a junior high school education. She is married with 2 children, and her husband is a mason. Alberta has been selling used clothing since 1991, and is responsible for assisting her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase the sales of used clothing to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house she wants to build with her husband.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to increase the sales of used clothing.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en:
A. Sanobar is 34 years old and comes from a large and humble family.  She is married and the loving mother of four children.  

Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work.  Therefore, she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. 

Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle.  With the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. 

Sanobar asks for a $600 loan for the term of 12 months in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown.  With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life.  Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. 

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  

While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.  Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.  To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle in order to expand the business and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Mustafonqul

texts.ru: Давлатов Мустафонкул проживает в городе Куляб. Работает в средней школе , учителем .Кроме того привозит книги из города Худжант, которые реализует на рынке"Саховат" . Кроме того рядом продает самбусу , выпекаемую его женой. Дело приносит доход , но теперь он планирует увеличить товарооборот, путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 14 месяцев. Он женат и имеет троих детей.
texts.en:
Mustafonqul D. lives in the town of Kulyab. He is a high school teacher. He brings books from Hujant and sells them at the Sakhovat market. He also sells sambusa that his wife bakes. THe business is profitable but Mustafonqul would like to increase cash flow. Therefore he is applying for a loan that he would pay off within 14 months. Mustafonqul D. is married with three children.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny T. is a 31 year old resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, where she earns a living distilling Khmer wine for sale, as well as raising pigs. To help with the family's food needs, her husband sells firewood by cutting it down from the forest. They have two children who are teenagers and in school. Ny T. hopes to improve her business, because it is very profitable for the family. She is asking for a loan to buy rice for distilling wine and piglets to raise. The remainder of the loan will used for her husband's business operation.

loans.use: To buy rice for distilling wine and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Cordila

texts.en: Cordila is an industrious fashion designer and she also sells sarongs in her shop. Cordila learned this business for 2 years and she has been in the business for the past 9 years. Cordila has 5 apprentices in her shop and she has 4 sewing machines. Cordila is 28 years old and married with a child. Cordila needs a loan to purchase one sewing machine and sarongs. She says thanks to Kiva and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and one sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cooker and to fix up his stall

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary B. sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen, brings home for processing and preservation, and then sends to the market for sale at Atobiase near Elmina. Mary has been selling fish since 1996. She has received no formal education. She is married with 3 children, and her husband is a farmer. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in their children's education.

loans.use: To increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Binodira

texts.en:
Education is the most important inheritance Binodira and her husband can give to their five dear children.  They are both very responsible parents and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. 

This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband, she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs.  Even so, she now finds herself with more expenditures and she would like a loan in order to increase their capital by increasing their production. 

Binodira and her family are waiting for your quick response.

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.

These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Mahsatoi

texts.en:
Mahsatoi A. is applying to the MicroInvest loan programme for the first time. She believes she is a serious client, who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure and intends to work diligently until she becomes a successful small business woman.

Mahsatoi has been engaged in the livestock business for 20 years. She started helping her mother take care of animals when she was a young girl, and then when she got married she took care of her own livestock. She has one dairy cow, one calf and 4 rams. Mahsatoi wants to buy a pedigree bull to increase the number of her livestock. This is the reason why Mahsatoi applied for a loan, and she thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina D. is married and has 1 child. She has received schooling through junior high. Faustina sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Atobiase near Elmina, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is a carpenter. Faustina uses her income to assist her husband with the house keeping expenses. Faustina will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to save towards a house that she wants to build with her husband.

loans.use: Faustina will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and has two daughters. She has two business locations where she sells women's shoes.  Irina started her business 10 years ago. She quit her job and together with her husband began a shoe retail business. Irina offers her clients good quality shoes and good treatment. She always helps her clients to choose shoes that fit best. The clients value this service and come back.

This business is the only source of income for Irina's family. Irina became a grand mother recently. Now she helps her daughter's young family financially. Irina’s younger daughter is a university student (in her last year) and Irina helps  to pay for the tuition.

Irina would like to receive a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase her inventory. Her goal is to develop this business further and open a third location.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
B. Zamira is a polite and hard-working entrepreneur in Penjikent, Tajikistan.  Known for her honesty and dedication, she works long hours running her own small clothing store where sells mainly women's clothes and underclothes.  

Zamira is lucky because her store is located in an excellent location, so she has an excellent sale rate.  That's why she's confident she will be able to repay a loan of $1000 in full.  

Zamira is single and lives with her parents, but the high inflation rate in Tajikistan is making it difficult for her family to maintain their basic standard of living.  With the loan, Zamira hopes to purchase more inventory to grow her business and improve her family’s living conditions.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for increasing the range of goods.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen sells drinks, provisions and foodstuffs and she has been in this business since 1988. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. Helen is 42 years old and she has 6 children. She lives at Ilaje and is requesting a loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. Helen appreciates the financial assistance provided to her in these hard times. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru: Давлатов Тохир житель города Куляб. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Работает в магазине. Уже пять лет , как он торгует продуктами питания. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 14 месяцев.Кроме этого бизнеса клиент занимается резкой по дереву , и этот  вид деятельности является дополнительным заработком его семьи.
texts.en:
Tohir D. lives in the town of Kulyab. He is married with four children. He works in a store. It's been five years since he's been selling groceries, and now he is applying for a loan in order to increase cash flow. He would be able to pay off the loan within 14 months. In addition, Tohir does wood carving, which is an additional source of income for his family.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Uuganbayar B. is a 40-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children. Jasray, his wife, works at the shoe factory, and the children go to school. He moved to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, from the countryside a decade ago. During the last 10 years, he has been making traditional belts called Gyargan. The beautiful belts are made from woven silk. Before 1930, this type of belt was used commonly by the lamas, or Tibetan Buddhist priests (50% of Mongolians practice Tibetan Buddhism, or Lamaism, according to the CIA World Factbook). 

Nowadays, very few people know how to make Gyargan belts. He learned to make the Gyargan belt from his aunt. At first, it was hard for him to find clients. But now he has many customers who buy the Gyargan belt to use during the lunar New Year celebration. Uuganbayar weaves only one belt in 3 days, or about 10-12 per month. His monthly income from his business is MNT 160,000-180,000 (1500 MNT=$1 USD). Attached is a very, very short video of Uuganbayar at work!

loans.use: Buying silk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock her store with merchandise

loans.name: Bozor

texts.en:
D. Bozor is 43 years old and was born in Penjikent, Tajikistan.  He is the father of four children, and his main work consists of breeding cattle. 

This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family.  A very ambitious man, he would like to buy a greater number of cattle and build a farmhouse to house them in order to ensure their safety.  Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of $800 for the realization of this project. 

Bozor promises to repay the loan in 12 months.  When his dream is carried out, he will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family.  With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Mutyba Specioza Group

texts.en:
M. is 36 years of age and married with four children. All of her children go to school. She rents a six room house and lives there with her children. She doesn’t have additional family to look after. M. always has three meals a day and her greatest expense is tuition for her children. She makes her living raising chickens and works seven days a week. She normally receives about ten customers a day and most of her clients are men. She sells her hens at retail and she has done this kind of business for over seven years. Besides rearing chickens, she is also a shop attendant. 
The main challenge she faces in her business is that it is seasonal. She can only sell her hens when they have matured.

M. has been a member with MCDT for 5 years. She chose to work with MCDT because they operate in a simply way that is easy to understand. She has worked with her group for 5 years and she wants to use this loan to increase her stock. She also wants to continue expanding her business until it becomes a farm.

loans.use: To increase on her stock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. is married and has 6 dependants. She has received schooling through junior high. Mary sells bread which she bakes herself. She also sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Atobiase near Elmina. She has done this since 2000. Her husband is a carpenter. Mary uses her income for assist her husband with the house keeping expenses. 

Mary will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale and also to purchase flour and other baking materials to increase production. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to invest in their children's education.

loans.use: To buy fish in larger quantities and also to purchase flour and other baking materials to ncrease production.

loans.name: Fedalia

texts.en: Fedelia sells cooked food and drinks. She has been in this business for 15 years. Fedelia opens her shop by 6:00 A.M. to prepare for workers going to work by 8 A.M., and she closes by midnight, from Monday to Sunday. Fedelia lives at Ilaje, is 40 years old, married and has 5 children. Fedelia is requesting a loan for $550 (80000 NGN) to purchase more drinks and food items to cook and sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Buy more drinks and food items to cook and sell

loans.name: Oblokul

texts.en:
H. Oblokul has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from his young age, that his family never went without the daily bread.  He is married and has four children. 

Oblokul has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs.  With a starting capital of $500, and thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise 2 years ago.  Today this business has become domestic and his children and wife are also engaged in the business. 

Today Oblokul needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase his range of goods for sale.  For this purpose he is requesting a loan of $800 for the term of 12 months. 

He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.  We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of foodstuffs for increasing the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy travel bags for resale

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en:
J. Rafoat is a 39 year old woman.  She is married with four children.  Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle and also breeding sheep.  

She walks through the farms and several settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price to be able to increase her profits.  She currently has 2 cows, a calf, and 4 sheep which she will fatten for some time to later sell them.  

With the loan she wants to buy calves and feed for his animals.  This will be her first loan with IMON International, and her evaluation shows she is qualified to receive the loan.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves and feed for animals

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Mrs. Girlie Hernandez is 36 years old, married and blessed with four children. She hails from the province of Antique, Philippines. She is engaged in fishing and she is asking for a loan to purchase materials in making fish net as additional assets of the business.  The people in the village are her main customers.
	
She dreams that she will have her own fish net and let her children finish their studies. She want to thank ASHI for helping her establish her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials in making a fish net

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana sells sarongs and is also a fashion designer. Christiana learned this business in 2 years, and she has had this business for 5 years. Christiana is married and she is 32 years old. Christiana lives at Ilaje, and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. She requests a loan for $550 (80000 NGN) to purchase more sarongs to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Buy more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Radjabmo

texts.en:
Radjabmo is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family.  Two years ago she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available on their land for this business. 

She is engaged in this business together with her husband.  Slowly, the number of cows has increased and, with that, her clients started asking for more and more.  With an endless list of requests she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and, for this reason, she is requesting a loan. 

Be an important part of the growth of Radjabmo’s business.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Falilat Ligani

texts.en: Falilat sells food. Falilat is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children. Falilat has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years and the loan has allowed her to tremendously increase her business. In order to further increase her business, she is requesting a $550 (50,000 NGN) loan to purchase more food to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Buy more food to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N., the 26-year-old mother of a three-year-old son, operates a drug shop in Bugiri. In 2005, with the financial support of her husband, Empala David, Sarah opened a drug shop, renting the premises for ush 600,000 per annum.

Customer courtesy and genuine products have enabled Sarah to develop a loyal customer base, earning her a weekly profit of about ush 85000. She is now requesting a loan to purchase additional medicines for the business; her ambitions are for her son to become a doctor, and for her to become a well-known pharmacist.

loans.use: Purchase more medicine.

loans.name: Efua Yaa

texts.en:
Since 2006, Efua Yaa K., an uneducated lady with two children, has sold food supplies and fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale at Atobiase near Elmina. She uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the housekeeping expenses.

Efua Yaa is requesting a loan to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale and also to purchase more food supplies for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, She plans to save towards a house that she wants to put up with her husband and also to invest in expanding their cocoa farm.

loans.use: To buy fish in larger quantities and more food supplies for sale.

loans.name: Agustín

texts.es:
El Sr. Agustín está casado con la Sra. Zoraida, viven en la cuidad de Hernandarias desde hace varios años, ellos y sus hijos fueron criados en esa ciudad, hoy día todos ya son mayores de edad y profesionales.-
Se iniciaron en la actividad con un pequeño capital que fueron juntando poco. Para la compra de su camioneta y un poco de mercaderías ahorraron de a poco, hasta juntar un monto de consideración que les permita adquirir dicho activo para el negocio y para uso de la familia.-
Ellos viajan por las colonias vecinas para la venta de sus mercaderías cada semana.-
La Sra. Zoraida aparte de ser esposa  es una persona muy activa y emprendedora, a más de ser una buena compañera de  viajes.
Demostraron ser muy trabajadores y muy responsable en sus compromisos
texts.en:
Agustín is married with Zoraida. They have lived in the city of Hernandarias for a number of years. They and their children grew up in this city. Their children are now grown and have careers. They opened their business with a small amount of money which they had saved. They saved little by little in order to buy their van and a small amount of goods to use for their business and their home. They travel throughout the neighbouring suburbs to sell their merchandise every week. Zoraida is more than a wife: she is a very active and entrepreneural woman in addition to being a good travel companion. They have shown that they are very hard-working and very responsible in their commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: T-shirts, capris, shorts and other clothing

loans.name: Saidamo

texts.en:
Saidamo has a very good sense of humor and her jovial spirit helps her face difficult times.  She’s been immersed in raising animals since her childhood and, for that reason, she decided to remain in this industry. 

She works very hard to obtain the income that will satisfy her family’s necessities.  The immense love that she feels from her children and her faithful husband motivates her to keep working hard.  She wishes to buy more animals and, in this way, increase her income.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. 

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  

While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.  Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.  To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for expanding the business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy S. sells food supplies like plantain, banana and other items at Atobiase, near Elmina. Mercy has received primary level education.  She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is a carpenter. Mercy has been selling food supplies like plantain and bananas since 2007. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the house keeping expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to increase the sale of food supplies to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house that she wants to put up with her husband.

loans.use: Her loan will be used as additional capital to increase the sale of food supplies.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
M. Sharofat is 51 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two adult children. Mrs.Sharofat sells such goods as detergents, hair accessories for girls, batteries, blades, machine twist and treads, pens and other items. She has been in this business for 5 years. Her husband helps and supports her always. The business is successful and brings considerable income to the family. Today, Mrs.Sharofat wants to expand her business and to increase her working capital to purchase additional goods for resale. For this purpose, she requests a loan of $ 800 US Dollars for a term of 12 months. She has borrowed from IMON several times and having always duly repaid her loan payments. She is a good client of IMON and promises to manage this loan with diligence. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Expand her business and purchase additional goods for resale.

loans.name: Ana Gonzalez

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 38 años  está acompañada con el señor Julio Medina que trabaja como vendedor ambulante de mercerías en el centro de la ciudad. Tienen  tres hijos de los cuales todos son menores de edad y dependientes de ellos. Ella se dedica a la peluquería.

Ana  se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de   diez años y su local comercial se encuentra en su misma casa. Donde realizo algunas refacciones  para montar su peluquería.
 
Ana, con sus ganancias de su trabajo aporta a los ingresos de la casa, y junto con su compañero hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.

Ana, comenta que tiene bastante trabajo. Es por ello que  desea adquirir mayor cantidad de cosméticos y materiales de peluquería, de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona.
texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old. She is married to Julio Medina who works as a street vendor in the centre of the city. They have three children who are all minors and dependent on them. She is a hairstylist. Ana has been in this business for more than 10 years and her business is located in her home, which she made alterations to in order to open her salon. Thanks to the income from her business, Ana contributes to the household income and together with her partner pays for the household expenses. Ana says that she has plenty of work; because of this, she wants to buy more cosmetics and styling materials so that she can satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca B. is married and has 4 dependants. She has received no formal education. Rebecca sells clothing at Atobiase near Elmina, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is a farmer. Rebecca uses her income to assist her husband with the house keeping expenses. Rebecca will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of clothing and meet the increased demands of her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land for the building of the family house so that she can stop paying rent and also provide comfortable shelter for the family.

loans.use: As additional capital to increase the sale of clothing to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Amriddin

texts.en:
S. Amriddin is 52 years old.  He is married with five children.  He sells cattle. 

As a rule, he purchases small cattle in the central market, feeds them and then resells them at higher prices in the local market.  Being in this business for 4 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them.  

His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate stable and considerable incomes for his large family.  Amriddin has a large and friendly family who are always trying to help each other.  

Today, knowing that the prices for the animals are not so high, but will increase for sure, Amriddin is planning to enlarge his stock and purchase cattle.  For this purpose he is requesting $800 for a term of 12 months. 

You could become an important part of Amriddin's family's life.  He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle for expanding the business.

loans.name: Odil

texts.en:
S. Odil is 49 years old.  He is married with four children.  

From the time he was young, Odil began learning to work in the small business with his parents.  With a lot of sacrifice, he became a main producer in agriculture in the area where he lived.  After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more. 

His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children and see them become professional, ethical and hardworking.  For this reason he is asking for a loan of $800 for a term of 12 months.  He wants this loan to buy additional livestock. 

Be an important part of the growth of Odil’s business.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso P. nació en Concepción, según comento vino a Ciudad del Este en el año 1976, prácticamente a los 21 años, Empezaba a trabajar de jornalero, después de vendedor independiente, hasta que un día logró construir su casa en donde tuvo la idea de montar una despensa, que sigue en marcha hasta hoy día.

El señor quiere este préstamo para aumentar su stock de mercaderías por que había  invertido en la construcción de la muralla de su casa  y quedó con la necesidad de reinvertir en su despensa.

Su despensa tiene buena ubicación y esta a nivel de la competencia.
texts.en:
Alfonso P. was born in Concepción and says that he moved to Ciudad del Este in 1976 when he was almost 21 years old. He began working as a day labourer, later became an independent merchant, until one day he managed to build a home and had the idea to open a convenience store, which he still runs to this day. Alfonso wants this loan to increase his stock of merchandise because he had previously invested in building walls for his house and now needs to reinvest in his store. His store is well located and is well able to compete with other stores.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods to stock his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Mavjud

texts.en:
V. Mavjud is 43 years old.  He is married with 5 children.  He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs and household goods like cookies, soft drinks, juices, tea, detergents and many other items in his grocery store, which he built 2 years ago. 

Currently, Mavjud has about $1000 in inventory.  His monthly net profit is about $300.  

Today, Mavjud is requesting a loan of $800 for a term of 12 months to increase his stock.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. 

One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing all the best.  We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
