To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca T., a 27-year-old married mother of four children between the ages of 14 and 2, two of whom are in school, sells spare parts in Kamuli, earning an average profit of ush 200,000 per month. From this income, she pays rent at the rate of ush 20,000 per month.

Rebbeca has eight years of experience in the business and dreams of opening up a large retail outlet for both motorcycle and bicycle spare parts. She hopes to see her children go to the best schools in the country.

loans.use: Purchase bolts, rims, pedals, carriers and wires.

loans.name: Bernardino Alonso

texts.es:
Bernardino, tiene 49 años  está casado con  la señora Maria López y juntos tienen dos hijos de los cuales ambos son dependientes de sus padres. El se dedica al cambio de monedas como por ejemplo (dólar, real, peso argentino, euro, etc.)
Bernardino se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de seis años, el comenta que tiene su puesto fijo en el centro de la ciudad frete mismo al banco nacional de fomento, el  cuenta con el respaldo  legal del directorio del banco nacional de fomento es decir una resolución para poder trabajar legalmente sin ningún tipo de inconveniente.
Bernardino, con sus ganancias de su trabajo aporta a los ingresos de la casa,  junto con su señora  hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.
Bernardino, comenta que tiene bastantes clientes. Es por ello que él desea adquirir mayor cantidad  de capital  para poder abastecer a todos sus clientes y así también obtener más clientes.
texts.en:
Bernardino is 49 years old. He is married with Maria López and together they have two children, both of whom are dependent on their parents. He is a money changer, changing currencies such as dollar, real, peso argentino, euro, etc.) Bernardino has been in this business for more than six years. He says that he has a permanent locale downtown in front of the Banco Nacional de Fomento. He can count on the legal support of the management of the Banco Nacional de Fomento: he is able to work legally without encountering problems. Bernardino uses the income from his work to contribute to the household and together with his wife they pay the family's expenses. Bernardino says that he has plenty of customers. Because of this, he wants to acquire a greater amount of capital to satisfy his existing customers' demands and gain new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ayo

texts.en: Ayo is 47 years old, married, and has 3 children. Ayo lives in Akesan, Lagos state, Nigeria. Ayo sells underwear and ready-made clothes, and she has been in this business for the past 8 years. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past year. Ayo requests a loan of $350 (50,000 NGN) to purchase more underwear and ready-made clothing to sell. Ayoade is grateful for the financial support she receives from LAPO Microfinance and Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase underwear and ready-made clothing to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa M. is 46 years old. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 28 and 20. All of her children have completed school and are employed. Hawa runs a salon in Kamuli town from which she earns an average monthly profit of USH 250,000 (1 USD = 1,960.00 USH).

From her profits, she pays for rent at the rate of USH720,000 per annum. Hawa has 2 professional hairdressers who come in handy when the client business is high. With her 5 years experience in the business, her dream is to open  up a trendy beauty clinic and create more employment opportunities for others.

loans.use: To purchase hair additions, mirrors, hair relaxers and treatments, and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Rokhaya D., 52 ans, mariée avec  02 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter un permis de coupe et faire sculpter des pirogues à vendre. Les pirogues sont comme de petits bateaux faits en bois et utilisés par les pêcheurs pour aller en mer. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Rokhaya D., age 52, is married and has two children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Tenghory Transgambienne for seven and a half years. She wants to buy a cutter’s permit and to have pirogues made and sold. Pirogues are like small wooden boats and are used by fishermen for going out to sea. Rokhaya’s income enables her to help cover family expenses. The loan she’s requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To have boats made for sale

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing A. is 23 years old, married, and has one child. She is a registered nurse. She has a store where she sells medicine. She travels to Onitsha where she purchases medicine to sell in Benin City. She requests a loan of $475 (70,000 NGN) to purchase more medicine to sell. Blessing says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of maize, millets, beans, and peanuts

loans.name: Namuyanja Pauline Group

texts.en:
Pauline is 74 years of age, and is a widow with 7 children aged between 31 and 52. Pauline sells charcoal to earn a living. She rents a four room house, where three people currently stay. She also has access to electricity and piped water. She cares for her grandchildren who lost their parents and came to stay with her. They have three meals a day. Her greatest expense at the end of the month is mainly school fees for her children.

She also sells grasshoppers, during their season, at the market. She works seven days a week and she pays rent for the place she works. Pauline normally receives about 10 people a day, both men and women. She sells her products on a retail basis, and has been in this business for over 10 years.

Pauline complains of the very expensive transportation from the villages where she purchases her goods. And the grasshoppers only come seasonally, which is twice a year. She has worked with MCDT for six years now and she chose to work with MCDT because of the school fees loan they give to their clients. She will use this loan to increase her stock and she also hopes to educate her grandchildren until they graduate from university.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Esmerita

texts.es:
Esmerita, tiene 46 años  está separada con tres hijos  que ya son mayores D. edad profesionales, con sus familias formadas e independiente D. ella. La misma se dedica a la venta D. comestible como por ejemplo: empandas, marineras, milanesas croquetas y todo tipo D. minutas.
Esmerita se ha dedicado a este rubro por más D. tres años y su local comercial se encuentra en la zona del centro D. la ciudad donD. da D. comer por día a 30 clientes debido a que su comida es la más rica en la zona.
Esmerita, con sus ganancias D. su venta hace frente a los gastos D. la casa y también recibe el apoyo D. sus hijos que le pasan una mensualidad para sus gastos.
Esmerita, comenta que tiene bastante venta. Es por ello que ella desea adquirir mayor cantidad D. mercaderías como frutas, verduras, productos cárnicos, arroz, aceite, azúcar, etc., D. este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona y tener mayor cantidad D. clientes.
texts.en:
Esmerita is 46 years old. She is separated and has three children who are adults and have careers, their own families and are independent of her. Esmerita sells food such as empanadas (meat pies), marineras (seafood), milanesas (breaded beef), croquettes and all types of fast foods. Esmerita has been in this business for more than three years; her store is located in the downtown area of the city where she feeds 30 customers a day because her food is the most delicious in the neighbourhood. Esmerita pays for her household expenses with the income from her business, in addition to which her children give her money monthly to pay for her expenses. Esmerita says that she has plenty of sales. Because of this she would like to buy more merchandise such as fruits, vegetables, meats, rice, oil, sugar and so on to meet the demands of her existing customers and attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods such as rice, sugar, oil, vegetables, fruits, breads and meats

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama Mané, 40 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 2 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des crèmes de beauté et des ensembles  d’habits. Elle veut un prêt pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus  vont lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et  de santé de sa famille.  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mariama Mané is 40 years old, married, and has four children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group Tenghory Transgambienne for 2 years. Her business consists of buying and re-selling beauty creams and outfits. She is asking for this loan to strengthen her business. Her income will allow her to improve her living conditions and her family's health. She is seeking a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell beauty creams and clothing

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
K. B. Karim, 29 years old and married with three children, has been running his salon in Kamuli for a period of six years. He has two experienced hairdressers who offer quality services to customers.

The business generates an average profit of ush 200,000 per month from which he pays rent of ush 600,000 per annum. To replenish his stock, Karim is requesting a loan to purchase hair additions and cosmetics. His dream is to own a chain of beauty salons.

loans.use: To purchase hair additions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo es soltero vive con su mama. Se inicio en la actividad, una ferretería y tienda de materiales de construcción, con un pequeño capital que su papa le había dejado como herencia después de su muerte.  
El fue juntando su dinero y aumentando cada día más el volumen de su negocio.-
Están  en su local propio es un lugar muy concurrido por  encontrarse en el centro mismo de la cuidad de Hernandarias.-
Según las referencias que conseguimos es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable.-
texts.en:
Guillermo is single and lives with his mother. He opened his hardware and building materials store with monies he inherited from his father when his father died. He saved his money and every day added to his stock to expand his store. His store is in a very busy meeting place in the very centre of the city of Hernandarias. According to the references we obtained, he is a very hard-working and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sand, bricks and other items, and building materials

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday A. is 32 years old, married, and has 2 children. He has a pharmacy where he sells medicine. He is requesting a loan amount of  $700 (100,000 NGN) to purchase more medicine to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es:
El señor José Mercedes Portillo Ortiz está casado con la señora Valeriana Guillen, tienen 4 hijos; todos mayores de edad y viven en forma independiente.

 El señor José en principio se dedicaba en construcción de casas,  de esta actividad comenzó a  juntar un poco de capital y con el cual monto una cabina telefónica en el predio de su casa. Como tiene una esposa muy activa y emprendedora  monto un pequeño  copetín que les  genera también un ingreso de consideración. El crédito solicitado es para comprar saldo de mini carga telefónica para su posterior venta al público.

Tiene casa propia, y su máximo sueños refaccionarlo de a poco, por que actualmente tiene con esternit y con el tiempo quiere cambiar por tejas, el cliente ya fue beneficiado con los créditos que ofrece kiva y manifiesta que le sirvió bastante porque gracias a eso pudo aumentar sus ingresos, pero sigue con la necesidad de inyección de capital para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Mercedes Portillo Ortiz and his wife Valeriana Guillen have four grown children who are now living on their own. Jose mainly works in housing construction, and has been successful enough to put away sufficient capital to allow him to install a cell phone booth outside his house. His wife is also quite entrepreneurial and she manages a small coffee shop which provides them with additional income. The purpose of the loan is to allow Jose to buy phone minutes which he can then re-sell to the public at a profit. With his earnings, he hopes to be able to make improvements to his house, such as replacing the asbestos cement roofing sheets with clay tile. He has successfully obtained Kiva loans previously, and they have helped him increase his income. He expects to be able to continue increasing his earning power with the present loan request.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase phone minutes for re-sale

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin A. is 35 years old and married. Toyin has a shop where she sells palm oil. She is requesting a loan of $350 (50,000 NGN) to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Banna

texts.fr: Banna G. est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 4 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter  et revendre des arachides et de l’huile de palme. Elle veut renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et la prise en charge de la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Banna G. is married with five children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group Tenghory Transgambienne for 4 years. Her business consists of buying and re-selling peanuts and palm oil. She would like to strengthen her business. Her income allows her to improve her living conditions and to take responsibility for her children's schooling. She is seeking a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell peanuts and palm oil

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
El señor  Julián  tiene 48 años de edad, es casado, tiene cuatro hijos. Su esposa es la señora Cerafina, ambos son comerciantes y se ayudan constantemente. El señor Julián monto una despensa en el año 2001 que hasta hoy sigue en marcha y en crecimiento, además de la despensa el tiene ingresos por ventas de mandioca.
 El crédito solicitado es para compras de mercaderías para aumentar stock. Su máximo sueño es brindarles la mejor educación a los hijos, quienes necesitan de su apoyo, pues, la educación es cara y la única manera de solventar es dedicándose en dos rubros. Mientras el comercializa la mandioca su esposa se encarga de atender la despensa.
texts.en:
Julian M., 48 years of age, is married and has four children. His wife is Cerafina de M., and both are merchants who work together constantly. In 2001 Julian set up his store, which continues to this day, growing steadily. He also augments his income by the sale of yucca flour. His loan request is to purchase, wholesale, additional merchandise for his store. His dream is to be able to provide a good education for his children, who need his assistance because education is expensive, and which requires both husband and wife to work. His wife helps him run the store, while he takes care of the sale of the yucca.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general store items - flour, soda, and other food items

loans.name: Hammed

texts.en: Hammed A. is 47 years old, married, and has 6 children. Hammed sells building materials in his shop. He is requesting a loan of  $700 (100,000 NGN) to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John K. W. is 43 years old. He is married and has 9 children; 3 attend secondary school, and the rest attend primary school. In addition to his job as a medical officer in the Jinja main hospital, John manages the Luzinga welfare medical and eye clinic.

He plans to use the loan to purchase medicine and equipment for minor surgeries. He has 14 years experience in the business and dreams of establishing another clinic. His goals are to have a well-educated and healthy family.

loans.use: Purchase medicine and equipment for minor surgeries

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr: Aida D. est mariée avec 07 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 7 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter  et revendre des  perles, de l’encens, de l’eau de Cologne, du beurre de karité et des produits de linge comme l’Omo, le bleu et la gomme arabique. Elle veut renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et la prise en charge de la scolarité de ses enfants.Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Aida D. is married and has seven children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group Tenghory Transgambienne for seven and a half years. Her business consists of buying and re-selling beads, incense, cologne, shea butter, and washing products such as Omo (washing powder), detergent, and gum arabic. She wants to strengthen her business. Her income allows her to improve her living conditions and take responsibility for her children's schooling. She is seeking a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell beads, incense, cologne, shea butter, and washing products

loans.name: Okadeji Laide

texts.en: Okadeji Laide A. is 26 years old, married, and has one child. She sells rechargeable phones. She is requesting a loan of $225 (30,000 NGN) to purchase more rechargeable phones to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more rechargeable phones to sell

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano, tiene 46 años  está casado con  la señora  Graciela de M. y juntos tienen  un hijo mayor de edad y que trabaja como ayudante de su padre. El se dedica como constructor de obras.
Luciano se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de ocho años, el comenta que siempre tiene bastante trabajo ya que realiza con buena calidad y a un precio accesible. Muchos de sus trabajos obtienen a través de recomendaciones de sus propios clientes.
Luciano, con sus ganancias de su trabajo aporta a los ingresos de la casa,  junto con su señora y  también con la ayuda sus hijos hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.
Luciano, comenta que tiene bastante pedido de trabajo. Es por ello que él desea adquirir equipamientos de construcciones especialmente una mezcladora de sementó de mayor capacidad de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona donde realiza los trabajos.
texts.en:
Luciano M. is 46 years of age, and is married to Graciela de M.. They have one grown son who works with his father in the construction business. Luciano has been in the construction business for 8 years, and he has always had plenty of work because he is very skilled and his work is of high quality. Many of his new jobs come to him from references by previous clients. The money he earns from construction, along with what his wife earns helps the family with all their financial needs. As mentioned above, Luciano has plenty of construction jobs. In order to work more efficiently, he wishes to purchase additional construction equipment – especially a larger cement mixer. This will enable him to work more quickly and take care of the high demand for his services.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction equipment

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice K. is 38 years old, married with 4 children. Her husband runs a hardware shop, whereas Alice offers  a service of decorating for functions. Their eldest child is 20 years old while the youngest is 13 years old.

Alice is using the loan to  purchase more chairs, tents and decorations. Her services earn her an average profit of  USH 400,00 (1 USD = 1,970.00 USH) per month in a good season. Her dream is to establish a reputable decorating service firm.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs, tents and decorations.

loans.name: Ramona Abadie

texts.es:
La Señora Ramona es casada, tiene 2 hijos menores. Ella tiene 33 años y cuenta con el apoyo de su marido; ambos trabajan en el negocio.

Ambos fueron empleados en una casa comercial y empezaron a vender zapatillas con la indemnización que cobraron por la liquidación del negocio en donde fueron funcionarios (sus dueños se mudaron a su país de origen).

Hoy día la mercería está creciendo y debido a la necesidad de cambiar constantemente las mercaderías solicita el préstamo para  comprar mercaderías para la temporada escolar.

Tiene casa propia, pero es rustico y necesita refaccionar, aun, no tiene capital suficiente para invertir en ella.
texts.en:
Ramona is married and has two young children. She is 33 years old and relies on her husband’s support; they both work in their business. The both were employees in a commercial business and they began selling shoes with the compensation they received when the business liquidated where they were employed (the owners moved back to their country of origin). Today their store is growing and due to the necessity of constantly changing the merchandise she is seeking a loan to buy merchandise for the school season. She has her own home, but it is rustic and needs repair, though she doesn’t have sufficient capital to invest in it.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy general store merchandise, shoes, sandals, and more

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is 49 years old, married, and has 5 children. She sells drinks. She is requesting a loan of $350 (50,000 NGN) to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe A. is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children. She sells palm oil and other food. She is requesting a loan  of $475 (70,000 NGN) to purchase more palm oil and food to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more palm oil and food to sell

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola A. is 62 years old, married, and has 8 children. A. provides laundry services. He requests a loan of $350 (50,000 NGN) to purchase more laundry supplies to effectively provide his laundry services. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase laundry supplies

loans.name: Adegoke

texts.en: Adegoke O. is 36 years old and married with 2 children. All her children are in school. Adegoke sells dried yams for making yam flour. She is requesting for the loan amount of $350 to purchase more dried yam to sell. She says thanks to all the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried yams to sell

loans.name: Tyani

texts.en: Tyani M. is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is requesting for the loan amount of $350 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet K. is 39 years of age and is married to Jimmy Ntambi. The couple has 4 children, the eldest being 16 years old, whereas the youngest is 7 years old. Annet sells clothes in Jinja town, where she rents the stall for USH  200,000 (1 USD = 1,970.00 USH) per month. 

She earns the loyalty of her customers by selling quality products at fair prices. The business earns Annet an  average profit of approximately USH 500,000 per month. Based on her 3 years of experience in the business, Annet dreams of opening up another outlet. The loan proceeds will enable her to replenish her stock of clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Nassuna Aisha Group

texts.en: Aisha is the leader of this four-person group.  She is a 30-year-old single mother of five children between the ages of 13 and 19. All her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She rents a one-room house where where she lives with three of her children; her other children live in the village with her mother. They have electricity but no piped water in their home. The family gets three meals a day. She works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. She operates a ladies salon in Ndeeba. Aisha works seven days a week and uses public transport to get to and from shopping in Kampala. Aisha averages about seven customers a day and works mainly with women and children.  Aisha has been in this business for ten years. She has been a member of MCDT for four years and this is her eighth loan. She wants to buy more braids and creams for her salon.

loans.use: To buy hair creams and braids

loans.name: Laraba

texts.en: Laraba M. is 33 years old and married with 2 children. She sells sarongs. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité  la contacto fue la Señora Doralicia B.  quien vive en la zona del Barrio Fátima de C.D.E.,  madre de  2 hijos, ella se dedica a la Venta de gallinas, ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas  para formar el comité en dicha zona.
El comité se denomina “8 de Diciembre”, está constituido  por 21 señoras muy activas y solidarias, todas de la misma zona.
Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser Venta de: Pantalones, remeras, tomates, cebollas, Ajo, cremas para el rostro,  manzanas, bananas, gaseosas, galletitas, caramelos, melones, sandias, azúcar, leche, aceite, escobas, Trapo de piso, detergente, suavizante, Carnes etc., y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo.
Las señoras retiran un crédito de Gs 300.000 a Gs 800.000 c/u
El Crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para y artículos de primera necesidad para la venta.
texts.en:
The committee was formed by Doralicia B. who lives in the Barrio Fátima zone of C.D.E. She is the mother of two children and works selling chickens. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the committee in the area. The committee is named "December 8", and consists of 21 active and supportive women, all of whom live in the same zone. Each woman sells different types of goods such as: pants, T-shirts, tomatoes, onion, garlic, face cream, apples, bananas, soft drinks, small cookies, caramels, melon, watermelon, sugar, milk, oil, brooms, rugs, detergent, fabric softener, meat, etc. They will also sell anything else that is a new undertaking and creates a steady income. The women want to take out a loan of 300,000-800,000 guarani to be used to purchase merchandise and necessary goods to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of fruit, vegetables, chicken, cosmetics, caramels, drinks, silverware, plastics, clothing, food, ice cream, bread, etc.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu S. is 48 years old. He is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. Abdu sells motor and bicycle spare parts in Iganga. He is using the loan to purchase parts such as rims, tyres, tubes, and brake pads. 

The business earns him an approximate profit of ush 700,000 per month. With eight years of business experience, Abdu looks forward to opening a spare parts wholesale shop. He also dreams of sending his children to the university.

loans.use: Purchasing rims, tyres, tubes, brake pads.

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke A. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs like garri, yam, and plantain. She is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Fatai

texts.en: Fatai is 40 years old and married with 3 children. He sells dried yams for making yam flour. He is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase more dried yam to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried yam to sell

loans.name: Nasaazzi Jane Group

texts.en:
Jane is the leader of a four-member group. She is forty years old and divorced with eight children, aged between 3 and 22 years. Seven of her children go to school and the eldest is working. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She at times gets some assistance from her ex-husband. She resides in and rents a single-room house where she stays with nine people. They have neither electricity nor piped water at home. The family does get three meals a day.

Jane works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She sells charcoal in a Mengo market in one of the city suburbs. She works five days a week and buys charcoal from villages, which incurs extra transport costs. Jane pays a fee of 20000 per month as rent plus an operating license. She sells to an average of 20 customers a day and to all categories of people, mainly on retail. Jane has been in this business for the last 13 years and a member of MCDT for four years. She is servicing her seventh loan, working all along with the same group mates. Before joining the charcoal business, Jane had a restaurant.

Jane is faced with the challenge of the rainy season, which hinders her customers ability to reach out to her and makes transportation of her merchandise difficult as roads become impassable. Her monthly expenses include rent for the business, her children's school fees, and feeding the family. She wants to use this loan to buy more charcoal and to pay school fees for her dependents. She aspires to buy a plot of land and sell only on wholesale.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Ogundare

texts.en: Ogundare is 36 years old and married with 3 children. Ogundare sells dried yams. Dried yams are used for making yam flour. She is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase more dried yam to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more dried yam to sell

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos O. is 60 years old and married with 5 children. He sells dried yams for making yam flour. He is requesting a loan $700 to purchase more dried yam to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried yam to sell

loans.name: Jelilatu

texts.en: Jelilatu O. is 29 years old and married without a child. She is a tailor. She is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Teyode

texts.en: Teyode A. is 36 years old and married with 2 children.  She has a small lodging and drinking spot. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité  fue la señora Lurde G., está casada con el Señor Carlos A. es madre de 2 Hijos ella es Transportista vive en el barrio Fátima de C.D.E. A la señora le agrado mucho el Programa de comité e Mujeres Emprendedoras contacto con sus vecinas y amigas  para formar el comité en dicha zona.

El comité se denomina “Maria Auxiliadora”, está constituido  por 21 señoras muy activas y solidA. todas de la misma zona.

Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser Venta de: Pantalones, remeras, zapatillas, tomates, cebollas, maquillajes, polvo compacto, cremas para el rostro,  manzanas, bananas, gaseosas, galletitas, caramelos, melones, sandias, azúcar, leche, aceite y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo.

Las señoras retiran un crédito de Gs 300.000 a 800.000 Gs
El Crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para y artículos de primera necesidad para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lurde G. founded this group. She is married to Mr. Carlos A., and is the mother of two children. She specializes in shipping, and lives in the Fátima de C.D.E neighborhood. She is very grateful to the group's program and to Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) for the contact she has with her neighbors and friends to form the group in this area.

The group is called "Maria Auxiliadora," and it is comprised of 21 active, united women, all from the same area. They all work in different fields, including sales of pants, t-shirts, shoes, tomatoes, onions, makeup, powders, facial creams, apples, bananas, sodas, cookies, caramels, melons, watermelons, sugar, milk, and oil, while other will begin a new line of work and rely on a fixed income.

The women are taking out a credit of $3050, which will be used to purchase merchandise and necessities for their sales.


Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for retail activities

loans.name: Namatovu Ruth Group

texts.en:
Namatovu is 36 years of age and married with four children aged between 14 and 20 years. She sells ripe bananas to earn a living for her self, she is renting a two roomed house and she has access to electricity and piped water. She does care for additional family members. and they have three meals a day. Her greatest expense at the end of the month is paying tuition for her children.

R. sells her bananas in the market and she works 7 days a week. She pays market dues for the place in which she sells her ripe bananas. She normally receives about 5 customers a day and they are both men and women. She does her business on a retail basis. She has done this business for over 5 years now. The main challenge she faces in this business is that it is seasonal.

R. has been with MCDT for over 5 years now and she has so far received 10 loans. The reason why she joined MCDT is because it is easy to and it was also near the place she does her business. She has worked with her group for 2 years now and she wants to use the loan she is to receive to increase on her stock.

loans.use: To increase her stock of bananas.

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité fue la Señora Cecilia Pico, ella es integrante del comité Medalla Milagrosa del Barrio Fátima, quien le comento a la Señora Zully López quien a su  vez formo el comité en dicha zona. 
El comité se denomina “Tajy Poty”, y está constituido  por 24 señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona.
Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser Venta de: Pantalones, remeras, tomates, cebollas, cremas para el rostro,  manzanas, bananas, gaseosas, galletitas, caramelos, melones, sandias, azúcar, leche, aceite, escobas, Trapo de piso, detergente, suavizante, Carnes, empanadas cadenas, pulseras, pintura, etc., y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo.
Las señoras retiran un crédito de Gs 300.000 a Gs 800.000 c/u
El Crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para y artículos de primera necesidad que lo pondrán a la venta.

Nombre y Apellido	Actividad
Zully Olinda L.	Venta de Ropa
 Leidi L.	Venta de Ropa
Deida M.	Venta Cosméticos
Lida G.	Costura
Silvia G.	Kiosco
Mirta B.	Venta de Ropas y Zapatos
Emiliana T.	Venta de Comidas
Lidia P.(no esta en la foto)	Venta De Comidas
Rosana B.(no esta en la foto)	Venta de Lencería
Marina C.	Cotillón
Cristina P.	Pintura
Celsa M.	Venta de Cosméticos
Dora P.	Venta De Cosméticos
Zoraida B.	Despensa
Maria G.	Despensa 
Margarita S.	Despensa
Maria S.	Copetín
Delia D. 	Venta de Ropas
Selva Díaz	Venta de Plásticos
Sonia P.(no esta en la foto)	Venta De Joyas
Lidia V.	Venta De Ropa
Diona B.	Venta De Ropa
Zully G.	Venta de Joyas
Maria T.	Venta de Huevo y Queso
texts.en:
The group was formed when Cecilia Pico, a member of the Medalla Milagrosa del Barrio Fátima group, talked to Zully López about forming a committee in her neighborhood. The committee López founded calls itself "Tajy Poty" and is made up of 24 very active and supportive women from the same neighborhood. The women make a living in a variety of activities, such as selling: pants, T-shirts, tomatos, onions, facial cream, apples, bananas, soft drinks, cookies, caramels, melons, watermelons, sugar, milk, oil, brooms, cleaning rags, detergents, fabric softeners, meats, empanadas, chains, bracelets, makeup, etc., and others will learn a new trade and make a fixed income. The women increased their loan request from 300,000 Gs to 800,000 Gs, and the money will be used to purchase supplies and items of primary need so they will be able to make sales.

Name Activity

Zully Olinda L. Clothing sales

Leidi L. Clothing sales

Diona B. Clothing sales

Zully G. Jewelry sales

Maria T. Egg and cheese sales


Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise and supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Nakato Hasfa Group

texts.en:
Hasfa N. is 38 years of age and married with five children. She rents a two room house and there a four people living with her. She does care for additional family and they have three meals a day. Her greatest expense is paying tuition for her children at school.

Hasfa N. is a tailor and that is how she earns her living. She works six days a week and rents the shop in which she sews. She receives about ten customers a day and most of them are men. She has done this particular kind of business for seven years now and prior to it she was selling water.

She complains of the rainy season because she receives few customers during that time. She has worked with MCDT for eight years and this is her sixteenth loan. She chose to work with MCDT because it was easy for her to join. She has worked with her group for eight years. She is going to use the loan to buy materials to sell. She wants to continue expanding her business to improve her wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy more materials to sell.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
La señora Genoveva tiene 49 años esta casada con el señor Sixto Zarate tienen 8 hijos 7 estan casados y trabajan y el menor estudia en el colegio.
Anteriormente la señora trabajaba en un taller de costura con el tiempo y experiencia adquirida abrió para su propio taller de costura. Empezó con una sola maquina y ahora pose cuatro.
Su marido se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno.
Quiere ampliar su taller comprando más maquinas de coser y contar con algunos empleados para poder de esa forma dar tambien empleo.
El préstamo que solicitó fue invertido en la compra de una maquina de coser, hilos y telas.-
texts.en:
Genoveva is 49 years old and is married to Sixto Zarate. They have eight children, seven of whom are married and working, and the youngest is in school. Genoveva used to work at a sewing shop, and with the time and experience she acquired you opened up her own shop. She started with a single machine and now has four. Her husband makes a living buying and selling livestock. She wants to expand her shop, purchasing more sewing machines and hiring some employees. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase a sewing machine, fabrics and thread.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine, fabrics and thread

loans.name: Adjakossi Kokou

texts.fr: Monsieur koganou réside dans le quartier d’agoè assiyéyé il tient une boutique de jeux vidéo qu’il a appelé « PLAYSTATION », dans son quartier il est le seul a faire cette activité dans son quartier et cela marche bien pour lui, il veut acheter une autre playstation 2, une télévision un ordinateur P3 des bancs, ventilateurs et transfo c’est pourquoi il demande à wages un crédit, il est marié et a deux enfants à sa charge.
texts.en:
Mr. Kognanu lives in the Agoè Assiyéyé area. He has a video game arcarde which he has named "Playstation." In his area, he is the only one in this business, and this works well for him. He would like to purchase another Playstation 2, a television, a P3 computer, benches, fans, and an electrical transformer. This is why he is seeking a loan (through Wages). He is married and has two children in his care.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy video games, computers, benches, and fans for his store

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
El señor Gilberto A. de 32 años de edad es soltero sin hijos, arrienda un terreno para desarrollar su actividad y vive en el mismo sitio.

Aprendió la actividad de viverista, trabajando con su hermana Teresa en uno de los viveros que posee ésta. Con el objetivo de crecer buscó trabajar por su cuenta y recibió el apoyo de su hermana que le facilitó los insumos y la garantía para sus primeros créditos.
Actualmente es un microempresario sólido que apunta al crecimiento en calidad y sobre todo la satisfacción de sus clientes.

El crédito será destinado a la compra de semillas, púes los proveedores vienen de la Argentina, en intervalos de 45 días.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 32 years old, single and has no children. He rents a plot of land to carry out his plant nursery, and he lives at the same site. He learned the activity by working with his sister Teresa at one of her nurseries. With the goal of going out on his own, he looked for his own work, and his sister supported him by providing him the raw materials and guaranteeing his first loans. Currently he has a sound small business that points to his growing quality and, above all, his customers' satisfaction. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase seeds since suppliers come from Argentina every 45 days.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizer and planting accessories

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and planting supplies for their land

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr: Cet homme a pour activité la menuiserie, il a installé une atelier « Ets béni de l’éternel »dans son quartier à agoè, il a beaucoup de commande c’est pourquoi il sollicite un prêt de wages pour pouvoir s’acheter 50 planches, il fait son activité depuis 2000, il a déjà obtenu un crédit de wages qu’il a bien remboursé. Il est marié et a deux enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Dovi A. is a carpenter by profession, and he has set up a workshop named "Ets béni de l'éternel" in his area in Agoè. He has many orders, which is why is asking for a loan (through WAGES) to buy 50 boards. He has been running his business since 2000. He has already obtained one loan through WAGES, which he repaid without problems. He is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boards

loans.name: Isabelino

texts.es: El señor Isabelino V. nació en la ciudad de Puerto Pinasco, esta casado con Sara Daniela Ortiz con quien tuvo cuatro hijos todos menores aún. Ambos se dedican a la venta de ropas usadas, el negocio lo tienen en su casa pero tambien lo venden en forma ambulante. Por las tardes el señor Isabelino tambien vende productos comestibles como galletitas, caramelos entre otros. Opera con la Fundación desde el año 2007 primero como integrante de un comité de hombres donde tuvieron un buen pago pudiendo hoy día obtener un crédito en forma individual y gracias al financiamiento pudo aumentar sus ingresos como tambien criar cerdos para la venta como otras de sus actividades.
texts.en:
Mr. Isabelino V. was born in the city of Puerto Pinasco, and he is married to Sara Daniela Ortiz. They have four children, all of whom are still young. They both dedicate themselves to selling used clothing, both out of their home and by traveling through the streets. In the afternoons, Isabelino also sells food such as cookies and caramels, among other things. He has been with Fundación since 2007, and began as a member of a group of men that had good payment history. This enabled him to be able to apply for credit as an individual today, and thanks to this financing, he was able to increase his income as well as to begin raising pigs for sale, among other projects of his.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing and accessories

loans.name: Oyelayo

texts.en: Oyelayo S. is 35 years old and married with 3 children. He sells bags of pepper. He is requesting a loan of $1025 to purchase more bags of pepper to sell. He says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of pepper to sell

loans.name: Venicia

texts.en: Venicia V. would like to provide her children and grandchildren with a cement floor. Venicia has five children and 13 grandchildren. She lives in Batey La Grua. She is a widow who operates a successful colmado (small store) to provide clothes and food for her family. After meeting with Venicia at her home, I can attest her situation is difficult, but her courage and strength are inspiring.  She has successfully repaid three business loans, therefore, she qualifies for this home improvement loan.  Please help us make Venicia's dream of a cement floor a reality!  Thank you!

loans.use: A cement floor for her house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu L. is 45 years old and married with 2 children. Idowu sells bags of pepper. He is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more bags of pepper to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of pepper to sell

loans.name: Alira

texts.fr: A. habite dans le quartier de’Agoè assiyéyé, elle a pour activité la vente de bouillie, c’est un commerce qu’elle fait depuis 2004, elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de wages et elle souhaite  se réapprovisionner en produits de première nécessité pour préparer sa bouillie plus précisement 2sacs de mil, 2 sacs de sorgho, 2 sacs de maïs et 2 bidons d’huile. Elle est mariée et à 03 enfants.
texts.en:
A. lives in the Agoè Assiyéyé district. Her work involves selling bouillie (porridge) which is a business she has had since 2004. She has never been the recipient of a WAGES loan, and she would like to supply herself with essential ingredients for making her bouillie, to be exact: 2 sacks of millet, 2 sacks of sorghum, 2 sacks of rice, and 2 drums of cooking oil. She is married and has three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of millet, sorghum, corn, and oil

loans.name: Piyalo

texts.fr: K. pyalo est mariée, son mari est un militaire et elle est mère de 03 enfants, elle habite le quartier de toglé près d’agoé, elle a pour activité la vente de bois de chauffage et de céréales, elle veut agrandir son stock par l’achat de 20bols d’haricots et  25 sacs de charbons. Elle a démarré ce commerce depuis 2004. Elle avec le surplus de revenu qu’elle gagne elle arrive à aider son mari dans les charges du foyer
texts.en:
Pyalo K. is married, and her husband is a soldier. She is the mother of three and lives in the Toglé district, near Agoé. Her work involves selling firewood and grain. She wants to increase her inventory by buying 20 bowls of beans and 25 sacks of charcoal. She started off in this business in 2004. With the extra income she earns, she manages to help her husband to cover household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and grain

loans.name: Balamna

texts.fr: Balamna H. a pour activité principale la vente de céréales, c’est un commerce qu’elle pratique depuis 1998, étant en besoin de se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de wages un prêt pour pouvoir s’acheter 04 sacs de maïs et 8sacs de sorgho. Cela lui permettrai aussi de satisfaire convenablement à la demande. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, son mari est un marin.
texts.en:
Balamna H. works mainly in selling grain. This is commerce she has been doing since 1998. Needing to restock, she is requesting from WAGES a loan to buy 4 sacks of corn and 8 sacks of sorghum. This will also enable her to satisfy the demand appropriately. She is married and the mother of four. Her husband is a sailor.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and sorghum

loans.name: Zenabou

texts.fr:
Cette dame habite le quartier d’agoè démakpoé, elle a pour activité la vente de produits d’alimentation générale et de quelques produits cosmétiques, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1995 e s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé , elle fait son commerce dans sa boutique q’elle appelle ETS MOLA, elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de wages, elle sollicite son premier crédit afin de s’acheter 20 bidons d’huile et 08 sacs de riz. 
Elle est mariée et a trois enfants qui sont à leurs charges.
texts.en:
This is a lady who live in the Agoè Démakpoé district. Her work involves selling groceries and a few cosmetic products. She has been in this business since 1995 and acquires her supplies at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She does commerce at her shop she calls "ETS MOLA". She has never been the recipient of a loan from WAGES and is requesting her first one in order to buy 20 drums of cooking oil and 8 sacks of rice. She is married and has three children, who they support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Koffi Senan

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est très dynamique et a pour activité la vente de produits d’entretien, il va même de maison en maison, de services en services pour convaincre de l’éfficacité des produits qu’il vend, il habite le quartier d’agoè telessou et fait ce cvommerce depuis 2005 il est marié et a un enfant. Il sollicite pour la première fois de wages un crédit pour pouvoir acheter afin d’agrandir son stock 10 cartons de detergeants, 10 cartons de désodorisants et 10 cartons de savons.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who is very dynamic. His work involves selling care and upkeep products. He goes from house to house and agency to agency to convince people of the effectiveness of the products he sells. He lives in the Agoè Telessou district and has been in this commerce since 2005. He is married and has a child. He's requesting a loan from WAGES for the first time. It will be used to expand his inventory through the purchase of 10 boxes of detergent, 10 boxes of deodorant, and 10 boxes of soap.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy maintenance products

loans.name: Noufo Wayi

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de tokoin Soted, elle exerce dans la restauration, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2006, elle a besoin d’acheter des produits de première nécessite pour la restauration  et pour pouvoir varier les plats qu’elle propose c’est pour cela qu’elle s’adresse à wages pour obtenir un prêt afin de s’acheter 3 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs d’haricots et 02 sacs de riz. Elle est mariée et son mari est  un sécretaire administratif, avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce, elle arrive à aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Tokoin Soted district. Her work involves food catering, a business she has been in since 2006. She needs to buy essential ingredients for preparing meals and to vary the dishes she offers. This is why she is enquiring at WAGES to obtain a loan, so as to buy 3 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of beans, and 2 sacks of rice. She is married, and her husband is an administrative secretary. With what she earns from her work, she manages to help him cover day-to-day household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for catering

loans.name: Cusco Sur Group

texts.es:
Este banco se denomina "CUSCO SUR", fundado hace 8 años, permitiendo el desarrollo D. miembros antiguos hasta la actualidad y ellos siguen agrupando a nuevos socios, para darles también la oportunidad que ellos tuvieron, este banco está ubicado en las oficinas centrales en la ciudad del Cusco.

Los miembros integrantes D. este banco, son artesanos D. la zona sur D. la ciudad del Cusco, ellos son 18 miembros  05 mujeres y 13 varones; quienes alternan sus actividades con la elaboración D. artesanía y la exposición D. sus trabajos, el dinero que ellos recaudan les permite llevar a sus hogares una mejor alimentación y alcanzar una educación más justa para sus menores hijos; estos socios llevan en su sangre una técnica ancestral heredada desD. sus antepasados, la cuál plasman en sus obras y permite así seguir cultivando la cultura y trasmitirla año a año.

Nuestros socios, son gente trabajadora y cumplida, por lo que se comprometen a devolver el préstamo que se les otorga en el tiempo determinado, a su vez agradecen su apoyo y el hecho D. soñar con la realización D. sus proyectos.
texts.en:
This bank is called "Cusco Sur" (South Cusco), and was founded 8 years ago, enabling the development of its original members up until the current day, and they continue to acquire new members, so that they too can have the opportunities that the others had. This bank is located in the central offices in the city of Cusco. The eighteen members of this bank are artists from the southern part of the city of Cusco. There are five women and thirteen men and they take turns creating their art and showing it for sale. The money they make allows them to bring home better food and to achieve a more just education for their younger children. These members carry in their blood an ancient skill inherited from their ancestors which shapes their works and allows them to continue creating their culture and transmitting it year after year. Our members, as they are hard-working and accomplished, are committed to paying back the loan that is granted to them in the specified period. They appreciate your support of their dreams of accomplishing their projects.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for their artwork

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en: Bolanle O. is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She sells clothes. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Amistad inicia su tercer ciclo con  20 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de quesos, calzados, abarrotes, ropa, animales menores, leña, elaboración de jugos y farmacia.

Como es el caso de Primitiva que es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Primitiva vende quesos de manera ambulatoria que compra en las ferias.

Por otro lado Elsa es separada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Elsa vende calzados variados en la feria dominical de San Juan, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.

Mientras que Edna que es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Edna tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende abarrotes, actividad que realiza todos los días.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 1000soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total de 14,100 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de queso, arroz, azúcar, zapatos escolares, chompas, pantalones, leña, medicinas, carnes, animales.

Los sueños de las socias son aumentar sus negocios, que sus hijos salgan adelante y sean profesionales, tener los ahorros suficiente para la vejez y progresar.
texts.en:
The Amistad Communal Bank began its third cycle with 20 members. The members have different businesses such as selling cheese, shoes, groceries, clothing, small animals, firewood, production of juices and pharmacology. As is the case with Primativa who is married, is 39 years old and has 5 children, Primitiva sells cheese that she buys in the market from a moving cart. On the other hand Elsa is separated, 44 years old and has 3 children; Elsa sells various kinds of footwear at the Sunday market in San Juan, she acquires her products in the city of Lima. Edna is married, is 40 years old and has 2 children, Edna has a spot in the Nery García market where she sells groceries, an activity that she does every day. The members need different loan amounts as 300 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, 900 soles for a total of 14,100 soles in loans from Banco Comunal. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of cheese, rice, sugar, shoes, school supplies, sweaters, pants, firewood, medicines, meat, animals. The dreams of the members are to increase their business, that their children succeed and become professionals, and to have enough savings for old age and to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Their loans will be invested in the purchase of cheese, rice, sugar, shoes, school supplies, sweaters, pants, firewood, medicines, meat, animals.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth A., 40, is the mother of a boy and girl, both in basic school. Her husband trades in raw gold and its products, and they live in a rented apartment in Simpa, a small farming community a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana.

In order to help her husband meet the demands of the family, for the past four years Ruth has been selling a local food called ‘kenkey,’ which is prepared from corn dough. The dough is first cooked and then balled in a plantain leaf, after which it is boiled again for hours. Kenkey is served hot or cold with stew or ground pepper and fried fish. Ruth supplies to retailers in her community and also sells from a tabletop in the local market square.

She is now requesting a loan to procure bags of maize from farmers in the surrounding communities in order to produce the kenkey in bulk. Ruth needs to increase her profit so as to better provide for the family.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana F., 25, is the mother of a boy and a girl, both in basic school. Her husband is a rubber tapper in one of the nearby villages, and they live in a rented apartment in Asaman, a small farming community a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana.

In order to help her husband meet the demands of the family, Diana has been trading in palm nuts for the past year. Procuring the nuts from farmers in the nearby villages, she treks to other markets to sell to retailers, mostly food vendors. Diana is requesting a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk as she needs to increase her profit to better support her husband’s efforts in providing for the family.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte A. is 32 years old. She is married and has four children, a boy and three girls. Currently, three of Charlotte’s children are in the basic school. The youngest is yet to start school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a small town called Simpa. Simpa is a farming community that is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana.
 
Charlotte sells food stuffs such as cassava and plantains to support her family. She procures cassava and plantains from farmers in the surrounding communities. She supplies them to the food vendors in her community. Charlotte has been in business for 12 years. She wants a loan to procure the food stuffs in bulk so she can distribute them to her increasing number of customers.

It is Charlotte’s dream to provide her children with the best possible education.

loans.use: To procure cassava and plantain

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A., 38, is married and has four children, two boys and two girls. One of her children is in junior high school and the rest are in the basic school. They live in a rented apartment in a small town called Simpa. Simpa is a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana. A.’s husband is a rubber taper. 

Nana sells food stuffs such as yams to support her family. She buys the tubers of yams all the way from Ejura in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She supplies them to the food vendors and retailers in her community. She also treks to nearby markets to do business as well. She has been in business for one year. A. wants a loan to procure the food stuffs in bulk so she can distribute them to her increasing number of customers. It is her dream to support her children to have the best education possible.

loans.use: To procure yams

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate D. is forty–two years old. She is married with four children, a boy and three girls. Kate says her son is in the junior high school while the others are in the basic school. She lives with the family in a rented apartment in a small town called Simpa. Simpa is a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana. 
Charlotte trades to help her husband provide for the family. She deals in food stuffs such as cocoyam, plantain and some vegetables. Her husband is a palm nut farmer.
She procures her goods from farmers in the surrounding communities. She sells in her house to customers who come to buy. Her children also sell in their neighborhood. Kate has been in business for eight years. She wants a loan to buy her  goods in bulk.
She desires to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy bulk cassava and plantain

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Dora es casada, tiene 45 años y 2 hijos, Dora tiene un bar restaurante en su casa en donD. venD. desayuno, almuerzo y por las noches venD. bebidas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. 3 empleados. 
Dora necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cerveza, arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños D. Dora son tener un hotel, una discoteca y que su hija ingrese a la universidad.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the communal bank Capuli. She is married, 45 years old, and has two children. Dora runs a bar and restaurant out of her home where she sells breakfast and lunch by day, and sells drinks by night, work that she performs with the help of three employees. Dora needs a loan for $950 which will be invested in the purchase of beer, rice, and sugar. Dora dreams of having a hotel and a discotheque, and sending her daughter to college.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer, rice, and sugar for the bar/restaurant.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Celia es viuda, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Celia tiene un puesto en un centro comercial ubicado en una avenida concurrida en donD. venD. ropa en especial lencería que es confeccionado por su hijo que tiene un taller en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Celia tiene un bar en un local alquilado.
Celia necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. tela D. la ciudad D. Lima.
Los sueños D. Celia son que su negocio crezca, su ultimo hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the communal bank "Capuli". Celia is a widow, she is 50 years old and has 7 children. Celia has a business in the mall were she sells clothing, especially undergarments that one of her sons sews in a workshop that he has in her house. He works every day to make the undergarments. Besides this Celia operates a bar out of a location that she rents. Celia needs a loan of 1,500 soles which will be used to buy fabric from the city of Lima. Celia's dream is that her business grows and that her youngest son finishes school.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric in the city of Lima

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is forty–five years old. She is married and has five children, three boys and two girls. Felicia says two of her children have completed their tertiary education; two have also completed junior high school and are learning trades. The youngest is in the basic school. Felicia lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment at a small town called Simpa, a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a palm nut farmer while she is a food vendor.
Felicia cooks rice and stew. She says she sells her food by the roadside in the afternoons. 
Felecia says she buys rice from the retailers in her community. She has been in business for four years. It has been her desire to make savings enough to help her husband take good care of the family. She wants a loan to buy bags of local rice in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bulk bags of rice

loans.name: Nuevo Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
el grupo Nuevo Esfuerzo es integrado por tres Señores los cuales son muy amables y muy responsables.  Estas son las actividades que ellos realizan:
Juan C.: se dedica a moler maiz para fabricar tortillas, nacatamales, rosquillas. el tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, tambien el realiza trabajos de albañileria, el atiende a sus clientes del molino de 4:00am hasta las 6:30am, luego lo atiende su esposa. don Juan tiene 64 años y tiene 3 hijos los que gracias a este negocio los ha logrado sacar adelante, actualmente tiene un hijo que esta cursando la Secundaria, el necesita el credito para hacerle unas mejoras a la caseta del molino ya que es de madera y esta en mal estado tambien necesita comprar unos repuestos para el molino.
 Elias M.: el cuenta con un molino para moler Maiz, el se levanta muy temprano a atender a sus clientes desde las 4:00am, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad,  en vista de que hace algunos años tuvo un accidente en una maquina cuando trabajaba en una de las fabricas de elaboracion de cajas para empacar puros, (la maquina le corto los 4 dedos de la mano derecha) fue asi que el decidio emprender este negocio y gracias a Dios le va muy bien, el tiene 5 hijos, una de ellas se graduo de maestra y los demas estan cursando la secundaria, el necesita el credito para poder comprar unos repuestos para arreglar el molino.
 Esteban S.; el sr. S. es Casado, tiene 5 hijos y su actividad principal es la venta de ice cream y conos los cuales los vende de manera ambulante en diferentes barrios y colonias de la ciudad de danli, este negocio la genera ingresos para poder alimentar su familia, actualmente el necesita invertir en producto en vista de que ya viene la temporada de verano y es la epoca de mayor venta, el necesita comprar en cantidades grandes para obtener mejores precios y asi tener una mayor ganancia, el cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos con su negocio,
texts.en:
The Nuevo Esfuerzo (New Force) group is made up of three very friendly and responsible gentlemen. There are their activities: Juan C.: Grinds corn to make tortillas, nacatamales, and rosquillas. He has been doing this for many years, and also works construction. He tends to his customers at the mill from 4:00 am until 6:30 am, after which they are attended to by his wife. Juan is 64 years old and has three children who, thanks to his business, he has been able to help succeed. Presently, one of his sons is attending high school. Juan needs the loan to make some repairs to the building that houses his business, because it is made of wood and is currently in disrepair. He also needs to buy some spare parts for his mill. Elias M.: Also has a mill to grind corn. He gets up early to begin serving his customers at 4:00am. He has been doing this for many years. Some years ago he had an accident with a machine while working in a factory that produced cigar boxes (the machine cut off four fingers from his right hand), and so he decided to start this business and, thanks to God, it's going very well for him. He has five children, one of them a teacher and the others in high school. Elias needs this loan to buy some spare parts for his mill. Esteban S.: Mr. S. is married with five children, and his primary occupation is selling ice cream on foot in different neighborhoods in the city of Danli. This business generates income to be able to feed his family. Currently he needs to invest in merchandise since summer is coming and it's the high season for ice cream sales. He needs to buy ice cream wholesale in order to get better prices and earn higher profits. His children also help him with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ice cream, cups, cones, spare parts for corn-grinding mill, cinder blocks, cement, sand.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy A. is twenty–five years old. She is divorced and has one child, a boy in the basic school. She lives with the family in a rented apartment in a small town called Simpa. Simpa is a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana. Being a single parent, Dorothy works very hard to provide for herself and her son. 
She deals in ready-made clothes for both sexes. Dorothy buys her goods from big boutiques in the cities. She says she treks to nearby markets to do business. Dorothy has been in business for six years.
Dorothy wants a loan to buy varieties of textiles in bulk so she can offer goods in many more places. It is her dream to sponsor her child to have the best of education.

loans.use: To buy dresses

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena K. is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both boys. According to Philomena, both of her children are yet to start school. She says her husband is a laborer in a road construction company. She lives with the family in a house in a small town called Simpa, a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana.
Philomena enjoys trading very much. She runs a provision store to support her husband take care of the family. She procures her goods from nearby markets at wholesale prices. She says her shop is situated in her house. She has been in business for three years. It has been her desire to save enough to sponsor her children to have the best education. She wants a loan to procure provisions in bulk so she can maximize her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure provisions in bulk

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda Q. is twenty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, a girl and three boys. She says her first born is in the junior high school while the rest are in the basic school. She lives with the family in a rented apartment in a small town called Simpa. Simpa is a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana. Matilda works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family.  Her husband trades in gold.
She is a professional hair dresser. She has three apprentices who are currently under training. A number of them have already graduated. Matilda has been in business for as long as nineteen years.
Matilda wants a loan to procure artificial hair, cream, lotion, weave-on, etc. It is her dream to sponsor her children to have the best education.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair, lotion, cream, etc

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T. is twenty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a boy and a girl. She says both of her children are in the basic school. She lives with the family in a rented apartment in a small town called Simpa. Simpa is a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana. Mary works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family.  Her husband deals in second-hand clothes.
She deals in ready-made clothes and ladies’ fabrics. Mary procures her materials from big shops in the nearby big towns. She says she sells in the local market and treks to nearby markets to do business. Mary has been in business for three years.
Mary wants a loan to procure a variety of textiles in bulk so she can trek to many places to do business. It is her dream to sponsor her children to have the best education.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo de 3 mujeres llamado las Triunfadoras se ha formado en la colonia 28 de marzo, sus integrantes son Santos Isabel O. de 45 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, una de sus hijas murio ahogada hace 8 años en una piscina, le a costado reponerse por este acontesimiento, el varon tiene 22 años ya se graduo y tiene un negocio de reparacion de celulares y una niña que esta en la escuela, a todos ellos ha logrado mantener por medio de la venta de cosmeticos, ella necesita el credito para comprar lociones, cremas, shampoos.
Yesenia S. de 20 años de edad, madre soltera y tiene un bebe de 3 meses, el padre no se hizo responsable y le ha tocado cubrir con todos los gastos de su hijo, con la ayuda de la mama que se lo cuida mientras ella trabaja, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa usada enviada de estados unidos, gracias a este negocio esta saliendo adelante pero necesita comprar mas fardos ya que su hijo necesita comida, ropa, pañales, medicamentos y todo esto lo tiene que cubrir ella.
Leonor C. de 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos pero uno ya se graduo, esta trabajando y le ayuda a ella en algunos gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas de lunes a domingo, a la vez tiene la venta de ropa en su casa, ella tiene muchos clientes ya que los clientes que le comprar las tortillas le comprar ropa, ella se separo de su esposo y tiene que pagar todos los gastos de su hogar ya que el no le ayuda en nada.
texts.en:
The three-woman group Triunfadoras has been formed in the 28 of March village. Its members are Santos Isabel O., who is 45 years old and has three children. One of her daughters drowned eight years ago in a pool, which was very difficult and has made it hard for her to get her life back in order. Her son is 22 years old, already graduated and has a cellphone repair shop. Her daughter is still in school. Santos Isabel has been able to provide for them thanks to her cosmetics sales, and she needs a loan to buy lotions, creams, and shampoos. Yesenia S. is 20 years old, a single mother of a 3 month old baby whose father doesn't support them, so she has had to pay for all the costs of child care by herself, with the help of her mother who takes care of the baby while Yesenia works. Yesenia sells shoes and used clothing sent from the United States. Thanks to this business she is putting one foot in front of the other and succeeding, but she needs to buy more merchandise to sell because her baby needs food, clothing, diapers, medicine, and she has to pay for it all herself. Leonor C. is 39 years old, a single mother, and has two children, one of whom has already graduated who is working and helps Leonor with some of the household expenses. She sells tortillas every day, and at the same time also sells clothing in her home. She has many customers who buy both tortillas and clothes from her. Leonor separated from her husband and she has to pay all the household expenses since he does not help her at all.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bundles of used clothing, makeup, firewood, cornmeal, salt, water, lime, and matches.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jazmín Group

texts.es:
El inicio del presente comité fue la señora Sebastiana Z., quien ya habria pertenecido a un comite D. la misma zona D. donD. se retiró por cuestiones personales, invitó y organizó a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras.

La señora Sebastiana Z. se dedica a la venta D. ropa, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. prendas en general y D. esa manera poder sutirse D. mecaderia.

La señora Hortencia Josefina A. se dedica a la venta D. bebidas y helados, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. bebidas y helados al por mayor para luego venderlas.

La señora Paola Beatriz Villamayor se dedica a la venta D. comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. insumo para la elaboración D. los comestibles.

La señora Lourdes Soledad C. se dedica a la venta D.  bebidas, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. bebidas al por mayor para luego venderlas.

La señora Crispina R. se dedica a la ventra D. bebidas, invirtió su dinero en la compra D. bebidas al por mayor y D. esa manera surtir su negocio.

La señora Nilsa Vicenta C. se dedica a la venta D. comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. insumo para su elaboración y ofrecer mayor calidad en su producto.

La señora Ruth Noemi Araujo  se dedica a la venta D. comestible,  invirtió el dinero en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboración D. los comestibles D. esa manera ofrecer mayor variedad

La señora Graciela Ramona Perez se dedica a la costura,invirtió el dinero en la compra D. elementos para su trabajo,  consiguiendo asi comodidas y mayor productividas.

La señora Pabla Elida J. se dedica a la venta D. mercaderias, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. azúcar, aceite, yerba, etc pudiendo asi ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y  aumentar su ingreso.

La señora Maria Crsitina L. se dedica a la venta D. lenceria,  invirtió el dinero en la compra D. esa prendas al por mayor asi ofreciendo mayor variedas a sus clientes

La señora Maria Benita Z. se dedideca a la venta D. ropa, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. prendas en general D. esa manera surtir mas su mercaderia para ofrecer a sus clientes

La señora Mabel Celeste Ramirez  se dedica a la venta D. comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboración D. los comestibles pudiendo asi ofrecer mas variedad D. comidas sus clientes.

La señora Emerenciana A. D. Rolon tiene una despensa, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. mercaderias varias azúcar, yerba, lacteos, bebidas, panificados para surtir su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientela.

La señora Nancy Corolina C. se dedica a la venta D. lenceria, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. esas prendas obteniendo mayor variedad D. prendas para ofrecer a sus clientes.

La señora Liz Natalia Cantero  se dedica a la venta D. Lenceria, invirtió el  dinero en la compra D. esas prendas al por mayor para luego reenvenderlas obteniendo  asi mayor ingreso.

La señora Rosa Cesarina G.  se dedica a la venta D. bebidas, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. bebidas varias pudiendo asi surtir su negocio y ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes.

La señora Johana Marieliz V. se dedica a la venta D. comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. insumo para la elaboración D. los comestible.
texts.en:
The founder of this group was Mrs. Sebastiana Z., who had already belonged to another group in the same area, from which she withdrew for personal reasons. She invited and organized her friends to form part of the Committee of Small Businesswomen program. Mrs. Sebastiana Z. sells clothing, and will invests the money in the purchase of garments in general and in this way can stock up on merchandise. Mrs. Hortencia Josefina A. sells drinks and ice cream, and will use the money to buy drinks and ice cream at wholesale prices to later sell them.
