Mrs. Paola Beatriz Villamayor sells food, and will invest the money in the purchase of ingredients to make food for sale. Mrs. Lourdes Soledad C. sells drinks, and will use the money to buy drinks at wholesale prices to sell. Mrs. Crispina R. sells drinks, and will use the money to buy drinks at wholesale prices in order to stock up her business. Mrs. Nilsa Vicenta C. sells food, and will use the money to invest in the ingredients used in preparing them so she can offer a higher quality product. Mrs. Ruth Noemi Araujo sells food, and will invest the money in purchasing ingredients to make the food she sells in order to offer better variety to her clients. Mrs. Graciela Ramona Perez is a seamstress, and will use the money to buy tools for her work, making it more comfortable and productive. Mrs. Pabla Elida J. sells staple goods, and will use the money to buy sugar, oil, yerba, etc. to be able to offer wider variety to her customers and increase her income. Mrs. Maria Cristina L. sells lingerie, and will use the money to buy merchandise at wholesale so she can offer a wider variety of products to her customers. Mrs. Maria Benita Z. sells clothing, and will invest the money to stock up on the merchandise she sells to her customers. Mrs. Mabel Celeste Ramirez sells food, and will use the money to buy ingredients to prepare the food so she can offer a better variety to her clients. Mrs. Emerenciana A. D. Rolon has a general store and will use the money to buy various merchandise, such as sugar, yerba, dairy products, drinks, and bread to stock up her business and offer better variety to her customers. Mrs. Nancy Carolina C. sells lingerie and will use the loan to buy merchandise to offer a better variety of products to her customers. Mrs. Liz Natalia Cantero sells lingerie, and will invest the money in buy merchandise wholesale to later sell it for a larger profit. Mrs. Rosa Cesarina G. sells drinks, and will use the money to purchase a variety of drinks, thus stocking up her business and offering better variety to her customers. Mrs. Johana Marieliz V. sells food, and will use the money to buy ingredients to make the food she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothing, fabrics, eggs, flour, dairy products, drinks, meats, cold cuts, corn, bread, canned goods, yerba, oil, sweets, vegetables, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Keyla Yolany

texts.es: la Sra. Keyla M. de 27 años de edad y residente en la colonia Villanueva, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos y enchape de oro los cuales los vende en las colonias aledañas de donde ella vive, tambien vende su producto en las camaroneras del sur del pais ya que ella viaja los fines de semana para vender su producto, poco a poco a logrado adquirir varios clientes, ella tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio, dicho negocio le ayuda a sacar adelante a su hija la cual tiene 3 años de edad, ella es madre soltera porque su pareja la dejo abandonada y no le ayuda en nada y por esa razon es que ella lucha para salir adelante con su pequeña hija, con este credito tiene la intencion de surtir mas el negocio y darle mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Keyla M. is 27 years old and lives in the Villanueva district. She has a business selling clothes, shoes, and gold plating, which she sells in neighboring districts. She also sells her products in the shrimping villages in the south of the country during the weekends. Little by little she is increasing her client base. She has been doing this business for five years, which helps her take care of her three year old son. She is a single mother because her partner abandoned her and doesn't provide any support for her or her child, and for this reason she struggles to carry on with her little daughter. With this loan she plans to stock up her business and provide a better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El señor Jose Ramon L. nació en la ciudad de Mbuyapey, es soltero.  Desde hace mas tres años que se dedica a la venta ambulante de artículos comestibles y mercaderias en general Su medio de transporte es una camioneta con lo cual recorre todo el territorio del Chaco, Asunción, Luque y Limpio donde tiene una  buena cantidad de clientes. Gracias al crédito de la Fundación pudo aumentar su inventario y consecuentemente su ingreso familiar.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Ramon L. was born in the city of Mbuyapey and is single. For more than three years he has sold food and general merchandise as a traveling salesman. He has a truck that he uses to travel all over the territories of the Chaco, Asunción, Luque and Limpio, where he has a good number of customers. Thanks to the loans provided by the Foundation, he has been able to increase his inventory and, consequently, his family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bulk food items and general merchandise

loans.name: Sergio Santiago

texts.es: El señor Sergio Santiago labora para una empresa como capturista de informática, su esposa la señora María de Jesús labora como psicóloga de una prestigiosa Institución. Ellos son un matrimonio estable emocional y económicamente, ellos ahora que tienen su casita desean construir toda una barda alrededor para protección de la familia con la adquisición de este préstamo.
texts.en:
Mr Sergio Santiago works for a company as data capturer. His wife Maria de Jesús works as psychologist of a prestigious Institution. They have an emotional and economically stable marriage and now that they have their small house, they want to build a wall around it for protection of the family with the money of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall around the house for protection

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Flor Estela

texts.es:
La señora Flor Estela es promotora de una empresa de carnes frías con la cual tiene una antigüedad de 2 años, su esposo el señor Pablo Chávez es albañil independiente con muchos años de experiencia por lo tanto con mucha clientela. 
Ellos son una familia trabajadora y unida, están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de un techo tipo cochera para la protección de su automóvil.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flor Estela is a promoter of a cold meats company, where she has been working for 2 years. Her husband Pablo Chávez is an independent bricklayer with many years of experience therefore with a big clientele. They are a hard-working and close family, they are requesting this loan to be able to build a roof for their garage for the protection of their automobile.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buid a roof for their garage.

loans.name: Kamuyu Group

texts.en:
This is Amidu J., Mabinty K., Isatu C., and Mamusu K.. They named their group Kamuyu, a Temne phrase for “Be patient.” They are local entrepreneurs from the village of Makump, five miles from Makeni. They buy their goods either from Makeni or the other villages surrounding Makump.

This is the group's sixth request for a Kiva loan through SMT. Previously, each one of them in the group received a loan of 800,000 SLL. That loan had meaningful impacts on the lives of these people. They were able to use the loans to pay for their children’s school fees. They were also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a loan of about $330 (1,000,000 SLL) each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Amidu (right) is the leader of the group. He is 60 years of age and was born in Makump village. He is married to 3 wives and they have 19 children. The eldest is 26 and the youngest is over 1 year old. His wives too are businesswomen; they joined him in the business. Amidu has been a businessman for over 30 years now.

Amidu sells palm kernels. He and his wives walk around the surrounding villages to search for and buy the palm kernels and then sell the palm kernels in Makeni. A pan of palm kernel costs him 1,000 SLL. With his loan, he will be able to buy 30 bags of palm kernels.

Amidu and his wives faces one challenge in their palm-kernel business and it is that of transporting the kernels from the villages to Makump village. Since these are villages, there are no vehicles around to help them transport the kernels. Apart from this, Amidu is doing fine is his business and he enjoys doing it. Your loan will help boost his business, having money in his hands will make him feel good and have piece of mind.

loans.use: Buy at least 30 bags of palm kernels

loans.name: Norma Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Norma Margarita es una microempresaria que se dedica a la venta de quesos, ella cuenta con su cartera de clientes ya que tiene años vendiendo, 
Su esposo le manda un ingreso extra ya que el se encuentra en los estados unidos trabajando y le manda su dinerito cada semana, ella le ha ido haciendo mejoras a su casita pero ahora tiene el proyecto de terminar la losa de concreto del frente de su casa
Para darle un estilo diferente y más moderno es por eso que esta solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs Norma Margarita is a small business woman, she sells cheese. She has her own clients' portfolio since she has been selling it for many years. Her husband sends her an extra revenue since he is working in the United States and he sends some money to her every week. She has been doing improvements to her small house but now her project is to finish the concrete slab in the front of her house in order to have a different and more modern style; that's why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build concrete slab in the front of her house.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Luisa es viuda y tiene 7 hijos, cinco de ellos varones y dos nenas, todos mayores de edad. En el año 1998 mediante una vecina que le convencio de invertir su dinero en la compra de artículos de primera necesidad para luego salir y vender a los vecinos y asi poder obtener alguna ganancia.
Como le fue muy bien en su primera salida decidió dedicarse a eso por lo que recurrió a la Fundacion Paraguaya para capitalizarse.
Lo que muy pronto la señora Luisa quiere hacer es abrir una pequeña despensa en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Luisa is a widow with seven children, five of them male and two female, all grown. In 1998 a neighbor convinced her to invest her money in buying primary goods to go out and sell them to other neighbors in order to make some money. Because this went very well for her the first time around, she decided to continue with this business, so she turned to the Fundación Paraguaya in order to capitalize her business. Soon she would like to open a little store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of oil, sugar, toilet paper, and paper towels.

loans.name: Mirgia Guadalupe

texts.es: la Sra. Mirgia tiene 51 años de edad es muy alegre, trabajadora y dinamica, tiene 16 años de dedicarse a su negocio el cual es un salon de belleza, ella tiene clientes fijos de todos los meses ya que les gusta como les hace el trabajo de corte de pelo, tintes, etc. ella tambien hace iluminaciones, aplica tintes, tratamientos para el pelo, lavado de cabello y tambien vende cremas, shapoos, acondicionadores, esmaltes de uña, cremas perfumadas, ella anteriormente solo se dedicaba a la venta de estos productos pero en la actualidad puso su negocio de salon de belleza, ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas maquinaria que le ayude a hacer su trabajo mas facil, ella necesita comprar maquina para corte de pelo de hombres, cepillos para secar el pelo, planchadora de pelo etc, esto para tener mas clientes y atenderlos como se debe.
texts.en:
Mirgia is 51 years old. She is a happy, dynamic and hard-working person. She has been making a living for the past 16 years as the owner of a beauty salon. She has a set list of clients that come to her salon once a month since they like the work that she does of cutting, styling and coloring their hair. She also does highlights and hair treatments. She gives hair-washes and sells shampoos, conditioners and nail polishes and scented lotions. Before she started her salon, she only worked by selling beauty products. Now that she has the salon, she needs a loan to be able to buy more equipment that will help her to do her job better. She needs to buy trimmers to cut men's hair, brushes to remove hair, a straight iron, etc. Will all of this new equipment, Mirgia will be able to take better care of her clients and to attract new clients to her salon.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clippers to cut men's hair, a straight iron, peroxide, hair dyes and ,cosmetic products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maura Gabriela

texts.es: La señora Maura Gabriela  nació en Luque, esta casada con Oscar Daniel Zelaya con quien tuvo un hijo. Es peluquera mientras que su marido trabaja en un supermercado. Gracias al financiamiento pudo equipar mejor su salón de belleza y comprar algunos artículos de mercerias, cosméticos entre otros, y asi aumentar su ingreso familiar con el servicio que ofrece.
texts.en:
Maura Gabriela was born in Luque and she is married to Oscar Daniel Zalaya, who she has a son with. She is a hairdresser and she works while her husband works a a supermarket. Thanks to the financing she has received, she has been able to make improvements to her beauty salon. She has increased her inventory of beauty products, like cosmetics, and she has been able to increase her family's income with the services that she offers.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products, hair products and general merchandise

loans.name: Fet For Shameness Group

texts.en:
This is Foday K., Bintu K., and Abi K.. They named their group Fet For Shameness. They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. This is their fourth loan from Kiva through SMT. Previously, each of the group members received a loan of 800,000 SLL. That loan created meaningful impacts in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay their children’s school fees. They were also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Now, they are requesting a loan of $1000 (3,000,000 SLL) to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Foday (right) is the leader of the group. He is 35 years old. He was born in Sanya, a village near Kamakwe, in northern Sierra Leone. His wife is a businesswoman and they have five children; four attend secondary school and one is in primary school. He has been a businessman for over 10 years.

Foday sells spare parts for freezers and cold drinks. He plans to use this loan to buy six compressors, two crates of soft drinks, and five crates of “mega” drinks. Foday will have to travel to neighboring Guinea to buy the compressors. In Guinea, a compressor will cost 600,000 SLL ($200).

The greatest challenge facing him in his business is that lack of capital; therefore, he is requesting a new loan again from SMT (Kiva). Once his builds up his capital, he will stop requesting loans. The loans he gets from SMT (Kiva) make his business grow, and consequently make him a happy man, too.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for freezers (six compressors) and cold drinks

loans.name: Mirta Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Mirta está casada desde hace aproximadamente 29 años con el Sr. Saturnino Bernal, con quien tiene 5 hijos, Gustavo, Mario, Hector, Mauricio y Laura, todos ya mayores de edad.
Doña Mirta se dedica a la confección de ropas desde que tenia 17 años que aprendió la profesión con su madre, lo que siempre le sirvió para sustentar a su familia.
Los créditos que la Fundación le otorga los invierte en la compra de telas para luego confeccionar uniformes para estudiantes etc.
Los próximos créditos los quiere invertir en la compra de una maquina de coser industrial
texts.en:
Mirta has been married for about 29 years to Saturnino Bernal, who she has five children with. Her children are Gustavo, Mario, Mauricio and Laura and they are all grown. Doña Mirta has made a living as a seamstress since she was 17 years old. She learned how to do the job with her mother. The job has always allowed her to provide for her family.

With the loan through The Foundation she will be able to buy fabric so that she can then make school uniforms and other uniforms as well. With the rest of the loan she plans to buy an industrial sewing machine.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Fabric

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: La Sra Marta tiene 57 años de edad, ella tiene su propio taller de costura para confeccionar prendas, camisas, faldas, pantalones, chaquetas, hace 33 años se dedica a este negocio, ella desde muy temprano comienza con el trabajo para poder entregar a tiempo sus pedidos, ella es muy agradable, sonriente y muy dedicada a su trabajo, la sra a veces solo cobra la mano de obra ya que los clientes le llevan todos los materiales para que tranaje, pero en otros casos a ella le toca comprar los materiales, ella vive con su madre y pasa al cuidado de ella ya que esta enferma, es soltera y necesita el credito para comprar una maquina de cocer nueva ya que se le arruino la que tenia por muchos años, tambien necesita comprar botones, hilos, aceite, encajes, zippers, su meta para este año es trabajar mas y poder contrar una persona que le ayude a la costura.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marta is 57 years old. She has her own sewing workshop, where she makes garments, shirts, skirts, pants, and jackets. She has spent 33 years in this business. She begins working very early so that she can deliver her orders on time. She is very friendly, cheerful, and is very dedicated to her work. She sometimes only covers her labor since her clients bring the materials for her to work on, but in other cases, she buys the materials. She lives with her mother and takes care of her because she is sick. She is single and needs this loan to buy a new sewing machine since the one that she had for many years is ruined. She also needs to buy buttons, thread, oil, lace, and zippers. Her goal for this year is to work more and to be able to hire a person to help her with sewing.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, fabric, brooches, thread, buttons, lace, and zippers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Venancio

texts.es:
El señor Venancio tiene42 años esta casado con la señora Virginia de  37 años tienen 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en el colegio.

Cuando se conocieron el señor era empleado y la señora también.  Adquirió la profesión de pintor de autos(chapista). Con los ahorros abrieron para su  pequeño taller, que actualmente cuenta con varios clientes, a su señora le  abrió una pequeña despensa para tener mas ingresos.

Quiere ampliar su  despensa ya que cuenta con varios clientes ya formados en su mayoría vecinos.
Le gustaría que en el futuro sus hijos se reciban y que sean grandes profesionales ya que ellos no tuvieron la posibilidad de terminar ni siquiera la secundaria.
texts.en:
Mr. Venancio is 42 years old and is married to Mrs. Virginia, who is 37 years old. They have 2 children that are in high school. When they met, both Mr. Venancio and Mrs. Virginia were employed. He learned to be a metal worker. With their savings, they opened their small workshop, which, at present, has many clients. For his wife, Mr. Venancio opened a small store so that they can earn more income. They want their store to grow since they have many clients already, most of whom are their neighbors. In the future, he would like his children to graduate and became important professionals since he and his wife didn’t have the opportunity to finish secondary school.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, sodas, cookies, and other merchandise

loans.name: Laura Estela

texts.es:
Laura inició el negocio porque necesitaba un ingreso extra para pagar sus estudios. Comenzó el negocio abril del 2006, rento un local en el cual esta instalo un tipo snack donde tiene videojuegos y surtio de comida rapida y frituras asi como fuente de sodas.
Ella ha ido  progresando poco en el negocio debido a que no todas las ganancias son invertidas en el,  ya que la mayoria de los recursos adquiridos son para gastos de sus estudios, y su progreso personal.


Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $3000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas para adquirir mercancía que le permitirá tener un mayor inventario, y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Laura began her business because she needed extra income to pay for her studies. She began the business in April 2006. She rents a location, in which she installed a snack bar, where she has video games and supplies fast food and fried foods, including a soda fountain. She has been making a little progress in the business since not all of her earnings are invested in the business. The majority of the resources she earns are for expenses on her studies and for her personal progress. She needs a loan for MXN $3000, which she will repay in 8 fourteen-day installments. With the loan, she will buy merchandise that will allow her to have a better inventory and to be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Sabenty Group

texts.en:
This is Abdul K., Kadiatu K., and Kadiatu F.. They named their group Sabenty. They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Makeni. This is their sixth loan from SMT. Their most recent loan provided each of them 1,000,000 SLL. That loan created meaningful impacts in the lives of these people. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They also are able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. They are requesting a loan of $1000 (3,000,000 SLL) to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Abdul (right) is the leader of the group. He is 38 years of age. He was born in Makump village, five miles from Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has four children. One of his children is in primary school, two are in secondary school, and the youngest is not school-aged. His wife is also a businesswoman. Abdul sells groceries, including palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, potatoes, cassavas, oranges, and cigarettes.

With this new loan, Abdul will expand his business. He will be able to buy at least one carton of cigarettes, four bags of rice, and ten barter (five gallons make a barter) of palm oil. Abdul sometimes buys his goods from Makeni or the villages surrounding Makump. He then takes them to Freetown, where he sells them.

So far, Abdul faces no major challenges in his business. Business is going well for him and he enjoys doing it. Through the loans from SMT and Kiva, he has been able to build himself a house worth $1666 (5,000,000 SLL). With this loan, and the income it will generate for him, Abdul plans to build himself another house.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó con varias señoras del comité Mujeres Activas del barrio 3 de mayo el cual se disolvió, ellas decidieron formar el nuevo comité Mujeres Solidarias. Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el 7º ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y esta integrado por 15 señoras, las mismas tienen diversas actividades.

La señora Alba Rosa T. de Romero se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de remeras, pantalones, blusas, baqueros y otros al por mayor para su posterior venta.

La señora Leonora A. de Caballero tiene una despensa en su casa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderias para el incremento de su negocio.

La señora Silvina Vera B. se dedica a la venta de helados  e invirtió el dinero en la compra de helados al por mayor para su venta posterior.

La señora Feliciana L. se dedica a la venta de bebidas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de gaseosas y cervezas para su venta posterior.

La señora Victorina M. es modista y tiene un taller de costura en su casa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para su taller.

La señora Mirna Raquel R. se dedica a la venta de comestibles e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los comestibles.

La señora Evelia S. tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderias para surtir su negocio.

La señora Rosa Marilina C. es modista e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para el incremento de su taller de costura.

La señora Nilda Karina M. se dedica a la venta de helados e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos al por mayor para su venta posterior.

La señora Nitalicia V. se dedica a la venta de bebidas e invirtió su dinero en la compra de gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor para su posterior venta.

La señora Mercedes S. se dedica a la venta de helados e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos al por mayor para su venta posterior.

La señora Juana Bernal se dedica a la venta de mercería e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos para el incremento de sus negocio.

La señora Nancy Mabel Díaz realiza venta de  mercería e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos para el incremento de sus negocio.

La señora Antonia Pabla M. tiene una granja e invirtió el dinero en la compra de alimentos para sus animales.

La señora María S. Hermosilla se dedica a la venta de lencería y cosmeticos e invirtió el dinero en la compra mercaderias para la venta de los mismos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of a number of women from the Mujeres Activas group of the 3 de mayo neighbourhood, a committee which no longer exists. These women decided to create a new group Mujeres Solidarias. This group which is made up of 15 women who have a variety of businesses is now in its seventh loan cycle with the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras programme. Alba Rosa T. de Romero sells clothing and has invested her share of the loan in the bulk purchase of T-shirts, pants, blouses, jeans and other clothing. She will retail the clothing which she has purchased in bulk. Leonora A. de Caballero has a store in her home and invested her share of the loan in the purchase of merchandise to stock her business. Silvina Vera B. sells ice cream and invested her share in the bulk purchase of ice cream for later resale. Feliciana L. sells refreshments and invested her share of the lon in the purchase of soft drinks and beer for retail. Victorina M. is a dressmaker and has a workshop in her home. She invested her share of the loan in the purchase of materials for her workshop. Mirna Raquel R. sells food and bought ingredients to prepare meals. Evelia S. has a store and invested her share of the loan in the purchase of merchandise to stock her business. Rosa Marilina C. is a dressmaker and invested her share of the loan in the purchase of material for her workshop. Nilda Karina M. sells ice cream and invested her share in the wholesale purchase of goods to retail later. Nitalicia V. sells refreshments and invested her share of the loan in the wholesale purchase of soft drinks and beers to retail later. Mercedes S. sells ice cream and invested her share in the wholesale purchase of raw materials for later retailing. Juana Bernal sells merchandise. She invested her share of the loan in the purchase of goods to stock her business. Nancy Mabel Díaz sells merchandies and invested her share in the purchase of goods to stock her business. Antonia Pabla M. owns a farm and invested her loan in the purchase of feed for her livestock. María S. Hermosilla sells lingerie and cosmetics and invested her share of the loan in the purchase of merchandise to retail.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, jackets, busos, shirts, flour, rice, noodles, sugar, bakery, tea, milk, ice cream, soda, beer, yarn, fabrics, meat, discs for empanadas, vegetables, oil, napkins, shampoo, belts, handbags, lingerie, cosmetics, among others.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó con la invitación que les hicieron las señoras del comité Las Mercedes a las vecinas del barrio de formar un nuevo grupo, por lo que se creo el comité Virgen de las Mercedes el cual actualmente esta conformado por 19 integrantes quienes tienen diversas actividades.

La señora Lourdes López es modista e invirtió el dinero en la compra de telas e hilos para la confección y venta de prendas.

La señora Graciela T. tiene una despensa en su casa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderias para el incremento de su negocio.

La señora Idelina V. se dedica a la venta de dulces y a la alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de dulces al por mayor y de insumos de alfarería.

La señora Benigna G. se dedica a la venta de dulces y a la alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de dulces al por mayor y de insumos de alfarería.

La señora Wilma M. se dedica a la alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de arcilla y pinturas para la elaboración de su alfarería.

La señora Dionicia G. se dedica a la alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de arcilla y pinturas para la elaboración de su alfarería.

La señora Gladys M. tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderias para surtir su negocio.

La señora María Marta T. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comestibles e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para el incremento de su negocio.

La señora Simplicia B.  tiene una despensa en su casa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderias para el incremento de su negocio.


La señora María José M. se dedica a la alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de arcilla y pinturas para la elaboración de su alfarería.

La señora Maxima B. se dedica a la venta de dulces e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los mismos.

La señora María Magdalena M. se dedica a la venta de dulces e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los mismos.

La señora Norberta C. se dedica a la alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de arcilla y pinturas para la elaboración de su alfarería.

La señora Alicia C. se dedica a la venta de dulces e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los mismos.

La señora Sonia S. se dedica a la alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de arcilla y pinturas para la elaboración de su alfarería.

La señora Isabel Ruíz Díaz se dedica a la alfarería e invirtió el dinero en la compra de arcilla y pinturas para la elaboración de su alfarería.

La señora Juana C. se dedica a la venta de frutas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de frutas al por mayor para su venta posterior.

La señora Mercedes F. se dedica a la venta de dulces e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los mismos.

 La señora Cecilia S. se dedica a la peluquería e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos para incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
This group was formed at the request of the women of Las Mercedes to their neighbors to form a new group, which became the "Virgen de las Mercedes" group which currently has 19 members with diverse economic activities. Ms. Lourdes López is a dressmaker and invested her money in the purchase of fabrics and yarn to create and sell garments. Ms. Graciela T. has a store in her home and invested her money in the purchase of merchandise to increase her business. Ms. Idelina V. makes and sells sweets and pottery and invested her money in the wholesale purchase of sweets and ingredients to make ceramics. Ms. Benigna G. also makes and sells sweets and pottery and invested her money in the wholesale purchase of sweets and the material to make ceramics. Ms. Wilma M. is a potter and invested her money in the purchase of potter's clay and paints to create these ceramics. Ms. Dionicia G. is also a potter and invested her money in the purchase of potter's clay and paints to create ceramics. Ms. Gladys M. has a store and invested her money in the purchase of merchandise to stock her store. Ms. María Marta T. produces and sells food items and invested in the purchase of ingredients to increase her business. Ms. Simplicia B. has a store in her home and invested in merchandise to stock her store. Ms. María José M. is a potter and invested in potter's clay and paint to make ceramics. Ms. Maxima B. makes and sells sweets and invested in the purchase of supplies to make those sweets. Ms. María Magdalena M. also makes and sells sweets and invested in the purchase of ingredients to make those sweets. Ms. Norberta C. is also a potter and invested in potter's clay and paint to make ceramics. Ms. Alicia C. also makes and sells sweets and invested in the purchase of ingredients to make those sweets. Ms. Sonia S. is also a potter and invested in potter's clay and paint to make ceramics. Ms. Isabel Ruíz Díaz is also a potter and invested in potter's clay and paint to make ceramics. Ms. Juana C. sells fruits and invested in the wholesale purchase of fruits to improve her future sales. Ms. Mercedes F. also makes and sells sweets and invested in the purchase of ingredients to make those sweets. Ms. Cecilia S. has a beauty shop and invested her money in supplies to increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics, thread, flour, rice, noodles, sugar, bread, tea, milk, sweets, potter's clay, paint, meat, empanada dough, vegetables, oil, napkins, shampoo, cream, and cosmetics among others

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos G. es de Jejui-Choré casado, tiene 53 años, con casa propia,  con 3 hijos.

         Es propietario de una despensa con 8 años de funcionamiento, con buena ubicación, clientela formada, esta ubicado en frente de la Laminadora Alpacasa.

        Son muy conocidos de la zona, pobladores de hace mucho tiempo, muy responsables, sueña en habilitar una carnicería en la ciudad de Gral. Resquin distante a 5 Km. de su domicilio.
texts.en:
Carlos G. comes from Jejui-Choré. He is married, 53 years old, owns his home and has three children. He has owned a store for eight years; it is well-located in front of the Laminadora Alpacasa. and has a loyal clientele. They are very well known in their neighbourhood having lived there a long time; they are very responsible as well. He dreams of setting up a butcher shop in the city of General Resquin, 5 kilometres from his home.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Augustin

texts.es:
El   Señor Agustin Zorrilla Cano es de la Ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Niño Jesus, tiene casa propia,  con 50 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Amada Pera con 43 años de edad,   Tienen 4 Hijos, todos en edad Escolar.

Posee una Merceria en el centro de la ciudad, cerca del Mercado Municipal de Santani, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales.

El cliente sueña en construir un salon de material en su propia casa para tener otro negocio y asi obtener mejor ingreso para el bien de su familia.
texts.en:
Agustin Zorrilla Cano comes for the neighbourhood of Niño Jesus in the city of San Estanislao. He owns his home, is 50 years old and married to Amada Pera, 43. They have four school-aged children. He owns a clothing store downtown near the municipal market of Santani. He has a loyal customer base, good income, good business and personal references. The client dreams of building a fabric store in his own home in order to have another business and thus make more money for his family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital (Purchase of goods such as jeans, shirts, T-shirts, shoes)

loans.name: Elsa Ramona

texts.es:
La   Señora Elsa Ramona C. es de la Ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Fatima, tiene casa propia,  con 47 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Narciso Gonzalez con 46 años de edad,Tienen 3 Hijos, todos  mayores de edad trabajan independientes.

Posee una despensa en su domicilio particular, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, su marido es vendedor de quinielas, le ayuda economicamente.

El cliente sueña en obtener un capital de trabajo con mayor montos para cargar su negocio y asi obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa Ramona C. is from the Fatima neighborhood of San Estanislao City. She has her own home, is 47 years old, and is married to 46 year old Mr. Narciso Gonzalez. They have 3 children, all adults who work independently. They own a small convenience store in their home, with a well-established clientele, good income, and good commercial and personal references. Her husband sells lottery tickets and helps her economically. The client dreams of obtaining a large amount of working capital to supply her business and subsequently have greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a pool table

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
El   Señor Eusebio I. Candia es de la Ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Ycua Tui, que se encuentra a 7 Km. de la ciudad de San Estanislao,  tiene casa propia,  con 53 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Julia Lezcano con 48 años de edad,Tienen 3 Hijos, todos  mayores de edad trabajan independientes.

Posee una despensa en su domicilio particular, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, Ademas se dedica en la agricultura y ganaderia, posee 7 has. Finca con produccion bien diversificados, ganados vacunos y otros.

El cliente sueña en construir  un salon de material para su negocio y asi obtener mejores servicios e ingresos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eusebio I. Candia is from San Estanislao in the Ycua Tui neighborhood, located 7 km from San Estanislao. He is a 53 year-old homeowner. He is married to Julia Lezcano, who is 48 years of age. They have three adult children, all who work and are independent. He runs a pantry from his home. He has a well-established clientele, good income, and good personal and business references. He is also in agriculture and ranching. He owns 7 hectares of land. He counts with a diversified production, cattle and others. His dream is to build a storage room for his business to obtain an increase in revenue and to provide better services for his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital for purchase of goods: sugar, rice, flour, herbs, noodles

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La  señora Lidia Isabel G. Villar, es de San Estanislao, tiene casa propia, soltera, de 31 años de edad.

Es propietaria de una casa comercial, que esta ubicada en el mercado de dicha ciudad, con 3 años de funcionamiento, con clientela formada y un buen ingreso ya que tiene buenos tratos con los clientes.

Desea ampliar su local para poder trabajar y aumentar su rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Lidia Isabel G. Villar is from San Estanislao. She owns her own home, is 31 years old and single. She has owned a business located in the city market for three years. She has a loyal customer base and good income as she has a good relationship with her customers. She wants to expand her location in order to work and increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Victorio

texts.es:
El   señor Victorio C. Romero  es de la Ciudad de Chore, tiene casa propia,  con 43 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Juana Bautista Garcia de C. de 41 años de edad, tienen 4 hijos.

        Es propietario de una despensa con 6 años de funcionamiento, tambien realiza repartos de mercaderias, tiene un automóvil marca Toyota en el cual se desplaza, tambien se dedica a la agricultura.

Sueña en ampliar su local para poder cargar mas de mercaderias y asi aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Victorio C. Romero is from Chore, and is a 43 year-old homeowner. He is married to Juana Bautista Garcia de C. who is 41 years of age. They have four children together. He has been the owner of a store for six years. He also does deliveries in his Toyota. Mr. C. is also in agriculture. His dream is to grow his store in order to buy more goods to improve his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital for  purchase of goods

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, ella elabora dos tipos de tortillas, tortillas de tamaño normal y las otras especiales para tacos que son mucho mas grandes, estas las hace por encargo, ya que ella tiene contrato con el restaurant Shalom, las otras las vende en la casa y sale a repartirlas en la colonia, a mucha gente les gustan sus tortillas, ella toda su vida se a dedicado a este negocio y le gusta mucho, vive con su hija y con su esposo el cual trabaja de motorista de tegucigalpa a choluteca en una empresa de transportes, ella necesita credito para comprar maiz, leña, cal, sal todo esto para tener una mejor produccion y mejores ventas ya que quiere comprarse una maquina industrial para hacer tortillas y asi tener una mayor produccion.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha has 20 years of experience in making and selling tortillas. She makes two types of tortillas: regular-sized tortillas and much larger tortillas for tacos. She makes the latter per advance order because she has a contract with the Shalom restaurant. The other tortillas she sells at home and delivers them throughout her neighborhood. Many people like her tortillas. She has dedicated herself to this business all her life and she likes it a lot. She lives with her daughter and her husband who works as a driver covering the Tegucigalpa to Choluteca route for a transport company. She needs credit to buy corn, firewood, lime, salt in order to improve her production and sales. She wants to buy an industrial machine to make tortillas and thus have a better production.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, firewood, lime, water, matches, pans

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dunia Lizeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Dunia P. se dedica al comercio, tiene una pulperia ubicada en la aldea de Chichicaste, Jamastran, su negocioopera bajo el nombre de pulperia Dunia, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años y es notable que durante este tiempo la a podido administrar.
ella es casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia, tienen un hijo el cual depende de ellos al 100%.
con los ingresos que este negocio le genera ella cubre al 100% los gastos familiares pero necesita mas ingresos para poder seguir estudiando ya que ella es graduada del bachiller en administracion de empresas y desea estudiar en la universidad. ella necesita el credito para surtir su negocio ya que en la actualidad no cuenta con capital para poder comprar mercaderia.
texts.en:
Dunia P. dedicates herself to commerce. She owns a local convenience store in the village of Chichicaste in Jamastran. Her business operates under the name "Pulperia Dunia". She has done this for three years, and it's worth noting that during this time, she has been able to manage it. She is married and her husband dedicates himself to agriculture and ranching. They have a child who fully depends on them. With the revenue she derives from this business, she covers all of her family's expenses but she needs more income in order to keep studying. She graduated high school graduate with a focus on business administration and she desires to pursue university studies. She needs the credit to supply her business because she does not have the capital to purchase goods.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, lard, soap, toilet paper, noodles, coffee, chicken, eggs, dairy products, beans, soups, churros, soft drinks, and cookies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hekokatuva Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de San Roque González en la Cñia Matachi distante a 7km de la oficina de Carapeguá uñas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa . 
Estas Señoras son activas la mayoría de ellas son vendedoras ambulante ellas venden ropas,lencerías  y otras actividades ya mencionados mas arriba .Ellas buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar atravez del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida .
Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual

Este grupo tiene 15 integrantes, pero en este ciclo solo 12 van a recibir parte del prestamo.  Esta lista de integrantes incluye los miembros que no van a recibir dinero en este ciclo.

Wilma A.	Docente
Nancy V.	Venta de ropa 
Miryan Rogriguez	Vendedora
Vilma Montiel	Venta de lencería
Dionicia B.	Docente
Dorila Martínez	Venta de chipa
Zulma C.	despensa
Marcelina A. 	Venta de chipa
Felicia V.	Venta de queso
Catalina B.	despensa
Liliana C.	Venta de ropas
Obdulia C.	Limpiadora centro de salud
Lourdes C.	Venta de lencería y minicarga
Diana V.	Venta de ropas
Zunilda C.	modista
texts.en:
Seven kilometers from Carapeguá in San Roque González in Matachi, several women with low income found out about Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Women Entrepeneur's Committee) and decided to get together to receive information about the aforementioned program. These women are economically active. The majority are merchants who sell clothes, lingerie among the activities mentioned on this page. They seek a little more support through credit in order to increase their income and improve their quality of life. They need this loan to invest in their respective jobs and thus achieve a common and individual sustainable growth. The group has 15 members, but in this cycle only 12 will receive part of the loan. The list of members includes those who will not receive money in this cycle. Wilma A. Teacher Nancy V. Clothing sales Miryan Rogriguez Merchant Vilma Montiel Lingerie sales Dionicia B. Teacher Dorila Martínez Bread sales Zulma C. Pantry Marcelina A. Bread sales Felicia V. Cheese sales Catalina B. Pantry Liliana C. Clothing sales Obdulia C. Janitor at a health center Lourdes C. Lingerie sales and forklift operator Diana V. Clothing sales Zulma C. Clothing designer

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The majority of Comité's members invested their credits in their current activities as described above (clothes, noodles, sugar, herbs, rice, drinks, cloths, starch, corn flour, etc.)

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapegua distante a 1km de la oficina de Carapeguá uñas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa . 
Estas Señoras son activas la mayoría de ellas son Artesanas,vendedoras,modista,peluqueras y otras actividades ya mencionados mas arriba .Ellas buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar atravez del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida .
Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.

Este grupo tiene 15 integrantes en total, pero en este ciclo solo 14 solicitaron un prestamo.  La lista abajo incluye todos los integrantes.

Luciana  B.	Artesana
Rosa J. 	Alquiler de sillas

Rafaela C.	Artesana

Celsa R.	Empleada

Sila B. 	Tejedora
Mirian C.	Peluquera
Lidia C.	Modista
Suny B.	Tejedora
texts.en:
One kilometer from the Carapeguá office in Carapeguá, several women with low income found out about Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Women Entrepeneur's Committee) and decided to get together to receive information about the aforementioned program. These women are economically active. The majority are artisans, merchants, confectioners, hair stylists, or are involved in the activities mentioned on this page. They seek a little more support through credit in order to increase their income and improve their quality of life. They need this loan to invest in their respective jobs and thus achieve a common and individual sustainable growth. This group has 15 total members but in this cycle only 14 asked for a loan. The list below includes all the group's members. Luciana B. Artisan Rosa J. Chair rentals Maria B. Merchant Rafaela C. Artisan Maria Estela S. Employee Valeriana M. (Not pictured) Seamstress Jacinta Paredes (Not pictured) Pottery sales Ma-Francisca B. Merchant Nerlis B. Employee Celsa R. Employee Maria Bernardita S. Cheese sales Sila B. Seamstress Mirian C. Hair stylist Lidia C. Clothing designer Suny B. Seamstress

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The majority of Comité's members invested their credits in their current activities as described above (clothes, rags, thread, shampoo, conditioner, etc.)

loans.name: Tembiapo Porâ Group

texts.es:
Comité Tembiapo Porâ se denomina el grupo conformado en fecha 06 de marzo del 2008, gracias a que la actual Directora General Luz Teresa Giménez, se contacto con la asesora comunicándole que ha conseguido juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando con el Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras ya en el 4º ciclo, todas las integrantes del grupo se encuentran muy contentas trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria.
El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de 500.000 Gs.,lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como venta de ropas de Ao-po´i, venta de  comestibles, venta de mercerías, venta de exhibidores de vidrio, confección de ropas, compra de mercaderías para la despensa (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.),venta de artículos de librería, venta de accesorios para peluquería, manicura y pedicuro, venta de lencerías, etc.
Todas ellas están muy conformes trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya.

Este grupo tiene 16 integrantes pero en este ciclo solo 15 solicitaron un prestamo.  La lista abajo incluye todos los integrantes. 

Nombre y Apellido	Actividad

texts.en:
The Tembiapo Porâ Group was founded on March 6, 2008, thanks to Director Luz Teresa Giménez, who had contacted the adviser to communicate that she had gathered 16 women through the Women Entrepreneurs Group, now in it's 4th cycle. All of the group participants are delighted to be working together and in solidatirty.

El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de 500.000 Gs.,lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como venta de ropas de Ao-po´i, venta de comestibles, venta de mercerías, venta de exhibidores de vidrio, confección de ropas, compra de mercaderías para la despensa (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.),venta de artículos de librería, venta de accesorios para peluquería, manicura y pedicuro, venta de lencerías, etc. Todas ellas están muy conformes trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya. Este grupo tiene 16 integrantes pero en este ciclo solo 15 solicitaron un prestamo. La lista abajo incluye todos los integrantes. Nombre y Apellido Actividad Luz Giménez Venta de Ao - po´i Raquel Olmedo Venta de Ao - po´i Liz O. Venta de lencerías Blanca L. Venta de bebidas María S. Venta de exhibidores de vidrio María C. Venta de comidas y bebidas Isabel V. Despensa Catalina V. Costurera Claudia A. Venta de comidas y bebidas Maura V. Venta de mercerías y cubiertos. Dora R. Venta de mercerías. Olga Z. Venta de artículos de librería Eulalia V. Costurera Gertrudis V. Venta de ropas Lourdes C. Peluquería, manicuro y pedicuro María Q. Venta de comidas

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (rice, sugar, greens, dairy products,  breads, sodas, other drinks, ingredients, fabric and needles for clothesmaking, notions, Ao-po´i clothes, books, hair and nail care products, glass, linnens, etc.

loans.name: Sagastume 3 Group

texts.es:
la Sra. Rosa Elia M. es la cordinadora del grupo tiene 54 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de lociones, cremas, ropa de dama, caballeros y niños, tambien se dedica a la venta de nacatamales en su casa de habitacion, esta actividad tiene varios años de hacerla y con ello a podido levantar su casa.  
 La Joven Veronica L. de 37 años de edad la cual se dedica a la sastreria, ella confecciona ropa de dama, vestidos para novias, pantalones, actividad que realiza desde varios años, ella tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion.  La joven Kare G. de 26 años de edad se dedica a la elaboracion de collares, anillos y pulseras de piedras y plata, actividad que realiza hace 3 años y que tiene bastante demanda, este producto se vende bastante ya que las mujeres ahora usan mucho la fantasia, cabe mencionar que las 3 integrantes del grupo han salido adelante con sus negocios y han podido dar el sustento en sus hogares, tanto en alimentacion como estudios y salud. ellas estan solicitando un credito para poder invertir en sus negocios y poder incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Elia M. is the coordinator of the group. She is 54 years old and works selling lotions, creams, and clothing for men, women, and children. She also works selling tamales in her home, an activity she has done for many years, which allowed her to build her house. Miss Veronica L. is 37 years old and works as a tailor. She has made ladies' clothing, wedding dresses, and pants for many years. She has her business in her home. Miss Kare G. is 26 years old and works making necklaces, rings, and bracelets of stones and silver. She has done this for 3 years and there is plenty of demand and these products sell very well since the women wear lots of costume jewelry. It stands to mention that the three members of the group have been able to get ahead with their businesses and have been able to provide sustenance to their homes in food, studies, and health. The are asking for a loan to be able to invest in their businesses and increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The buy men's women's and children's clothing, silver bracelets, and tamales

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Oved

texts.es: Don Oved Zeledón vive en la zona # 4 de Nueva Guinea, esta solicitando su 3er crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para continuar mejorando su vivienda, lo que desea hacer ahora es repellar la habitación  de su casa. Trabaja como docente en la  Universidad URACCAN desde 5 años, se ha caracterizado por ser un joven  profesional, muy responsable y honesto, ha demostrado  buena conducta y moral crediticia y profesa la religión cristiana, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar,  a pesar que esta joven pareja no tienen hijos, son una pareja con alto espiritu de superación profesional y personal. Obved con el crédito anterior logro satisfactoriamente construir una habitación para una mejor comodidad de su familia, esta pareja aspira tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones para cuando nazca su primer hijo.
texts.en:
Oved Z. lives in Zone #4 in New Guinea. He is requesting a loan for the third time through AFODENIC (Kiva Field Partner) to continue improvements to his home. He hopes to plaster the walls of his house. He has been workign as a teacher in the University of Uraccan for the past 5 years. He is known as a young professional, very responsible and honest. He has demonstrated good conduct and and financial responsibility, and he is of the Christian religion. His wife runs the house, and even if they do not have any children they are a happy couple wanting professional and personal betterment. With the past loan, Oved built a home for the greater comfort of his family. This couple aspires to have a home with better amenities to welcome their first child.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Doña María Mercedes, es casada, trabaja como docente en la escuela Vigarmy Flores, tiene 3 hijos: el mayor tiene 27 años de edad, trabaja como docente igual que su mamá, la otra hija tiene 20 años estudia 1er año en la universidad Uraccan y el menor tiene 13 años estudia su 6to grado de educación primaria, esta solicitando su 8vo crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo en cambiarle zinc a su casa de habitación (compra de zinc y perlines) ya que se encuentra en malas condiciones, su compañero de vida trabaja en la finca como agricultor, ambos comparten los gastos del hogar y los compromisos adquiridos con AFODENIC, a pesar que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos, se caracterizan por ser muy responsables y humildes, esta familia son muy queridos por su comunidad ya que esta maestra tiene 21 años de impartir el pan de la enseñanza a los niños de su comunidad,  su sueño es tener salud, trabajo y una vivienda bonita para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is married and she is a teacher in the Vigarmy Flores school. She has 3 children: the eldest is 27 years old and works as a teacher, like his mother; her daughter is 20 years old and is in her first year of university at the University of Uraccan; and, the youngest is 13 years old and is in grade 6. She is requesting a loan for the 8th time through AFODENIC (Kiva Field Partner) to invest in changing the zinc and purlins of their roof (to purchase zinc and purlins) because it is in need of replacing. Her life partner works as an agriculturer, both sharing the household expenses and the compromises made to AFODENIC. Eventhough they are a family of limited financial resources they are known as very responsible and humble people. This family is very loved by their community especially because she has been a teacher for 21 years teaching the children of their community. Her dream is to be in good health, to have work and to have a beautiful home for their family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the roof, to purchase purlins

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Doña Flor de María, es soltera,  trabaja en el hospital Jacinto Hernández en Nueva Guinea desde hace 25 años como auxiliar de enfermeria, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad que a pesar que no estan a su cargo  económicamente viven con ella en su casa y le ayudan con los gastos familiares del hogar,  ella es madre y padre para sus hijos los enseñó a trabajar y a estudiar para ser personas de bien, su hija mayor de 28 años trabaja como analista de crédito en la Curacao y el menor de 25 años trabaja como docente.  Flor de Maria esta solicitando su 7mo crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo en pintar la casa y hecharle el piso a la cocina, es una mujer muy querida en Nueva Guinea y en su centro de trabajo por ser una persona de buen vivir, responsable, trabajadora y  sociable en su comunidad, su sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y llegar a conocer a sus nietos, tener salud y que su familia siempre permanezca unida.
texts.en:
Flor de María is single and has worked a the Jacinto Hernández Hospital in Nueva Guinea for the past 25 years as a nursing assistant. She has two grown-up children who, even though she's not their economic provider, live with her in her home and help with household expenses. She is mother and father to her children and taught them how to work and study so they would be good people. Her eldest daughter is 28 years old and works as a credit analyst in Curacao, and her youngest son is a teacher. Flor is requesting her seventh loan through Kiva partner AFODENIC to invest in painting her home and reflooring her kitchen. She is a woman well-liked in Nueva Guinea and at work she is known as a person of clean living, responsible, hard-working and sociable in her community. Her dream is to improve her home, come to know her future grandchildren, be healthy and for her family to always stay united.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paint her home and refloor her kitchen

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus inició el negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso que le permitiera sostenerse además de que le gustan mucho las ventas ya que de esta manera puede conocer gente y además le permite viajar a otros lugares para comprar los productos que vende.
El comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 1998 antes de iniciar su negocio trabajaba en un bar, pero entonces se enfermo, quedo desempleado y con muchas deudas, fue entonces que decidío dedicarse a la venta de artículos de cerámica y después también a la joyería de plata. 

Cuando comenzo invertía muy poco en cerámica para ver como se comportaban las ventas y se dío cuenta que las ganancias eran buenas. Después empezo a invertir también en joyería de plata y al día de hoy ya cuenta con bastantes clientes en ambos ramos del negocio. 

El necesita un prestamo por MXN $12,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas. Con este crédito va a comprar cerámica y joyería para surtir pedidos que tiene de sus clientes y de esta manera incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Jesus began his business so he could count on an income that would allow him to support himself, and because he enjoys sales, which allows him to meet people and travel to other places to purchase the products he sells. He began his business in March of 1998.

Before beginning this business he worked at a bar, but he became ill and found himself unemployed and with many debts. It was then that he decided to begin selling ceramic products and later, silver jewelry as well. When he began, he invested very little in the ceramics to see how the sales went and he realized that his earnings were good. He later began to invest also in silver jewelry and today he has many clients in both branches of his business.

He would like this loan for 12000 Mexican Pesos, which he will repay in 12 installments. With this loan, he will buy ceramics and jewelry to fulfill his orders from his clients and this way increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia  inició el negocio por el deseo de salir adelante y de superarse ya que es madre soltera y no tiene el apoyo de ninguna persona y para que sus hijos pudieran  estudiar, fue que empezo con su negocio. Además este trabajo lo puede realizar en su casa y al mismo tiempo estar al pendiente de sus hijos. Comenzó el negocio en Febrero de 2006 gracias a una invitación que recibío para asistir a un curso de manualidades en el cual aprendío muy pronto y en la actualidad puede realizar diversas manualidades como canastas, flores, juegos de baño, bolsas, etc. la cuales ofrece entre sus amistades y a la gente de las casas donde trabaja.  
Cada vez conoce mas gente a la que le gusta su trabajo y así la van recomendando con otras personas por lo cual desde que inicio le ha ido muy bien y puede tener una fuente de ingresos segura.


Ella  necesita un prestamo por MXN $6000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas, con el cual va a poder comprar materia prima como tela, pegamento, foamy, hilo, tijeras, papel, etc. Que me permita elaborar arreglos que me encargan mis clientes para fechas especiales y eventos.
texts.en:
Emilia started her business out of a desire to prosper and better herself since she is a single mother who does not have the support of another person. She also began her business to allow her children to study. Also, she is able to perform her business from her house so she can still watch over her children. She started the business in February 2006 thanks to an invitation that she received to attend a course on handicrafts. She learned very quickly and was able to learn to make many different type of crafts such as baskets, paper flowers, bathroom sets, handbags, etc. She offers these goods to her friends and coworkers. Each time she meets more people who enjoy her crafts, and they recommend her goods to others. This process continues very well and she is able to have a flow of steady income. She needs a loan of $6,000 MXN that she will pay in 12 installments, which she will use to purchase raw materials such as cloth, glue, foamy, thread, scissors, paper, etc. These will allow her to make alterations that her customers entrust her to make for special dates and events.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase material

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
Ciprina inició el negocio porque es algo que le gusta hacer y le divierte mucho elaborar diferentes manualidades, además que es una actividad que realiza en casa y a cualquier hora y al mismo tiempo puedo estar al pendiente de mis nietos.  Comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 2006, gracias a una maestra que le enseñó a elaborar las manualidades, primero comenzò haciendo bolsas y juegos de baño, después empezo a elaborar cosas de acuerdo a la temporada que se iba acercando como flores para el día de muertos, arreglos para la navidad, el día de la amistad, el día del niño, el día de las madres, etc. y gracias a Dios me ha ido muy bien ya que todos mis arreglos los alcanzo a vender entre familiares, vecinos y amistades.  Poco a poco ha ido haciendo  mas clientes que a través de otras personas la recomendaban al ver su trabajo el cual les gustaba mucho.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $6,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas con el cual va  a poder comprar materia prima como tela, pegamento, foamy, hilo, tijeras, papel, etc. Que me permita elaborar arreglos que me encargan mis clientes para fechas especiales y eventos.
texts.en:
Ciprina started a business because it is something that she wanted to do. She enjoys making different crafts very much, and it is an activity that she can perform in her house whenever she wants. At the same time, she can take care of her grandchildren. She began the business in March 2006 thanks to a teacher that taught her to make crafts. She first started making handbags and bathroom sets, and later began making things related to each coming season, such as paper flowers for the Day of the Dead and decorations for Christmas, Friendship Day, Children's Day, Mother's Day, etc. Thanks to God, she has been getting more customers through recommendations from other people who liked her work. She needs a loan of $6,000 MXN that she will repay in 12 installments that she will use to purchase raw materials such as cloth, glue, foamy, thread, scissors, paper, etc. This will allow her make decorations that her customers entrust her to make for special dates and events.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Persa Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Bancomunal Siempre Juntas.
Isabel es casada, tiene cuatro hijos de 29,27, 25, y 18 años, ellos trabajan y estudian educación superior.
Con su esposo abrió una librería, pero al poco tiempo sufrió un accidente  quedando sin poder caminar por un a año y medio  teniendo que cerrarse, su esposo hace trabajos de  imprenta y ella le ayuda lamentablemente esposo esta perdiendo el oído casi no oye, ella quiere abrir nuevamente una librería en su casa..     
Necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para  comprar cuadernos, fólder, lapiceros, y  comenzar una librería. 
Antes de entrar en Finca no-tenia nada, con los prestamos de finca empezó hacer su negocio, le enseñaron como administrar  su negocio.
El sueño de Isabel es abrir nuevamente su librería.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of Bancomunal Siempre Juntas. Isabel is married and has four children ages 29, 27, 25, and 18. They work and take classes at a center for higher learning. She opened a bookstore with her husband but suffered an accident shortly after and was unable to walk for a year and had to close the bookstore. Now her husband does printing jobs and she helps. Unfortunately her husband is loosing his hearing and is almost deaf. She would like to open up a new bookstore in her house. She needs a loan for 2,000 soles in order to buy notebooks, folders and pens to open a bookstore. Before working with FINCA she did not have anything. With the loans from FINCA she was able to start her business and was taught how to manage her business. It is Isabel's dream to open a new bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan for 2,000 soles to purchase notebooks, folders, and pens to open her bookstore.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco L. Q. quiere iniciar un cuarto en la parte de enfrente la casa donde vive es muy pequeña aunque tiene un hijo no descarta la idea de poder tener mas. El quiere aprovechar que son menos los gastos en su vivienda para ir levantando poco a poco  las paredes, la losa y destalles para que se vea bien. 
El es una persona trabajadora el cual tiene su propio negocio como vive en un lugar donde se ponen las pulgas y hay muchísima gente vende muy bien y también los fines de semana trabaja en un antro.
texts.en:
Francisco L. Q. wants to start building a room in the front part of the house where he lives. The house is very small; although he has a son he does not discard the idea of being able to have more. He want to take advantage that he has less expenses at home, to start building the walls, floor and details little by little. He is a hard-working person who has his own business. He lives in an area where the flea market is, he has really good sales because there are a lot of people. He also works at a bar over the weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start construction of small room

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio  inició el negocio porqué no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar por la situación económica de su familia y como este ha sido un negocio familiar y desde niño conocía el negocio  ya tenía experiencia de vendedor entonces quizo probar suerte en esta actividad.
Comenzó el negocio en Febrero de 1984 por herencia de su abuelo y de su mamá, ya que ellos se dedicaron toda su vida a este negocio y el aprovecho sus conocimientos y experiencia para continuar haciendo lo mismo.  

 Ha progresado mucho ya que cada vez tiene más clientes y  ha podido contratar tres vendedores para que vendan en distintos puntos de la ciudad, además de vender en la calle tiene muchos clientes que le hacen pedidos para adornar sus fiestas infantiles, por lo cual no se arrepiento de haberse dedicado a esta actividad. 

El necesita un prestamo por MXN $12,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas. 
Con este crédito va a comprar globos, gas, hilo, plástico, etc. Para estar preparado y bien surtido para las fiestas del día del niño que en México se celebra el día 30 de Abril.
texts.en:
Lucio started a business because he did not have the opportunity to study due to his family's economic situation. He has been part of a similar business before. Since he was a child, he has had experience as a salesman, so he wanted to test his luck in this work. He began the business in February 1984 from an inheritance from his grandfather and from his mother. Since they dedicated their entire lives to this business, he took advantage of their relationships and experience to continue doing the same thing. He has progressed a lot since each time he has more customers and he has been able to hire three salesmen who sell in different parts of the city. In addition to selling in the streets, he has many customers who make orders to decorate their children's parties, so he doesn't regret dedicating himself to this activity. He needs a loan of $12,000 MXN that he will repay in 12 installments. With this credit, he is going to buy balloons, gas, thread, plastic, etc. so he will be prepared and well-stocked for Children's Day which is celebrated on April 30 in Mexico.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Bancomunal Siempre Juntas
Carmen es conviviente, tiene 56 años, un hijo de 14 años que esta en la escuela particular.
Carmen empezó su negocio de venta de ropa con los prestamos de Finca, empezó vendiendo polos, ahora su sobrina le manda ropa de Italia tres veces al año día de la madre, fiestas patrias, y navidad.  
Necesita un préstamo de 3,400 soles, para comprar ropa importada de Italia.
Desde que esta en finca ha crecido en su negocio, aprendió ahorrar y como administrar su dinero, a sacar su ganancia del capital.  
El sueño de Carmen es poner una tienda bazar en su casa, pero le faltan terminar los acabados.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Bancocomunal Siempre Juntas. She is 56 years old, married, and has a 14-year-old son who is attending a private school. Carmen started her clothing business with loans from Finca. She started by buying polo shirts, and now her niece sends her clothing from Italy three times a year: Mother's Day, Fiestas Patrias and Christmas. Carmen needs a loan of 3,400 Soles to buy more clothes imported from Italy. As her business has grown, she's learned how to save and manage her money, and how to draw capital gains. Carmen's dream is to have a shop in her home, but she doesn't yet have the resources to make that happen.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing imported from Italy

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria inició el negocio por deseos de superarse y salir adelante con su hijo ya que no recibo ningún apoyo económico del papa por lo que tuvo que buscar la forma de percibir un ingreso ya que quiere brindarle una mejor forma de vida a mi hijo.
Comenzó el negocio  en Marzo de 2007, el negocio es una tradición familiar, primero comenzo ayudándole a su mamá  en su puesto. Como se dío cuenta que le iba muy bien, platico con ella para que le ayudara a independizarse y poner su propio negocio. Inicio con una pequeña inversión y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien ha  progresado porque ya tiene un mejor surtido que cuando comenzò además de que incluio la venta de alimentos enlatados y verdura básica para la preparación del marisco.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $12,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas,  con este crédito va a comprar mercancía para tener un buen surtido ya que se acerca una buena época en donde se vende mucho el marisco y por consecuencia también sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria started a business out of a desire to better herself and get ahead in life with her child since she does not receive any economic support from the father. She had to search for a source of income since she wanted to provide a better life for her child. She began the business in March 2007, which is part of a family tradition. She first started by helping her mother at her stand. When she realized that she was doing well, she spoke with her mother about helping her to become independent and begin her own business. She started with a small investment and thanks to God, the business has been progressing very well. She is already better stocked than when she started and has included canned food and basic vegetables for the preparation of shellfish. She needs a loan of $12,000 MXN that she will repay in 12 installments. With this credit, she is going to purchase merchandise to be well-stocked since a good time of year is approaching when a lot of shellfish is sold and consequently she sells a lot of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Soledad Maria

texts.es:
Soledad es socia del Bancomunal Siempre Juntas.
Soledad es casada, tiene 34 años dos hijos, de 15 y 5 años que están en la escuela estatal.
Soledad  estudio para obstetricia pero no ejerció, se dedico a las ventas. 
Hace cinco años empezó con su cuñado, en sociedad una tienda de abarrotes  “La Económica”
Antes de que entrara a Finca tenia poca mercadería, gracias a los prestamos pudo aumentar su mercadería, le gusta las  capacitaciones que dan, son de mucha ayuda.  
Necesita un préstamo de 2,600 soles, para la compra de víveres arroz, aceite, azúcar, harina.
el sueño es tener su negocio propio
texts.en:
Soledad is a member of the communal bank “Siempre Juntas.” Soledad is a 34-year-old, married woman who has two children. Her children, ages 15 and 5 years old, go to the state school. Soldedad studied to work in obstetrics, but did not practice in this area. Instead, she worked in sales. Five years ago she began a grocery store called "La Económica" with her brother-in-law. She did not have much merchandise before she became a member of Finca, but thanks to the loans she was able to increase her merchandise. She likes the trainings that are given because they are very helpful. She needs a loan of 2,600 to buy supplies like: rice, oil, sugar, and flour. Her dream is to have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Necesita un préstamo de 2,600 soles, para la compra de víveres arroz, aceite, azúcar, harina.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Bancomunal Siempre Juntas.
Haydee es casada  tiene 41 años, cinco hijos de 24, 23, 22, 19 y 16 años ya terminaron la escuela, se encuentran trabajando y realizando estudios superiores. 
Haydee tenia su bodega y el año pasado le robaron todo y se dedico a trabajar en una fabrica haciendo bordados, después de varios meses decidió vender gas,  sus hijos ven el negocio, empezó con tres balones de gas ahora vende 15 balones 
Necesita un préstamo de 2600, soles para el arreglo de su carro, para revisión técnica.
Su vida cambia desde que entro a Finca por que ella empezó su negocio cuando entro al Bancomunal, antes era muy tímida, ahora es más expresiva, las charlas que se dan le han ayudado mucho a su negocio y a su persona. 
El sueño de Haydee es abrir nuevamente una bodega y un locutorio
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the communal bank “Siempre Juntas.” Haydee is married, 41-years-old, and has five children ages, 24, 23, 22, 19, and 16. Her children have already finished school and are working and studying at higher levels. Haydee had a grocery store, but last year was robbed of everything so she began to work in a factory doing embroidery. After a few months, she decided to sell gas. Her children help her with the business. She began with 3 cylinders of gas and now sells 15. She needs a loan of 2600 soles in order to fix her car, which is in need of a tune up. Becoming a member of Finca has changed Haydee’s life because it’s when she became a member of the communal bank that she began her business. She was very shy before but now is more expressive. The talks that are given have helped her and her business a lot. Haydee's dream is to open another grocery store and a shop where people make telephone calls.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Necesita un préstamo de 2600, soles para el arreglo de su carro, para revisión técnica.

loans.name: Berna Cristina

texts.es:
