Es socia del Bancomunal  siempre Juntas 
Berna es separada, tiene 54 años tres hijos de 30, 28 y 23 años todos trabajan.
Se comprometió desde muy joven y no estudio, trabajo limpiando casas, y también  como mesera, por muchos años, pero hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de productos  naturales medicinales.   
Desde que esta en Finca tiene mas amigas, las reuniones la relajan, recibe ayuda mutua, procura no fallar en los pagos.
Berna necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para la compra y venta de sus productos. 
El sueño de Berna es ser distribuidora de productos medicinales y tener una tienda.
texts.en:
She is a partner of the Bancomunal Siempre Juntas Berna is separated, she is 54 and has three children of 30, 28 and 23. They all work. She got engaged very young and did not study. She worked as a house cleaner and also as a waitress for many years. For the last five years, she has sold natural medicine goods. Since she is at Finca, she has more female friends. Meetings relax her, she receives mutual help and tries not to fail her installments. Berna needs a loan of 1,600 soles to buy and sell her products. Berna's dream is to be a medicine products distributor and to have a store.


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Berna needs a 1600 soles loan to buy and sell her products.

loans.name: Candida Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur de la ciudad de Managua la señora Candida Quintana se ha desempeñado arduamente a laborar en su negocio de venta de abarrotes los cuales son comercializados en su propia casa de habitación donde a diario vende sus productos en su establecimiento.

Actualmente ha buscado el apoyo de Ceprodel por medio de la entrega de créditos para la compra de la mercadería ya que requiere del capital financiero porque a medida de que el negocio va creciendo es necesario invertir en mercadería para ofrecerla a los clientes y así mejorar las condiciones del negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Candida Quintana has worked with a lot of effort in her grocery store in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur at the city of Managua. She daily sells goods at her own house. Currently, she has looked for the support of Ceprodel through credit delivery to purchase merchandise because she requires financial resources as the business is growing. It is necessary to buy groceries to offer to the customers and in that way improve the business conditions.


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Rosa M. se dedica a laborar arduamente en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur para suplir la necesidad de su familia y de su casa de habitación la cual requiere de una mejora en la infraestructura por lo que ya ha sido maltratada tanto por los años como por los fenómenos naturales.

Actualmente la señora Blanca requiere de un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para la reconstrucción de su casa y es por este motivo que ha buscado el  apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un financiamiento para llevar a cabo esta obra y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de su casa de habitación y de su pequeño hijo que hoy más que nunca requiere del apoyo de su mamá.
texts.en:
At the Municipality of San Rafael del Sur, Ms. Blanca M. works really hard to support her family needs and house expenses. Her house needs structure improvements because it has suffered from aging and the strike of natural disasters.

Currently Ms. Blanca requires a loan to purchase building materials so as to rebuild her house; this is the reason why she has looked for Ceprodel support to obtain financing and get down to business. By doing this, her house conditions will be improved and her little child's too, who needs the mother's support more than ever .

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Amalia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Amalia M. actualmente ha logrado salir adelante en su trabajo por lo que ha duplicado sus esfuerzos para llevar a cabo su sueño de mejorar su vivienda ya que ha estado en malas condiciones pero ha comenzado  a reconstruirla poco a poco y para esto requiere del apoyo crediticio de Ceprodel para la compra de los materiales de construcción.

Es por este motivo que ella espera en que Ceprodel le beneficie con dicho financiamiento para salir adelante y de esta forma mejorar sus condiciones ya que comprará los materiales de construcción para la obra y al terminarla podrá gozar en conjunto con su familia y su hijo que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Ms. Amalia M. currently has been succesful doing her job so she has worked twice as hard to fulfill her dreams of improving her house as it is in bad shape. She has started to rebuild it little by little and to do so, she requires Ceprodel financial support to purchase buidling materials.

This is the reason why she expects that Ceprodel givers her financing to get through and improve her conditions this way. As a result, she will buy the building materials for the project and when it is finished she will enjoy it together with her family and her little child that she loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El señor Armando P. tiene poco tiempo que  adquirió su vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental pero le está haciendo falta la barda al frente de su casa, ya que tiene hijos pequeños y quiere la seguridad de ellos.
   Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder llevar acabo la mejora lo más pronto posible y plana pagarlo con los ingresos de su trabajo como jefe de una tienda en el aria de carnicería. Cuando fuimos a ser la visita de su casa el señor Armando no se encontraba estaba en su trabajo, quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Karent Carranza y uno de sus hijos quien son los que aparecen en la foto.
texts.en:
Mr Armando P. bought his house thanks to a government loan a little while ago but he needs to build the wall at the front of his house, since he has small children and he wants them to be safe. He is requesting a loan to be able to finish his project as soon as possible, and plans to repay the loan with the income of his work as a chief of a butcher's shop. When we went to do the visit of the house Mr Armando was not there, he was at work, we meet with his wife Karent Carranza and one of his children who are the ones in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall in the front of his house.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia E. tiene ya más de 2 años dedicándose a su negocio que es venta de ropa usada y nueva. Este es el ingreso de su familia ya que bajo su responsabilidad tiene a un hijo el cual está estudiando y quiere terminar su carrera profesional.
   Al negocio le está haciendo falta un techo de lamina para cubrí la mercancía del sol y de la  lluvia y además desea comprar mas variedad de ropa, pero en este momento no cuanta con el dinero para llevar acabo de la mejora y surtir el negocio. Ella planea pagar el préstamo con los ingresos que genera su negocio.
texts.en:
Virginia E. has more than two years' experience dedicating herself to her business selling new and used clothing. This accounts for her family's income because she is responsible for her son, who is in school and wants to complete his professional degree. Her business is missing a sheet roof to cover her merchandise from the sun and rain, and furthermore she wants to purchase a wider variety of clothing. However, at the moment she doesn't have the necessary money to make the improvements and stock her business. She plans to repay the loan with the income she makes from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof to her store and purchase merchandise

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es:
El señor Raymundo C. L. tiene un  negocio llamado  “Un mundo de tortas” desde hace  un año cuatro meses aproximadamente, el vende, tortas, gorditas, fritos con queso, nieve, carne, dulces y refrescos. El solicita un préstamo para comprar  un congelador  y surtir mercancía.
Su negocio lo tiene en su casa pero en frente se encuentra una escuela; nos comenta que el año pasado en estas fechas que empieza el calor, los niños le pedían nieve por lo que no se daba abasto y sus nieves las ponía en un refrigerador y no cabían.
texts.en:
Raymundo C. L. has run his business called "A World of Tortas" [torta is a style of sandwich] for approximately the past year and four months. He sells tortas, gorditas, french fries with cheese, shaved ice, meat, candies and refreshments. He is requesting a loan to purchase a freezer and stock his store with supplies. His business is located in his home, which is in front of a school. He tells us that last year this was when the temperature started rising and the children asked him for shaved ice, and he wasn't able to keep up and all the shaved ice he kept in the refrigerator didn't fit.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a freezer and supplies

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta C., 45, is a  resident of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, Southern Philippines. She is striving hard to provide the needs of her family. Julieta is married and blessed with 2 children. She tends a variety store (sari–sari store) and is sometimes engaged in traditional gold panning. Because the income of the family  is not sufficient , Julieta needs to have a financial assistance of PHP 11,000 to expand her variety store.  From the income of her business she hopes to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for sale in the store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
C. is 30 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province. She is married to Samol, 29, who plants crops and vegetables for a living. C. sells groceries including sugar cane, sweets, noodles, fruits, and other items. She buys her products in bulk from villager's fields at a bargained price. Then she sells these products in her retail shop to earn a profit. 

Recently, C. sold all of her products and is now applying for a loan to buy more grocery products for her store. She hopes to increase her income by expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: 28- Nam Ngạn Group

texts.vi:
* T. Hóa là một tỉnh nghèo chủ yếu sống nhờ vào nông nghiệp là chủ yếu,phường Nam Ngạn là một phường ven thành phố. ở đây đất làm nông nghiệp ít, dân cư ở đây sống dựa vào việc buôn bán. Phố Tân Nam là phố mới, dân cư từ nơi khắc đến sống là chủ yếu.Nhóm 28 gồm có 9 thành viên trong đó có 4 thành viên đã vay qua một chu kỳ ,còn lại 5 thành  viên mới đăng ký tham gia vay chu kỳ thứ nhất.Nhóm trưởng là K. Thị T. Trân sinh năm 1958, cH. bà tên là N. Văn Nhã .Gia đình ông bà mở một cửa hiệu nhỏ bán và sửa chữa đồ điện dân dụng,ông bà có ba người con,hai con lớn đã lập gia đình,cô con gái út vừa mới tốt nghiệp Trường Cao đẳng Y tế.Hiện nay, bà đang vay mức vốn 1.963.500 VNĐ ~115 USD.Trong nhóm có 4 thành viên vay mức 1.963.500 VNĐ, 5 thành viên vay mức 1.626.900 VNĐ ~ 96 USD.
* Vũ Thị Hương, sinh năm 1958 bà vay vốn để bán rau.
* N. Thị trường ,sinh năm 1974, chị vay vốn để bán rau.
* T. Thị Tú,sinh năm 1973,chị vay vốn để bán rau.
* T. Thị Phương,sinh Năm 1961, chị vay vốn để bán hoa quả.
* T. Thị Tâm,sinh Năm 1961 ,chị vay vốn để bán hàng ăn sáng.
* Ngô Thị Hằng,sinh Năm 1984 ,chị vay vốn để bán hoa quả.
* N. thị H. Phương,sinh năm 1985 ,chị vay vốn để bán hàng tạp hóa(bámh, kẹo,đường sữa...).
* H. Thị Lý,sinh Năm 1952, chị vay vốn để bán bánh kẹo ,đường sữa....
texts.en:
T. Hóa is a poor province. People live mostly from agriculture. Nam Ngạn is an area bordering the city. There is not much land for agriculture here. Tân Nam is a new town, most of the people living here are from elsewhere originally. The group number 28 has 9 members: 4 of them have already had a loan before, the remaining 5 are first timers. The group leader is K. Thị T. Trân, born in 1958. Her husband is N. Văn Nhã. They have a small shop selling/repairing electrical goods. They have 3 children: 2 of them are married and have their own family, the youngest daughter has just graduated from nurse school. Mrs Trân is requesting a loan of 1.963.500 VNĐ ~115 USD. In her group, there are 4 women who want to borrow 1.963.500 VNĐ and the other 5, 1.626.900 VNĐ ~ 96 USD. *Vũ Thị Hương, born in 1958. She sells vegetables. *N. Thị trường, born in 1974. She sells vegetables. *T. Thị Tú, born in 1973. She sells vegetables. *T. Thị Phương,, born in 1961. She sells fruits and flowers. *T. Thị Tâm, born in 1961. She sells breakfast. * Ngô Thị Hằng, born in 1984. She sells fruits and flowers. * N. thị H. Phương, born in 1985. She sells grocery and snacks(candies, cookies, suger, milk ...) * H. Thị Lý, born in 1952. She sells grocery.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: invest in her repair shop

loans.name: Sa Moeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sa Moeurn T. is 47 years old and she lives in Koun Tnaut village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Sat Phat, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice. They have five children, one of whom is a teacher in the local school, while another is recycling collector, and the others are enrolled in the local school.

Since their second child’s business is doing well, they want to expand it for their child. Thus, Mrs. Sa Moeurn T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to pull a cart to transport recyclable goods to re-sell at the recycling factory. She hopes to increase the family income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to pull a cart to transport recyclable goods

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Mrs. Kea N. is 30 years old and lives in the Kampong Cham Province with her husband and two of her young children. So far, two of their children are in school. Mrs. Kea N. is a good housewife who takes care of her children and cooks for her family. She and her husband have been married since 2005. Her husband is a blacksmith and sometimes also operates a moto-taxi business. On average, he makes around USD $6 a day to raise the family. Mrs. Kea N. would like to take out a loan to purchase blacksmith materials.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith materials

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.en: Lazaro J. Jr. manages a variety store  as his main source of income to raise his family. He is maried with seven children,  five of whom are in school. Lazaro has also a skills in cooking. He wants to engage in a food vending business which will be situated beside his variety store. Being an excellent cook, Lazaro is confident that he could gain patronage from their neighbors and even in their neighboring villages. He aspires to improve the building structure of his variety store and put up a food vending stall as well. Lazaro believes that this is the best thing he could do so he can send his cildren to school.  He is requesting an additional loan of PHP11000 to finance his plan.

loans.use: To improve the structure of his variety store and an extension stall for his food vending business.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sa Voeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sa Voeurn N. is a villager in Koun Tmar village in Kampong Cham province. She is a fish middleman. Her husband, Mr. Kong Seang Hay, helps his wife’s business. Since their business is doing well, they want to expand it by purchasing more fish to re-sell to earn more profit.

Mrs. Sa Voeurn N. is a 35-year-old with two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more fish to re-sell

loans.name: Chhai Kun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhai Kun L. is 46 years old and she now lives in Koun Tmart village in Kampong Cham province. She is a merchant in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Phen Sreng, is a pig breeder. Since his pigs are getting bigger and bigger, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy pig feed for them.

Thus, Mrs. Chhai Kun L. decided to ask for a loan to purchase pig feed for her husband’s pig business. She has three children, one of whom stays at home to do housework while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to grow yams

loans.name: Creuk

texts.en:
Creuk S. is 36 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province. She sells grocery items including cooked ingredients, sweets, and drinking water. Ms. S. has attracted many clients to her store because she is a responsible neighbor and seller. She gets up early every morning to buy her products in bulk at a bargained price and then takes them home to resell in her village retail shop. 

Ms. S. wants to increase her income earned from her business so she is applying for a loan to buy more grocery products. She dreams of having a good home and a big grocery store.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S., 50, sells fruits and vegetables in the Kampong Cham Province. She has two employed children who work as construction workers. Her husband, 60, is blind and stays at home. Mrs. Chea S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. This will reduce transportation costs that she spends every day.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Nith

texts.en: Mrs. Nith S. is a 36-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a construction worker who builds houses. Mrs. Nith S.'s has been working in that field for about for eight years and can make USD $2.50 per day. Her husband, pictured here, has been operating a motor-taxi business since 1990; and he is able to earn around $5 per day. This couple has six children, two of whom are in school and two others are employed as workers. Mrs. Nith S. is asking for a loan to raise cows.

loans.use: To raise cows

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas C. is 44 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province. She has three children: two of whom remain under her care, while the third is married and lives separately. For over a year, Ms. C. has been a mushroom producer, a trade she learned from her father. She has become recognized for her ability to grow high quality mushrooms behind her house.

She is married to Chhengngoun, 25, who owns a small farm where he raises ducks. Ms. C. and her family face a problem due to the lack of transportation. She is applying for a loan of $1000 to buy a motor. This will assist her family to buy food for her ducks, as well as assist her family's transportation needs.

loans.use: To buy a motor

loans.name: Laila

texts.en: Laila got married at an early age. Although her husband has a stable job she is not relying solely on her husband's salary since the payroll is always delayed and the take-home pay could not fully support their basic needs. So she looked for other means to earn an income to help her husband meet their day-to-day needs. When she heard of HSPFI offering loans to their community, she immediately applied and availed a loan amounting to PHP5000 to finance her ala carte food business (grilled meat either pork, chicken and beef). Laila was happy with the loan she got from HSPFI because she was able to earn and help her husband in raising their child. As the sales of her ala carte food business grew she needs a loan amounting to PHP8,000 to buy additional stocks and food containers to preserve the meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase container to store raw meat  for her foodstall

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jennebby

texts.en:
Jenneby P., who is 52 years old with 10 children, owns a small parcel of land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She grows rice to feed her family. She loves her work because she grew up in a farming family. Her parents, her husband, and her husband's parents are are also farmers. Together, they grow rice to support their family.

She is asking a CEVI loan of Php 10,000 to purchase four bags of Urea and other fertilizers to achieve maximum yield from her crops. She hope she will have more rice for her family and extra rice to sell to rice traders. Jennebby sells some of her harvest to rice traders to earn additional income for the family. 

CEVI is helping Jennebby sustains her farm business. Through her business, she will be able to improve her children's schooling and potentially send her children to college. CEVI supports Jenneby to grow her business by giving her credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim Ie, 57, is a farmer who lives in the Kampong Cham Province with her husband, Hang Hum. They have been married since 1980 and have two children. One is a student, and the other is a taxi driver. To earn a living, she has mature corns to sell at the market and is abL. to make about USD $4 per day, whiL. her husband earns $3 by growing and selling sesame. Mrs. Sim would like to request a loan of $1200 to purchase cows to help plow the land.

loans.use: To purchase cows to plow the land

loans.name: Loela

texts.en: Loela M. is very grateful to HSPFI for granting her PHP5000 loan which she used to put up a sari-sari (variety) store. She is also proud of herself for venturing into retail business as this is a big help in raising her 4 children. She is in need of PHP8000 to purchase additional grocery items for sale in her sari-sari store. She wants to earn more income to support the education of her children and other family needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for sale in her sari-sari (variety) store.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Hak S., 52, is a widow who lives with her three children in the Kampong Cham Province. She stays at home doing housework and cooking for her children. The family is supported by two children who work as mechanics. Mrs. Hak S. would like to take out a loan to purchase mechanic's tools for her sons (one of her sons is pictured here).

loans.use: To purchase mechanic's tools

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky P., who is 34 years old with two children, is a rice grower. Previously in 1999, Pinky worked in Manila as a cook and a clothes dealer selling fashion products like cologne, pants, perfumes t-shirts and sandals. However, she was not happy about being a cook and a clothes dealer. She decided to stop working and went back to her province to manage their small farm. 

She is asking CEVI for a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase fertilizer for her farm. The loan will help her achieve a bigger yield. She believes she could better contribute to her family's income. 

CEVI provides their clients not just credit assistance, but also training and insurance coverage. By providing such services, CEVI and its partners are able to lift more and more people out from poverty.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn B., together with her husband and seven children, resides in Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. They have a sari-sari store (variety store), a major source of their family income. This is tended by Merlyn. She works together with her husband, a farmer, to provide for the basic needs of their family. She desires to improve and fill her store with stocks to be competitive in the market; hence, she is requesting a loan amounting to Php 11,000.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her variety store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Isagani

texts.en: Mr Isagani L., 47, a resident of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, Southern Philippines is happily maried with 5 children. The realization of his business plan for a retail store started when he got an access to credit from HSPFI Microfinance Program. His direct customers are his neighbors and neighboring villages. Isagani wants to expand his mini mart by purchasing additional products like sugarcane, rice, beverages and dairy products.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing another products for sale like rice, dairy products and beverages.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Esra

texts.en: Esra A., a widow, raised her eight children by herself,  with the help of her variety store and food vending business at school canteen. For her, it wasn't easy to survive without someone who will share her burden. Her husband died 8 years ago leaving her the great responsibility for raising the children. This served as a challenge for her to work harder. HSPFI loans greatly helped her finance and sustain her business. As of now, she needs an amount of PhP11,000 as additional capital for her variety store and her food vending business at the school canteen.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her variety store and  food vending business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Sou S. is 34 years old and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. He is a single person who lives with his parents. Sou grows vegetables and operates a moto-taxi business to earn a living. He is able to make a combined profit of around USD $5 per day. Sou is asking for a loan to purchase a water pump to irrigate his farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump to irrigate his farm

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean M., who is 56 years old with five children, is a rice farmer. Her husband, Anilo M. Jr, is helping her manage the farm. They enjoy working together and taking good care of the rice seeds that they have sown. They work hard to have enough food for the family. Their harvest is reserved for family consumption while the rest is sold to rice traders in their village. 

Aside from rice, Jean also grows beans and vegetables in her backyard. She waters them everyday and then sells the harvest to earn extra income. This income is used to buy other family needs. 

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more fertilizer to increase her farm yield. Because she is supporting her grandson's education, she wishes to earn a bigger income from her farm.

CEVI supports farmers to achieve higher yields. Through credit assistance, farmers are able to buy fertilizer they need for their farm. They also receive training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina A., 45, is a resident of Pigsag-an ,Cagayan de Oro City. She a mother of three and happily married for  25 years. Farming is the main source of income in the family. Divina decided to put up a sari-sari store (retail store) as a way to earn additional income to support their family needs. She was able to see an opportunity in their village, and  Divina was able to avail a loan from HSPFI-microfinance program. Recently, she needs PHP8,000 to purchase basic commodities for sale like rice,corn,pasta's,beverages.dairy products and more for her growing retail store business.

loans.use: To purchase basic commodites for sale like rice,corn,pasta's,beverages.dairy products and more.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Duch

texts.en: Duch S., 36, pictured here with her husband, has a business of growing and selling vegetables, making about USD $5 per day. Her husband is a fisherman. Every day, he goes to catch fish and sell them to the market to earn approximately $3 a day. This couple has four children, three of whom are students and one who is too young to attend the school. Mrs. Duch would like to ask for a loan to purchase more fishing tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma M., 44 years old with one child, rents one and three quarter hectares of farming land to grow rice. She and her husband work hard on the farm in order to have food for the family. They enjoy working under the heat of the sun, touching the wet soil, removing the weeds to ensure quality harvest. 

Aside from farming, Gemma cooks "bananacue" in their village. "Bananacue" is a filipino term for fried banana on a stick that many children love to eat. Gemma is also able to cover some of the family expenses from the profit made through selling her "bananacue." 

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. She will use the loan to buy Urea and insecticide to increase her yield. This way, she can better support her children, especially with their schooling.

CEVI provides all clients, like Gemma, credit assistance for their businesses. Aside from that, they also receive training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas S. is a rice farmer. As the head of the family, he is doing his best to increase his yield to support his family. He is 32 years old and has 3 children. He is renting land from his cousin. He has solely managed the farm for 8 years already. Because of his farm, he was able to feed his family and send his children to school. He dreams of having all of his children graduate from college so that they can find better jobs for their future families. 

He is asking a loan of Php 10,000 to buy fertilizer for his farm. He will use the loan to increase his yield and thus support his family.

CEVI helps Tomas sustains his farm business. Now, he enjoys free training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
B. is 55 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province. He has 8 children: five of them are single and under his care, and the other three are married and lived separately. B. is married to Ra, 53, who is a pig raiser. To help the family income, his two daughters help his wife's business.

B. is a rice trader. He buys rice from the villagers in bulk, stores it in his house for a while, and then he resells it to the market. B. is a hard-working father. He now wants to renovate his house because it's too old and small. So B. is applying for a loan of $1000 to buy the housing poles and wood pieces.

loans.use: To buy the housing poles and wooden slices

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
M. is 55 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province. She has four children: one is single and under her care, and the other three are married and lived separately. M. is a widow and earns her living by owning a grocery store selling cooked ingredients, sweets, plastic, etc. To help M.'s business, Sokhan, M.'s daughter, stays with her and prepares the store for her.

M. is a responsible and helpful mother. She has earned a better income from her clients by having her store. M. recently faced a problem with transportation. M. is applying for a loan of $400 to buy a motorcycle for her and her family. The loan will help the family earn a better living standard.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her and her family

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia D. is 61 years old and a widowed mother of four. She lives in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, Southern Philippines. All of her children are married. At her age, Lilia still works hard to help provide the needs of the family of her youngest son and her two grandchildren who stay with her. She runs a sari–sari store (variety store) and food stall to earn an income.

Unfortunately, the income from those businesses is not enough to provide her household's basic needs. Therefore, she wants to venture in the poultry business. She needs financial assistance amounting to PHP 11,000 ($250). This will be her third loan cycle with Kiva partner HSPFI. She dreams of sending her grandchildren to college.

loans.use: To purchase poultry products and grocery items for the store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sainhishig

texts.en:
Sainhishig D. is a 42-year-old woman who lives with her husband and daughter in a "ger" (a traditional nomadic Mongolian home) on a plot of land owned by one of their relatives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband, Ariunjargal, is a 43-year-old who runs the family business with his wife. Their daughter, Zul, is 13 and goes to elementary school.

In 2000, the family moved from Tov Aimag (central province) to Ulaanbaatar city to improve their life condition. Sainhishig used to work as a saleswoman when she lived in Tov Aimag. She studied under the socialist system at the university, learning about the pricing and quality of commodities. Since they moved, her husband makes a variety designs of kitchen furniture in his yard, which Sainhishig sells. They buy materials from the construction market and get designs from foreign home-design magazines. They have many repeat clients. Their business capital is 1 million MNT ($1 USD=1500 MNT), and the monthly average income from the business is 1.1 million MNT. Their monthly average profit is 300,000 MNT.

Sainhishig and Ariunjargal are working hard to have their own plot of land to live on. Sainhishig says, in Mongolian, "We dream to have our own big furniture store. We'll work to make our dream come true." They will use their Kiva loan to buy raw materials, such as wood. The picture shows Sainhishig with her husband, Ariunjargal.

loans.use: To buy raw materials, such as wood, to make furniture

loans.name: Rezyl

texts.en:
Rezyl C. is a rice farmer. She owns a small farm, which she and her husband till to support their family. She is 23 years old and has 3 children. Her children are still young and thus aren't yet attending school. Aside from farming, Rezyl raises pigs in their backyard. She loves pigs and she thinks that having a piggery is a very profitable business. Rezyl wants to save money for her children's education. She wants them to be able to graduate college, something she and her husband were unable to do.

She is asking a CEVI loan of Php 10,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers to increase her harvest. Farming is their main source of living. Her family consumes most of the harvest; what remains is sold to rice traders for additional income. 

CEVI is helping Rezyl increase her yield. They give all their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Ulambayar E. is a 30-year-old man who lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. Both his sons go to kindergarten. 

Ulambayar runs a transport business with his own pickup truck, but only in the wintertime. He purchases coal from the local coal mine, bags it, and sells it out of his truck. (Most Mongolians who live in the traditional nomad's "ger" heat their homes with coal against the frigid winter nights.) In the warmer seasons, he helps in his wife's retail business. 

Ulambayar's wife runs a shoe selling business in her own stall at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Mongolia. She frequently travels to the Chinese border city of Ereen to buy shoes to sell. With this loan, Ulambayar hopes to buy more shoes to increase his family's business capital.

Before starting their transport and shoe-selling businesses, the couple had been renting land to set up their ger. When they began getting loans from XacBank, (Kiva's partner microfinance institution in Mongolia), they were able to use their profits to buy their own plot of land to live on.

loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun P. is a widowed and handicapped woman who lives with her daughter, son in-law, and niece. They live in Oyun's "ger" ( a ger is a traditional nomadic Mongolian home), on a plot of land owned by one of their relatives in Uvurhangay, a southern Mongolian province.

Oyun has a 500 sq. meter field that is located near the river Dairga in Uvurhangay province. She plants a variety of vegetables, such as potatoes, cabbage, and onions every summer and sells them in a rented indoor vegetable stall at the local food market in all four seasons. She grows plenty of vegetables, and after the harvest she rents an outdoor vegetable stall at the same market and hires someone to sell most of her harvest in bulk.

During the winter and spring, Oyun goes to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, once or twice a month to buy a variety of vegetables and other small food products, such as jelly, noodles, and ketchup, and sells them. Oyun's daughter helps in her mother's business. Oyun has a determined attitude. She is requesting this loan to buy more food products to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more food products

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
T. is 38 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has three children: two of them are single and under her care, and the other one is married and lives separately. She is married to Vann, 46, who is a team leader at one company.

T. raises pigs behind her house. She has sold her pigs to the slaughter every four months since 1998. To help pay the family's expenses, she also plants rice twice per year, and she owns a rice mill machine. T. is applying for a loan of $800 to buy more pig food and to repair her rice mill machine.

loans.use: To buy more pig food and to repair her rice mill machine

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn T. is a rice farmer. She and her husband till the the 3.5 hectares of land that they own in order to support their family. She has 7 children, all of whom are studying. She wants them to finish their schooling so that they can find better jobs in the future. Aside from farming, Evelyn wants to have a piggery. She wants to raise pigs because they are constantly in demand. 

She is asking a loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers in her farm. Some of the loan will also be used to buy piglets for her future piggery. Additionally, she is interested in looking for some other line of business that could augment their income. 

CEVI supports Evelyn in her business. They give all their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en:
Tserendolgor D. lives with her husband in the center of Uvurhangai, one of Mongolia's southern provinces. Her husband works as a receptionist in an elementary school, and her son is a soldier.

Tserendolgor worked as a tailor in a sewing factory for many years, but in 2000, she quit that job and started sewing a variety of clothes at home to sell. People come to her to order specific clothes with a specific design. In addition, she began renting a clothing stall at the local market last year, and moved her sewing machine there. Then she started sewing and selling at the same stall at same time. The orders people are giving her have increased day-to-day, since she has no competitors who run the same business. She would like to expand her business, and therefore she requests a loan to buy materials for sewing clothes.

loans.use: To buy materials for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Beverlyn

texts.en:
Beverlyn S. is a rice farmer. She has spent all of her life sowing rice seeds, removing the weeds, and harvesting the grains. She is 37 years old and has 2 children. Her husband, Jimmy S., is also a farmer. They enjoy working together to support their family and give their children a good future. From her harvest, she is able to satisfy her family's small needs. Her husband is very supportive and is the one helping her manage the farm. 

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers to increase her yield. This way, she will have more rice. She could then sell the surplus rice to some of the rice traders in their village in order to earn additional income. 

CEVI helps her grow her business. They give all their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
D. is 26 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She is a widowed mother of one child, who is still young.

D. has owned a general store for more than seven years. She works hard; she gets up in the early morning to prepare her store and goes to the market to buy products in bulk. She has gained a lot of clients and a better profit. D. wants to increase her income from her business, so she is applying for a loan of $500 to buy more grocery products for her store. The loan will help her attain a better living standard.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her store

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City is a community where small-scale mining is prevalent and is the main source of income for the locals. But Melodina does not rely only on the income from her husband's gold panning because it is inadequate to raise their five children, four of whom are already in their primary education.

To help support her family, Melodina engages into food peddling in their village. Fortunately, she was able to acquire a loan from Kiva partner HSPFI, which she used to put up a carenderia (food stall). She plans to expand her food stall so she can accommodate more customers, and therefore she is requesting an additional loan from HSPFI amounting to PHP 11000 ($250 USD). She hopes that with the success of her carenderia business, she will be able to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: To expand her carenderia (food stall).

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette B. grows rice. She is 42 years old and has 3 children. She worked previously in Taiwan as a domestic helper. For 6 years, she worked very far from her family and her children. Her husband is also a farmer. She and her husband enjoy working together to support their children's needs. While her husband is busy tilling the farm, she also cooks food and sells it to the villagers. She is also making a profit from the food that she sells. She uses the income to buy things that satisfy their other needs.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to help her husband buy the fertilizers needed in their farm; they will ensure better harvests. She is also planning to invest more in her food business.

CEVI provides Janette with the credit assistance that she needs. They give all their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Ayush

texts.en:
Ayush J., 46, lives with her husband, son, and daughter. Her son is a university student and her daughter stays at home. In 1995, her family moved to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, because her daughter got sick and needed long-term medical help from a bigger hospital. Ayush's husband is employed by a privately held company as an electrician. 

Ayush stayed at home to take care of her daughter until 2006. In 2006, she began to work as a saleswoman at someone's food stall at the local market, Enhjin. In 2007, after she had gained experience, she started running her own tiny business by renting a food stall at the same market. Ayush took a loan from the bank to buy food products, including pickles, mayonnaise and several types of bottled salads to create a business inventory. From her business profits, she repaid the full amount of the loan. 

Now Ayush's son helps her business. The monthly rent she pays for her stall is 80,000 MNT ($1.00 USD=1500 MNT). Her daily average income is 40,000-60,000 MNT. She earns a profit of around 20 percent. From the business profit, she paid for her son's tuition. With this loan, Ayush will invest in more of the food products that she buys from wholesalers.

loans.use: Buy more food products for her food stall

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
K. is 54 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has six children: four of them are attending school, and the other two are married and living separately. She is married to Bo, 60, who is a local farmer.

K. has raised pigs behind her house for more than 8 years. To meet her family's needs, she also helps her husband plant rice on another plot of her farmland located a bit farther from her house. Her children help her with her work after their classes. The family has earned a better profit with its businesses.

K. is applying for a loan of $1200 to buy a plot of farmland and more piglets for her stall. The loan will help the family achieve a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland and more piglets for her stall

loans.name: Tarcila

texts.en:
Tarcila U., 60, married and blessed with two children, is living in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City Southern Philippines. One of her children is in 4th year high school. Every day, she works hard to support the needs of her family. She was engaged in running a variety store (sari-sari store) but unfortunately, it failed.

Tarcila didn't lose hope. She attended one of the seminars regarding basic business management conducted by HSPFI. Having that knowledge, she wants to start a new store and needs the loan amount of PHP 11,000 to purchase grocery items to open up her store. Tarcila thanks you for funding her new store.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Pelba

texts.en:
Pelba T. grows rice for a living. She is 55 years old and has 4 children. She and her husband till their 4 hectares of land to support their family. Their harvest is for family use; what remains is sold to rice traders in order to add their family's income. Her children are studying; she has to budget her money to make sure that she can pay for their tuition and books. She and her husband work very hard to give their children a good future. 

She is asking a CEVI loan of Php 10,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers to increase her yield. The loan will truly help her increase her harvest. It will also help her start another business to augment her family's income.

CEVI gives entrepreneurs like Pelba a chance to start and sustain their businesses. They give all their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
T. is 48 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has two children: both of them are single and live with her. To help the family income, one of her children works in a small company.

T. earns her living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She also helps orphans in her village by working in the orphan center. She is famous for her job and her responsible character.

T. wants to have a healthier family by increasing her income so she is applying for a loan of US$ 800 to buy more piglets and pigfeed. The loan will help the family attain a better living standard.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pigfeed

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg T. is a single mother. She lives with four of her children in a "ger" (a ger is a traditional nomadic Mongolian home) on a plot of land she owns herself. She used to live in the country as a herder and owned over 400 animals, while running a business making crafts at home. Her children helped her to take care of all the animals and make crafts.

In 2005, Oyunchimeg's family sold all their animals and came to live in the center of the province. After she moved, she continued her handicraft business. Oyunchimeg has lots of experience with the Mongolian, nomadic way of life. She is also skillful making handicrafts as well as Mongolian traditional clothing, stuffed toys like camels, horses and felt art. She also makes a tiny, souvenir "ger", complete with little furniture, that is sold mostly to foreign tourists. Every year she participates in many art exhibitions that are organized either in the center of Uvurhangai province or in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The loan she is taking now is to buy more cotton and silk for her craft-making.

loans.use: to buy more cotton and silk for her craft-making

loans.name: Ream

texts.en:
K. is 48 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has five children: four of them are single and live with her, and the other one is married and lives separately. To support the family's needs, one of her children works as a metal welder. She is married to Yim, 51, who works as a motor taxi driver.

K. has been a fruit seller in the Sereysophon market for more one year. She buys her products from the villagers in bulk and takes them from her house to the market, selling retail at a good price. She recently wants to have more rice for her stock, for supporting her family. So, K. is applying for a loan of US$ 500 to buy more rice for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy more rice for her and her family

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
"Hard-working woman" describes Mrs. Alice A., 57 years old, separated and living at Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City. She has 2 children. She acts as father and mother at the same time after they separated from her husband for personal reasons. But life must go on with Alice. She has to strive to earn a living.

Being a market fish vendor is her main work. One must be wise enough in order to survive in this kind of business. With this, she was able to support the daily needs of her family. There is enough income in fish retailing, especially when there is a high demand for fish. In order to have additional capital, she joined Paglaum Cooperative in January 2001. She already received loans several times. Now, she is applying for PHP 5,000 to buy more fish for sale. She plans to own an additional stall in the market. She also wants to provide her family with a decent and comfortable life in future.

loans.use: to buy more fish for re-sale

location.town: Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Genkey

texts.en:
A simple woman is Genkey Merkado, 39 years old, married and a resident of Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City. She has 2 children. Her main source of income is fish retailing at Oroquieta City public market. Fortunately, she was able to acquire a stall in the public market which she considers a blessing, where she can display a variety of fish.

In order to have additional working capital, she joined Paglaum Cooperative in October 2000. She has had loans several times. Now, she is applying for PHP 5,000 to buy additional fish. She plans to purchase a fish car someday, for easy transport of fish to different areas.

loans.use: to buy additional  fish for re-sale

location.town: Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Mohammad Alam

texts.en:
Mohammad Alam is an uneducated man but he has lots of experience. He has a retail shop that he has been involved in  for more than 10 years in Nangrahar province. Before that he worked in agriculture in his own town. Now he has  the responsibility of his family. During the last 10 years Mohammad Alam tried to enlarge his shop but he could not afford the cost. When he found AFSG in Jalalabad he was very happy and decided to apply for a loan.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghanis for the term of 11 months to enlarge his shop and further his business with the hope of making a good monthly income for his family.

Alam wants to thank lenders around the world and  Kiva and AFSG for this fantastic loan process.

loans.use: To enlarge and buying some necessary things for his shop

loans.name: Narzullo

texts.en:
Narzullo A. applied first to the MicroInvest loan programme in 2009 but he recommends himself already as a reliable client. He was born in 1981 in the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. Narzullo is married and has 2 children. He has no special education but he is a hard-working young man. He is as an odd-job worker but the general family income comes from their livestock business. He is experienced in livestock so he started the livestock business when he was still very young and helped his father to take care of domestic animals.

Narzullo has one cow and 4 rams. He dreams of having a big farm and a good flock. He is ready to work hard to ensure a good future for his family and to realize his dreams. Now Narzullo is applying to KIVA with the request for a business development loan of 1600 STJ for purchasing one milk cow. He thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best to all lenders.

loans.use: purchasing one milk cow

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
P. is 39 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She has three children: all of them are single and attend school. She is married to Riem who is a water pipe repairman. She has been providing jars for storing water throughout the village since 2005. She is famous for her jars, because she is good at making jars, a skill which she learned from her parents. She has gained a lot of customers and a better profit from this business.

Recently, P. wants to increase her income as the family's expenses require. So for that reason, P. is applying for a loan of US$ 500 to buy a jar mold and its accessories. She dreams of having a big jar shop and advanced degrees for her children.

loans.use: To buy a jar mold and its accessories

loans.name: Aquino

texts.en:
Mr. Aquino M., is a resident of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 60 years old with 4 children. The family relies on income from farming. The family needs to wait 6 months to harvest coconuts and 3 months for bananas.

Aquino has many plans in life, and he wants to supply the needs of the family. At present, Aquino is very busy with his farm, and he wants to have other income source aside from farming. So, he joined HSPFI and was able to receive his first loan. With the money he received, Aquino put up a sari-sari (variety store). And now he needs additional capital amounting to PHP 11,000 to purchase grocery inventory for sale to address the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase  grocery inventory for sale

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Саидов Шавкат мужчина 47 лет , женат имеет троих детей.Он вместе с женой занимается бизнесом продажи косметических товаров.За товаром ездит сам Шавкат , а жена замещает его.Дети взрослые, две дочки учатся в высших учебных заведениях.Шавкат хочет получить кредит для увеличения своего оборота.Их точка реализации расположена в центре города Худжанда.Скоро весна и женский праздник 8 марта, поэтому Шавкат говорит , что будет разгар продажи и он хочет привести новинки туалетных вод,и дезодорантов.Во время мониторинга Шавкат был в отъезде за товаром,на снимке его жена.Взяв первый кредит Шавкат открыл дополнительную точку по продаже продуктов питания, которая расположена рядом с ларьком парфюмерии.Где торгует его жена.
texts.en:
Shavkat S. is 47, married and has 3 children. Shavkat and his wife sell cosmetics (on the photo is Shavkat's wife near the family's stall). The children have grown up: two of Shavkat's daughters are in college. Shavkat wants to use this loan to increase the volume of goods sold. His stall is located in the center of Khudzhand. The Spring is coming and the International Women's Day (March 8) approaching soon. This loan will help Shavkat to get and sell the goods, while they are in most demand.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of Cosmetics

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa E. raises pigs. She has been in this business since 1990. She loves raising hogs; moreover, she uses the profit she makes to raise her family. Her husband, Jessie E., is very much supportive of her. She is 40 years old; all of her three children attend school. She finds it hard to budget their resources. The pigs that she raises have helped her pay the tuition fees and books.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. The loan will also help Milagrosa buy more piglets and increase the size of her business. 

CEVI helps their clients grow their businesses. They give all their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing pig feed

loans.name: Abdugofir

texts.en:
Abdugofir I. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2008 when he applied first for a livestock business development loan. It helped him to purchase a milk cow and to start the business selling milk.

Today Abdugofir intends to open a specialized outlet selling sour milk products produced by his wife and relatives involved in this business. They plan to produce and sell pasteurized milk, curd, cream and the Tajik traditional product called “kurut” (salted dry milk cream).

Abdugfur has 10 years' experience dealing with livestock and he has the appropriate skills to use in practice. Abdugofir is applying to KIVA with the request for financial support in the form of a business development loan of 2000 STJ for 8 months. He wants to open his sour-milk outlet in the crowded local bazaar.

loans.use: to open an outlet in the crowded local bazaar

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle C. is engaged in a pig raising business. She grows pigs and sells all of them to some meat retailers in their village. Because pigs are always in demand, she doesn't have to worry about whether or not she'll be able to sell them. She is 39 years old and has 2 children. She worked in an electronics factory in Manila from 1992 to 1994. In 2004, she decided to stop working and get married. That same year, she started raising piglets. 

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for the pigs. She also is interested in looking for some other money making ventures to augment their income. 

CEVI helps Rochelle and its other clients grow their businesses. They give all their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing pig feed

loans.name: Khasan

texts.en:
K. Khasan was born in 1958 in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has three children who help him in the family livestock business. Khasan is a builder by professional background, but it is seasonal work, so the family also needs the incomes the livestock brings.

Khasan has been engaged in the livestock business for 25 years and he has the appropriate skills, which he uses in practice. Khasan rears the livestock and sells it. He is also involved in the production and selling of milk.

Khasan has applied to Kiva for a business development loan of $325 for 6 months to build a seasonal cow house. He thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To build a seasonal cow house

loans.name: Landy

texts.en:
Landy A. is a farmer. He grows rice to support his family. He is 49 years old and has 2 children. He is worried about getting money to sustain his 2 hectare farm business. His wife, Jerlyn A., supports him in all his decisions. Together, they work hard to raise their children well. He has been tilling the land for 15 years. Aside from being a farmer, he was also elected as a Brgy. councilor. He consequently serves the community for a 3 year term.

He is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy more fertilizer. The loan will allow him to have an abundant harvest.

CEVI helps farmers increase their yield. CEVI clients engaged in farming are also given credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Amanalah Group

texts.en:
Amanalah is the group leader of the Amanalah group. There are five members in this group and they all live in district 17 in Kabul Afghanistan. The total amount that the group members want to take is 50000 Afghani for the term of 7 months. Each member wants to take the loan to help the progress of his/her business. Aqalah wants to take a loan for purchasing materials for her brother's tailoring business. Anefa wants to take a loan for her brother’s beading business. bobo gull wants to take a loan for her brother’s quilt business. M. Rafe wants to take a loan for his fruit cart business. Amanalah wants to take a loan for his work shop.  
They all want to say that with these loans they will be able to progress in their businesses.

loans.use: They want to buy the necessary materials for they businesses

loans.name: Nigina

texts.en:
M. Nigina has been selling children's wear for 8 years. She lives in the B.Gafurov region but she trades in the Khujand local bazaar.

Nigina first applied to for a loan from MicroInvest in 2008. Her previous loans helped her to increase her business turnover, so she trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. She started her business practically from scratch but, thanks to her previous loans, she was able open a trade outlet selling children's wear. She works with straight suppliers so she can sell her goods at lower prices. She has repeat customers and a good assortment of clothes.

Nigina is applying to Kiva for a loan of $275 for 5 months to import the seasonal wear that permits her to increase her business turnover. Nigina thanks Kiva for its support.

loans.use: Import children's seasonal wear

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean G. is a rice farmer. She is 40 years old and has 3 children. Her husband, Aladin G., is a farmer as well. Her husband is the one managing their 1 hectare land. Previously, Mary Jean worked as an office clerk. She was not happy with her former job because she received little compensation. So, she went back to their village to help manage their small farm.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy the fertilizer that she needs. She believes that she will then make more of a profit and will thus be able to support her children, who are in school. She is also interested in looking for some other money making ventures. Aside from farming, she wishes to establish a small store. The loan will help her do so.

CEVI is helping people start and sustain their businesses. In addition to providing credit assistance, they give their members training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer and starting up a small store

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia E. grows rice. She started her business using 1 hectare of land, which she inherited from her parents. Now, she has abundant harvests that help her contribute to the family's income. She is 55 years old and has 3 children. Aside from farming, she also established her own "sari-sari" store. "Sari-sari" is a Filipino term for variety. It's a shop that has various different items for sale.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more fertilizers for her farm and merchandise for her "sari-sari" store. The loan will truly help her expand her business. Subsequently, she will be able to  support her children by paying the tuition fees for their schooling and buying the books that they need.

CEVI supports Cecilia in her business. Now, she enjoys having CEVI credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
M. Rahila has been an active MicroInvest client since 2004. Rahila trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure so she intends to work tightly with our programme for a long time. Thanks to her previous loans, she was able to increase her business turnover and to start a new business direction. She used to trade milk and kefir in the local bazaar but today she has opened a specialized trade outlet making and selling doughnuts. She makes doughnut with meat, potatoes, vegetables, and fruits in summer. Rahila prepares tasty doughnuts so she has many repeat customers.

Rahila is applying to Kiva for a business support loan of 4000 STJ for 6 months to buy the special heat equipment that permits her to work safely and increase her production. Rahila thanks Kiva for its precious support of small enterpreneurs all over the world.

loans.use: Buy special heat equipment for doughnut production

loans.name: Faqer Sha

texts.en: Faqer S. lives in District 15 in Kabul Afghanistan. He is married and lives there with his extended family. Faqer S. has a gas shop and is very hard worker with a lot of experience in his work, so he wants to expand his business. He is requesting an individual loan of 50000 Afghan for the term of 16 months to expand his stock and increase his monthly income to help support his family.

loans.use: To enlarge his business and buy the necessary materials for his shop

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
S. is 28 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She owns a house which she had just built economically.

S. has owned a clothes shop in the Toektla market since 2001. She buys clothes from Thailand and resell them to her customers in the province. Recently, S. has booked a number of clothes for her shop because of her clients' demand. Therefore, S. is looking for a loan of $1200 to purchase more clothes for her shop. The loan will help her business be successful.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her shop

loans.name: Safina Group

texts.en:
Amina has owned a small shop in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 5 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. She is requesting her second loan from Kiva partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more cement and a mattress for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Amina is 30 years old, married, and has four children. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Salama and Twalha. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more cement and mattress for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa E. owns 1.75 hectares of land. She dreams of acquiring 5 more hectares someday. Her husband, Domingo E., is the one managing their farm; he is helped by their children. All of her children are studying, so the net income of their harvest goes to school fees and the books that her children ask her to buy. She has been a CEVI client for almost 2 years already and needs additional capital to run her farm.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides in her farm. The loan will truly help her increase her yield. Consequently, she will have more support to give to all her children.

CEVI helps entrepreneurs build and start their own businesses. They provide credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Zuwena H. J. has her own small shop in the Melinne neighborhood on the island of Zanzibar.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $840. She works at her business every day.  She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more items for her business. She is hoping this loan will allow her profits to increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Zuwena is 30 years old, married and has four children: ages between 10, 8, 6 and 4.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Rukia O. M., who also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.en:
Saidniso M. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2002. She recommends herself as a serious and reliable client who has not had any loan repayment delays. Her business turnover increase helped her to take each following loan step.

Saidniso is 29 years old. She is married with 3 children. She lives in Khujand and works in the local crowded bazaar. She sells small items and electrical items (electrical heaters, water heaters, telephone accessories, etc.) She has been engaged in this business for 2 years. She brings in her goods herself from Istaravshan.

Saidniso is applying to KIVA with a request for a business support loan in the amount of 4100 STJ for 2 months to increase her business inventory assortment and turnover. She thanks KIVA lenders for their support.

loans.use: business assortment and turnover increase

loans.name: Rashidan Gulzar Masih Group

texts.en:
Rashidan baji, 52, is a widow and a citizen of a historic place called Yadgar in the city of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 40 years. Rashidan baji is an uneducated lady. She couldn’t get an education because her parents couldn’t bear her education expenses. Rashidan baji’s deceased husband left her with one son. She worked hard to establish her son. She has been selling clothes for 10 years and has been able to register her son in a driving school so that he was able to learn driving skills. She is still selling clothes because she has a good number of customers in the community and outside of the community. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her son so that he will be able to earn a good income.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Gulshan baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. Doras I. wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Mussarat baji wants a loan to buy iron for making iron rods to sell. Naseem Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina G. is a rice grower. She is 43-years old, and already a widow. She has three children who are in school. Since her husband's death, she is the sole manager of their small plot of land, the main source of her income. Her harvest also greatly helps to feed her family. She has a previous work experience as a payroll clerk in Notredame Hospital, found in Cotabato City in Mindanao. When she got married, she stopped working to help her husband with the farm. Now, she spends her spare time working as Brgy. Record Keeper in Brgy. hall. 

She is requesting a loan of to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. She is also hopes to open a small store. This loan will help her increase the yield on her farm and get her store started.

CEVI provides their client not just credit assistance. They also provide trainings and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm necessities

loans.name: Abdurazok

texts.ru: Абдуразок мужчина 25 лет , женат имеет одного ребёнка.Проживает в отдалённом районе Уткансой, расположенном вблизи гор.Жена молодая доярка собственных двух коров.Сам Абдуразок работает в колхозе трактористом.Ему колхоз не выплачивает зарплату , а выдают в начале года продукты питания на проживание(муку, рис , хлопковое масло,и.т.д.)поэтому для дополнительного дохода Абдуразок занимается бизнесом животноводства.Для увеличения Скота он хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Abdurazok A. is 25 years old, married and has a child. He lives in a distant Utkansoi district situated near mountains. His wife is a young milkmaid for their own two cows. Abdurazok works as a tractor driver at a collective farm. The farm does not pay him salary, but gives him food products (flour, rice, cottonseed oil, etc.) at the beginning of a year. Therefore, Abdurazok raises cattle to subsidize his income. He wants to obtain this loan to increase cattle headcount.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Tawakal Kwa Mola Group

texts.en:
Marieta P. is a milk seller in the Melinne neighborhood on the island of Zanzibar, Tanzania. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. She works at her business every day.  She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more milk for resale. She is hoping this loan will help increase her profits and she will be able to expand her business.  

Marieta is 35 years old, married and has two children: ages 5 and 3. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Rehema A., who also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more milk for resale

loans.name: Huma M. Nadeem Group

texts.en:
Huma baji, 37,is a married lady and a citizen of a historic place called Yadgar in the city of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 18 years. Huma baji passed her 10th standard. She couldn’t study further because her parents married her off to a man whose name is M. N., a painter by profession. This is not his regular source of income because he can only get income when people call him to paint their houses.

Huma baji shares the financial burden of her husband by doing decorative embroidery. She prepares embroidered dresses, taking the orders from her relatives and neighbors. Her husband is very happy with her caring behavior. Huma baji successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more paint for her husband’s painting business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Rani baji wants a loan to buy leather to sell. Rehana Kosar baji wants a loan to buy paint to sell. Josphen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nazia baji wants a loan to pay off the remaining installments on her auto-rickshaw. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy paint for her husband's business

loans.name: Mwanakheri

texts.en:
Mwanakheri M. is a fish seller in the Melinne neighborhood on the island of Zanzibar, Tanzania. She belongs to Tupendane group loan (Group code 2005).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business.  She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more fish for her business. She is hoping through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Mwanakheri is 38 years old, married with five children: ages 15, 12, 11, 10 and 8.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Shahzadi Nishat Ahmad Group

texts.en:
"My name is Shahzadi and I’m 38 years old. I am a citizen of a historic place called Yadgar in the city of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 12 years. My parents used to call me 'princess' because of my good behavior. My husband's name is N. A. and he is involved in making decorative pieces. He particularly uses glass pieces for making his decorative pieces. He learnt this art from his father. He has been doing this work for the past 10 years. I passed 10th standard and now I’m working in a school as a teacher and also running my own center where I teach 10 students. I earned Pak Rs.6,000 and I invested some of my income in a revolving committee and plan to renovate my house when it's my turn to get the whole amount. I am applying for a loan to buy glass to expand my husband’s decorative pieces sales business. "I’m the group leader for some more women from my locality. Jamila baji and Shamim Begum baji each want a loan to buy paper reams to sell. Bushra Parveen baji wants a loan to buy iron to make iron rods to sell."

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy glass for making decorative pieces

loans.name: Ana Riza

texts.en:
Ana Riza F. She is 29-years old, has two children, and owns a "Basak", a Filipino term for rice field. She grows rice and uses her harvest for family consumption. What her family doesn't need is sold to rice traders in their village  to augment their income. Formally, she worked as a "saleslady" or person who traded products inside the malls and department stores. She has been a CEVI client for two years and has a good repayment records.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. The loan will help her increase her yield and have more rice to sell.  

CEVI helps Ana Riza grow her business. She is provided with credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs for the farm

loans.name: Tuichiboi

texts.ru: Усмонов Туйчибой мужчина 36 лет , отец пятерых детей, жена домохозяйка.Туйчибой бизнесмен по купле продаже скота.Сам работает пастухом в колхозе.У самого Туйчибоя собственных коз 50 голов.Он целыми днями уходит в горы пасти скот.При мониторинге была встреча с его женой , сам Туйчибой отсутствовал.Фото сделано в день выдачи.Кредит хочет получить для увеличения голов скота,пока скот дешёвый на рынке.
texts.en:
Tuichiboi U. is a 36-year-old father of five. His wife is a homemaker. Tuichiboi’s business is buying and selling livestock. He works as a shepherd at a collective farm. He owns 50 goats. Tuichiboi spends entire days in the mountains grazing livestock. During his business monitoring, the meeting was with his wife, as Tuichiboi was absent. He wants to obtain this loan to increase his livestock headcount, especially now that livestock prices are cheap.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling livestock

loans.name: Farzana Arshad Group

texts.en:
Farzana baji, 36, is a married lady and a citizen of a historic place called Yadgar in the city of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 16 years. Her husband's name is A. and he has a jewelry-selling business. He has been selling jewelry for the past 10 years. He buys jewelry from famous cities (Lahore and Multan).

Farzana baji is the mother of five kids: four daughters and one son. Her son works as a salesman in a famous bakery in Lahore named “Gourmet”. Her daughters stay home and do the household work. Farzana baji is a seamstress and she sews clothes, taking orders from her relatives and from her neighbors. She charges US$ 2 per dress. She has successfully repaid three loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more jewelry to expand her husband’s jewelry-selling business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Asia baji and Parveen Akhtar baji and Ruqaiya baji each want a loan to buy iron for making iron rods to sell. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy jewelry to re-sell

loans.name: Nyanzi Chriatine Group

texts.en:
Christine is 24 years of age, and she is married with 2 children, ages 3 and 1 year. Her children are still too young to go to school. Ms. N. rents a single room with neither electricity nor water and they are four people staying in that room. She has one meal a day and the greatest expense for her in a month are food and medications for her family.
