Christine sells charcoal to earn a living for herself , and she sells from home; she works six days a week. She receives about 20 customers a day and they can be men, women, and children. She sells on a retail basis. She has done this type business for three years now.

The main challenge she faces in her business is that at times they supply her with poor quality charcoal and her customers complain. The rainy season also affects the supply of charcoal since most suppliers don’t go to villages to collect the charcoal when it rains a lot because of the poor roads.

Christine has worked with MCDT for 2 years now and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because it serves the poor. She wants to use the loan she receives from MCDT to increase her stock. She also would like to expand on her business and be able to sell on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: increase her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Maryam M. Javed Group

texts.en:
Maryam Baji is 30 years old, married, and a citizen of a historical place named Yadgar in Lahore, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband is M. J., who has a jewelry selling business. He buys jewelry from his native city Lahore. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. Maryam Baji helps him by selling his jewelry in the community, because his customers admire his collection. Maryam Baji successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more jewelry for her husband.

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Nasira Baji and Shahzadi Baji each want a loan to buy spare parts for vehicles to sell. Samina Baji wants a loan to buy jewelry to sell. Asia Baji wants a loan to buy reams of paper to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Mamadier

texts.ru: Мамадёр мужчина 30 лет , женат имеет четверых детей.Жена домохозяйка занимается уходом и воспитанием детьми.Сам Мамадёр ежедневно работает разнорабочим.Его средний доход очень низкий , не хватает на проживание семьи.Поэтому он с молодости занимается откормом и продажей скота,для увеличения скота и расширения сарая  он хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Mamadier is 30 years old, married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker, who takes care of the children. Mamadier works as a handyman every day. His income is very low and is not enough to support his family. That is why since his youth, Mamadier has been raising and selling livestock. He wants to use this loan to increase his livestock headcount and to expand his barn.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling livestock

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia B. is 41-old, has one child in school, and -- with her husband -- is a rice farmer. The school is raising the tuition and book fees. She sells a variety of godds in her small "sari-sari" store, which supplements somewhat the income from rice farming. "Sari-sari" means variety in the Philippines. Its like a sundry shop. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and to add more merchandise in her store. This will increase the yield of her small farm and help her attract more customers in her store.

CEVI helps her grow her farm. She has access to CEVI credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for a rice farm and inventory for a small general store

loans.name: Mwandawa

texts.en:
Mwandawa I. M. is a firewood and fruits seller in the Melinne neighborhood on the island of Zanzibar, Tanzania. She belongs to Takrima loan group (Group code 2034).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day she sells firewood and fruits. She is hoping this loan will allow her to increase her profits and grow her business.  

Mwandawa is 28 years old, married with seven children: ages 13, 12, 11, 9, 7, 2 and 1.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina L. owns a small food store in the Melinne neighborhood on the island of Zanzibar, Tanzania. She's had her business for 5 years. She sells snacks, such as Maandazi, a sweet, fried dough.  She belongs to Umoja Ni Nguvu group loan (Group code 2002).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more food items for her business. She is hoping this loan will allow her to increase her profit and grow her business.  

Christina is 29 years old married with two children.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: I Komang Wistra

texts.id: I Komang Wistra sudah menyelesaikan pinjamannya untuk tahap yang pertama. Pinjaman tersebut dipergunakan untuk biaya pengolahan tanah yang meliputi pembelian pupuk kimia, pupuk organik dan biaya untuk penyemprotan anti hama. Untuk masa tanam saat ini, pertumbuhan vanilinya bisa berkembang dengan baik karena mendapat perawatan yang optimal. Setiap tanaman vanili bisa menghasilkan 2 – 5 kilogram vanili basah. Panen yang lalu I Komang Wistra mendapatkan hasil 500 kilogram. Namun, saat ini harga vanili sangat rendah, yakni Rp. 5.000.- per kilogram. Jadi panen yang lalu I Komang Wistra hanya mendapatkan 500 x 5000 = Rp. 2.500.000.- Walaupun hasil yang didapat tidak sesuai dengan yang diharapkan, namun I Komang Wistra tidak terlalu bersedih karena dikebunnya terdapat juga pohon kakao yang juga mendapatkan perawatan dari biaya yang dikeluarkan untuk perawatan vanili. Pinjaman kedua ini I Komang Wistra berencana untuk lebih fokus untuk tanaman kakao karena hasilnya lebih baik dan harganya stabil. Pinjaman kedua ini dipergunakan untuk biaya pupuk dan bibit kakao untuk memperbanyak tanaman kakao yang sudah dimilikinya.
texts.en:
I Komang Wistra has fully paid off his 1st loan from DINARI foundation. He used that loan for his farming activities, buying organic and chemical fertilizer.As a result his vanilla farm (Vanilla planifolia) gives a good harvest. One vanilla plant can produce 2-5 KG vanilla. He harvested around 500 KG in the last harvest season. However due to the drop in vanilla price, I Komang Wistra only earned IDR 2.5 million from it (around USD 210).

I Komang Wistra is now planning to a new loan from DINARI. This time around he wants to focus on his Cacao plants. He switched to Cacao because cacao price is more stabile than vanilla. He is going to use this loan to buy more high quality cacao seed and fertilizer.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy cacao seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha H. S. is a snack seller in the Melinne neighborhood on the island of Zanzibar, Tanzania. She belongs to Tujitegemee  loan group (Group code 2003).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more flour, cooking oil and sugar for her business. She is hoping this loan will allow her to increase her profits wand expand  her business.  

Asha is 32 years old, married with a 12 year old child. She also cares for two dependents.

loans.use: To buy more flour,cooking oil and sugar for her business.

loans.name: I Made Weneh

texts.id: Walaupun hasil yang didapat tidak seperti yang diharapkan karena rendahnya harga vanili, namun I Made Weneh tidak merasa dirugikan karena selain mendapat dana, dia juga mendapat pelatihan membuat pupuk organik dan perawatan tanaman dari staf Dinari. Kegagalan yang sudah lalu dipakainya sebagai pengalaman untuk mencoba usaha sejenis yang tidak jauh berbeda, yaitu menanam pohon kakao. Tanaman kakao mudah dalam perawatan dan berbuah sepanjang minggu. Harganya stabil dan setiap seminggu sekali bisa dipanen. I Made Weneh merencanakan pinjaman kedua ini untuk mengembangkan usahanya diperkebunan kakao. Pinjaman itu akan dipergunakan untuk biaya mengolah tanah dan membeli bibit kakao. I Made Weneh optimis usahanya akan lebih baik dan bisa mendapatkan hasil yang optimal untuk kesejahteraan keluarganya
texts.en:
I Made Weneh participated in DINARI loan program and used the funding for his vanilla (Vanilla planifolia) farming venture. However due to vanilla price dropped significantly during the last harvest season, he cannot get optimal earning from his harvest. However he is not disappointed. Even though he cannot earn as expected he had a good experience and he was trained by DINARI staff on how to make organic fertilizer. He is optimistic that he can leverage his new learned skills for his future cacao farming venture.

He thinks cacao is better than vanilla as cacao is easier to grow and the market price is more stabile. It can also be harvested once a week. He is applying for a new loan with DINARI and he will use it to fund his cacao farming activities.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy cacao sedds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes L. is 46-years old, has two children in school and she and her husband are rice growers. She also grows vegetables in her backyard. What her family doesn't eat, she sells to others to raise money for the family's needs.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers. This will increase the small farm's yield and improve her income. Lourdes is also considering other income options to help her husband.

CEVI provides their clients not just credit assistance. They also provide trainings and insurance coverage services to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: I Made Mekir

texts.id: Jatuhnya harga vanili berimbas kepada semua petani yang menanam pohon vanili di kebunnya. Demikian juga yang dialami oleh I Made Mekir. Namun, dengan adanya pendampingan dari staf Dinari, I Made Mekir disarankan untuk beralih ke usaha baru yang lebih menjanjikan yaitu menanam pohon kakao. Saat ini tanaman kakao sangat diminati oeh banyak petani karena perawatannya yang mudah, namun hasilnya maksimal. Harganya pun relatif stabil dipasaran. Pinjaman kedua ini akan dipergunakan untuk biaya pengolahan tanah dan membeli bibit kakao. I Made Mekir merasa bersyukur karena mendapat pendampingan dan solusi untuk masalahnya sehingga ia tidak merasa rugi terlalu banyak. I Made Mekir berencana untuk mengganti seluruh tanaman vanilinya dengan kakao agar hasil yang didapat akan maksimal.
texts.en:
The drop in vanilla price impacted a lot of vanilla farmer, including I Made Mekir. For the next farming season I Made Mekir is advised by DINARI foundation to switch to cacao. Cacao is the favorite plan at the moment. It is easy to grow and the price is stabile.

I Made Mekir is going to use the new loan to grow cacao.He will replace all of his vanilla with cacao.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy cacao seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Mrs. Flordeliz S., 37 years old, married to a motorcycle driver, is presently residing at Cagay-anon, Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She has a 12-year old daughter studying at Jimenez Central School. She is engaged in retailing gasoline. The motorcycle drivers and fishermen are her main customers.

The business was started with a minimal capital of PhP 2,000 she got from her savings. One day a friend came to visit here and told regarding PMPC and the services being offered to its members. She was so impressed then and believed that she will be helped in having additional capital so she can augmentincome for the household.

She then attended the seminar and became a full-pledged member and was able to avail of a loan. Now, she is in her fourth loan cycle amounting to PHP5,000. She is hoping that through PMPC she can send her only daughter to school,  later on finish college and have a stable job for her the bright future of her own family.

loans.use: To purchase additional gasoline for sale

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia M. B. is a clothing seller in the Melinne neighborhood on the island of Zanzibar, Tanzania. She has sold clothing for a year. She belongs to Asaa khery loan group (Group code 2014).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more Khanga's (fabric, often worn as a wrap over clothing or a head scarf) and body oil for her business. She is hoping this loan will allow her profits to increase and grow her business.  

Zakia is 21 years old married with a 2 year old child.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (khanga) and body oil for her business.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma  A. T. owns a small shop in the Melinne neighborhood on the island of Zanzibar, Tanzania for the last 2 years. She belongs to Mombasa Two group loan (Group code 2052).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more items for her business and food for her family. She is hoping through this loan her profits will increase and she can expand her business

Mwajuma is 28 years old, married with two children, ages 5 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business and food for her family.

loans.name: I Made Sudara

texts.id: Sebagai seorang petani, I Made Sudara menghabiskan sebagian besar waktunya untuk mengolah lahan dikebunnya. Saat ini ia memiliki 20 are lahan yang didapatnya dari warisan orang tuanya. Sebagian besar ditanami dengan pohon kakao dan pohon kelapa. Karena ingin meningkatkan kesejahteraan keluarganya, I Made Sudara ingin memiliki sapi yang akan dipeliharanya dikebun miliknya. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, I Made Sudara dapat membeli 2 ekor sapi dengan harga per ekornya Rp. 2.000.000.- Sisa dari pinjaman itu dipergunakan untuk membuat kandang sederhana. I Made Sudara berencana untuk memelihara induk sapi sehingga nanti bisa mendapatkan anak sapi untuk dijual kembali. Karena kebun miliknya cukup luas, I Made Sudara tidak mengalamai kesulitan untuk mencari pakannya. Sapi jenis lokal cukup diberikan pakan dari dedaunan dan rumput segar sehingga bisa menekan biaya yang dikeluarkan. Jika usahanya ini sukses, I Made Sudara ingin menekuni usaha sebagai peternak sapi dengan lebih serius.
texts.en:
I Made Sudara has 20 acre of land which he inherited from his parents. He uses this land to grow cacao and coconut. He wants to have more income so he is planning to raise cows. He wants to apply for a loan and buy 2 cows. The price of 1 cow is around USD 170. He also wanted to built a simple hut for the cows.

He plans to buy breeding cows so they can produce more cows. If this venture is successful, he wants to expand more in the future.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 2 cows

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
T. is 47 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She has four children: two of them are single and live with her, and the other are married and lived separately. To help earn a stable family income, one of her sons works as a rice trader in Sereysophon market with an income of $4 per day. T. is married to Khy, 64, who owns a rice milling machine. T. currently wants to plant crops on her farmland for the coming traditional festival. So T. is applying for a loan of $600 to hire a tractor to plow her farmland and to buy natural fertilizer.

She dreams of having a bigger house and a master's degree for her daughter. T. was not available for the photograph so Khy is in the picture instead.

loans.use: To hire a tractor to plow her farmland and to buy natural fertilizer

loans.name: Khayr Mohammad

texts.en:
Khayr M. is the son of D. M.. He is 43 years old and he lives in Kabul Afghanistan.  He is married with three children and he has a metal shop. He has been involved in this business for more than 6 years and he wants to make his business larger.
Khayr has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 15 months. He wants to buy new machines for his shop.
Khayr is very happy with this loan process and he hopes to continue his involvement with both AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: He wants to expand his business

loans.name: Namiya Mastula Group

texts.en:
Mastula is the leader of a 5-member group. She is 39 and married with 4 children, aged between 5 and 18 years. All her children go to school. She takes care of five orphan children of her late sister. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she is staying with four people. They neither have electricity nor piped water at home. The family gets two meals a day and rarely take tea.

Mastula works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She sells charcoal in Makerere Market in one of the city suburbs. Mastula works seven days a week and buys charcoal from villages where she incurs extra transport costs. Mastula pays a license fee of 20,000/= per month as well as rent plus an operating license She sells to an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale.

Mastula has been in this business for the last 20 years and has been with MCDT for only one year, but is servicing her third loan, working all this time with the same group mates. Mastula is faced with a challenge in the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her and makes transportation of her merchandise difficult, because roads become impassable. Her monthly expenses include rent for the business stall, school fees, and food. She joined MCDT simply because it caters for women's problems. She wants to use the loan to buy charcoal and to pay school fees for her dependents. She aspires to buy a plot of land and build rental rooms.

loans.use: increase her stock of charcoal

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema A. Z. owns a small charcoal and firewood store in the Melinne neighborhood on the island of Zanzibar, Tanzania. She's owned her business for 2 years. She belongs to Tujitegemee group loan (Group code 2003).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She is hoping this loan will increase her profits and she can grow her business.  

Rehema is 24 years old, married with a 9 year old child.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma Y. is a fish seller in the Melinne neighborhood on the island of Zanzibar, Tanzania. She belongs to Tuwe Na Moyo group loan (Group code 2012).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business.  She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more charcoal and fish for her business. She is hoping this loan will increase her profits and allow her to grow her business.  

Fatma is 32 years old, married, with four children ages between 6 and 16.

loans.use: To buy more fish and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Yaing

texts.en:
S. is 59 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She has three children: all of them are married. Sokhom, 27, is S.'s daughter and a clothing sewer. S. is a widow and is a local fish seller. Besides her selling, S. also owns farmland which she inherited from her parents. She is known for her hard work and responsibility.

S. wants to increase her farming income, so she is applying for a loan of $600 to buy a plot of farmland next to her field. S. was not available during the photograph so Sokhom's picture was taken instead.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland next to her field

loans.name: Ukombozi Group

texts.en:
Ashura A. owns a small shop and charcoal store in the Melinne neighborhood on the island of Zanzibar, Tanzania. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more charcoal and to improve her business. She is hoping with this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Ashura is 23 years old, widowed with two children, ages 5 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and to improve her business.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma J. N. is a perfumes and chips (french fries) seller in the Melinne neighborhood on the island of Zanzibar, Tanzania. She's been a seller for 5 years. She belongs to Wapendanao group loan (Group code 2008).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more perfumes and Irish potatoes for her business and to open a kiosk. She is hoping with this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Fatma is 41 years old, divorced with a 3 year old.

loans.use: To buy more perfumes, irish potatoes and to open kiosk.

loans.name: Nalule Harriet Group

texts.en:
Harriet N. is 30 years of age and married with four children. She rents a two-room house in which six people are leaving. She has access to piped water and electricity and the family has three meals a day.

Harriet runs a salon and that is how she earns her living. She rents the shop that houses her salon. She receives over 15 customers a day and all of them are woman. She has done this kind of business for over seven years now. The only challenge she faces is that her salon is a bit hidden from customers as it's not along the way. So she is not satisfied with the location of her salon and hopes to move it to a busier place.

She has been with MCDT for over three years now and the reason why she chose MCDT is because the loans are not delayed when requested. She has been with her group for three years. She will use this loan to buy more braids for plaiting hair. She also wants to shift the location of her salon to a busier place to increase on the number of clients she gets a day, which will increase her income.

loans.use: To buy braids to use in her salon.
